""Hi, Uncle Zeke. It's ... good to see you,"" Gabe said as he shook his uncle's hand. He appreciated the handshake. Not only did it make him feel older, it wasn't as messy as hugs and hair mussing. He stood around quietly and smiled. It was good to be a part of all this happiness and reunion, and he didn't know what was going to happen when it was time to leave. To be plain, he was excited.

""C'mon, guys,"" Rina said to the two boys and gently began herding them to the mule. ""I smelled waffles and sausage. Wanna see if I'm right?""

Rina stayed on the ground to board the mule last, so as to give everyone else their choice of seats. The boys might want to sit together and catch up--Lordy, but Chris was getting big!--and of course, Kiera and Ezekiel might want to go side by side. If anyone wanted to ride shotgun, they'd have first crack at it.

Kiera crawls in with Ezekiel.  ""Food ho!"" she cheerfully cries.  ""I can smell it from here.""

Nika simply laughed. Once everyone was aboard, she put the vehicle in gear and went straight back to the main house, where breakfast was waiting. On the way there, she updated Kiera and Ezekiel on the random family stuff that had gone on since they were last home. Mama Johannsen was down with the flu this week, but it hadn't stopped her yesterday from telling Larry's youngest brother Jacob that if he married that floozy down the way -- and ""down the way"" was three spreads over from the massive Earhart/Johannsen combined spreads -- she'd beat him upside the head with his own boot.

That was Madge Johannsen for you. She wasn't letting her boys marry no floozies!

""And then you got all the town gossip,"" Nika smirked. ""One of our hands knocked up the Shepherd's daughter over in town and maaaaaaaaan, that was all the rage for a few weeks. Now they're all married up right and proper, but it meant that for like three weeks straight, we had that Shepherd out here preachin' fire and brimstone on Paul Nguyen's head."" She rolled her eyes, just laughing as she drives. ""I was never so glad to see a Shepherd go the hell away!""

It's not a long drive and by the time the vehicle pulls up to the main yard at the house, Larry Johannsen (Nika's brother-in-law), Nate, and the ranch hands who knew the visitors from years past were there to help greet and carry overnight bags where they needed to go so that everyone could visit and get settled.

((OOC: Just seemed like it might help if we got us actually to the house where people can all interact more freely!))

Nala's farmhouse had been added to over the years as marriages and children raised the number of seats at the dining table. A section of the wraparound porch was enclosed to make a dining room big enough for the immediate family and their guests. A door leading to the porch made it convenient to pass from one to the other. Rina held it open as Nika ushered the others inside where food and drink waited aplenty. 

She gave the teen boys a wink as they passed through and stepped inside herself. Rina detoured into the kitchen and stuck her head in cautiously. 

""BJ,"" she called loud enough to be heard over the work going on but low enough not to startle someone working with a knife. ""Do you need a hand in here?""

Truth to tell, she doubted BJ would need her help but she couldn't deny that despite her outwardly relaxed bearing, her inner paranoia was starting to spin worst case scenrios and the distraction of doing something useful would do her good.

""I've got it covered."" BJ says, even as he begins wheeling out a cart piled with bowls, a griddle, and several egg cartons.

Once the cart's been positioned and the griddle plugged into the wall socket, he detours for a moment to bring out everything else. Sausages. Toast. Waffles. All of it brought out with efficiency and set upon the large family table.

""Start on that lot, when you're ready come see me for omelettes. If they aren't the best you've ever had I'll make more until they are.""

""All right,"" Rina acquiesced and joined the others at the table. There were coffee and tea available and even a carafe of juice. She made sure the kids were served first, encouraging them to pile up and dig in, before getting her own plate of sausage and toast. As she got her tea, she hailed BJ. ""I'll take one with mushrooms and extra spinach, thank you.""

Leafy greens weren't her favorite but she knew she'd be better for eating them.

Kiera watched the cook, her eyes narrowed and appraising as she ordered her everything omelette.  The waffles had been a delight and the sausages sublime.  Biting her lip, she took folded piece of gold once he had handed it to her and settled back in her seat to eat it.  He had made the omelette with skill, not letting the eggs get overly cooked, added the other ingredients with a finesse that she hadn't enjoyed in far too long.  She sat for a moment, inhaling the promise and then cut into it.

After a forkful, she stood and strode over to the man, still at work on the rest of the orders, eyeing him until he looked up at her.

""Well,"" she stated, her green eyes cool and serious, ""you coming with us on the ship?  Cus' if you ain't, well. . .""  She shrugged and let the sentence linger unfinished.

""... then you'll have to eat whatever can be scrounged up by whomever has time for the galley?"" BJ asks with a faint smile. He finishes an order, sliding the half circle of golden goodness onto a plate, then hands it over.

""I admit, I've never cooked on a ship before. Might be interesting. How likely am I to be killed because you pissed someone off?""

Kiera smiled then, lighting up like a flare from a ship.  ""Oh that won't be a worry.  If anyone looked at you cross-eyed with you cooking like that, they wouldn't have long to live.""

Pausing to pull a lick of ginger hair from her eyes, she shrugged.  ""Just to be honest tho, I tend to piss off everybody."". She thrust out her hand.  ""I'm Kiera.""

Looks like Nala's gonna need a new cook ...

Rina rose and stepped up to the cart to receive her omelet and of course, caught the last half of the conversation. Leaning forward to accept her plate from BJ, she added, ""They wouldn't. She does. And I'd seriously consider her offer. Thanks,"" she added with a wink.

BJs omelets were glorious and if there was a way to get Rina to eat cooked spinach, BJ's was the only cooked spinach she trusted down her gullet.

Ezekiel could see his wife at work, doing one of the things she did best - poaching other people's talent. Seventy-five percent of the time it worked out, twenty-five percent of the time it put them in deep trouble. If he was being honest, that was probably about the right ratio for everything the two of them did together. Hopefully this would be in the seventy-five percent of things. 

But now it was time to steer things to serious business. It was a comfortable role for him, since he filled that position on the Exeter too. 

""Don't anyone stop eating, please. Food's too good for that."" Especially if they were going to be back in the black before long. ""But when we get a moment, I would like to start getting a handle on what the emergency is. Rina's wave was...sparse.""

Gabe was busy engaging in one of his favorite hobbies: eating. At a meal like this, he knew he could score thirds and even fourths if he could stomach it. Seconds were well under way at this point.

He'd been waiting weeks now to find out what was really going on, and he tried to be as invisible and as silent as he could, so that all the details would come to light. He knew that if anyone remembered he was here, they'd be censoring themselves or using code, and that would be a failure. He'd have to come up with counter-arguments for why he shouldn't be on the ship, and he couldn't do that without all the information he could absorb.

Nika put her fork down, swallowing the last bite of her breakfast before answering. Pushing her plate forward just a bit, she leaned her elbows on the table and drew her coffee closer to that she could drink it while answering. She shot a grin at BJ, murmuring, ""Nala's gonna have my head."" Cuz it's a given that if he wants to go with, she isn't going to say no. She's spoiled by dirtside cookin'! But she turned her attention to the more serious issue.

""Beggar's Wave was pretty sparse too -- deliberately so. The text of what he sent is what bothered us. He was 'glad to hear we were having a party for Arden' and he'd join us at the planet for it. Signed, Beglan Shea, PhD. You know how he felt about that title,"" she replied, casting a glance at Kiera. ""So as much as I hate to drag everyone home for trouble... I think maybe we got some trouble.""

There's a slight shrug and she raises her coffee cup to drink from it. ""If it turns out to be nothin', that's all well and good. But... I got the prickle at the back of my neck that's saying he wouldn't have invoked Arden's name *and* his title if he weren't hip-deep in horse manure and needs help.""

But she turned her attention to the more serious issue.</p><p>""Beggar's Wave was pretty sparse too -- deliberately so. The text of what he sent is what bothered us. He was 'glad to hear we were having a party for Arden' and he'd join us at the planet for it. Signed, Beglan Shea, PhD. You know how he felt about that title,"" she replied, casting a glance at Kiera. ""So as much as I hate to drag everyone home for trouble... I think maybe we got some trouble.""</p><p>There's a slight shrug and she raises her coffee cup to drink from it. ""If it turns out to be nothin', that's all well and good. But... I got the prickle at the back of my neck that's saying he wouldn't have invoked Arden's name *and* his title if he weren't hip-deep in horse manure and needs help.""</p>

With a short snort, Kiera smiled lightly.  ""Well invoking ghosts definitely gets my attention.""

She spun her empty coffee cup around, twirling it absently, her brows meeting as she glanced at her husband.  

Do we go?  Do we take the boy?  

She felt a pang of guilt even thinking the questions.  They had Quentin.  But they couldn't ignore a plea for help, especially from Beggar.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>With a short snort, Kiera smiled lightly.  ""Well invoking ghosts definitely gets my attention.""</p><p>She spun her empty coffee cup around, twirling it absently, her brows meeting as she glanced at her husband.  </p><p><em>Do we go?  Do we take the boy?  </em></p><p>She felt a pang of guilt even thinking the questions.  They had Quentin.  But they couldn't ignore a plea for help, especially from Beggar.</p><div><em><br></em></div>

After so many years together, Ezekiel had gotten quite good at interpreting his wife's gestures and looks. This one was easier because he was almost certainly thinking the same things she was. Being a parent was a large responsibility and one of their most important. But it by no means was their only one. Another signpost along the road...

""The Exeter and the Drake family are at your service, Nika."" He said it simply and firmly, like there was no other way it would have played out. He worried about Chris, of course, as did Kiera, but helping out family was everyone's responsibility.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>After so many years together, Ezekiel had gotten quite good at interpreting his wife's gestures and looks. This one was easier because he was almost certainly thinking the same things she was. Being a parent was a large responsibility and one of their most important. But it by no means was their only one. <em>Another signpost along the road...</em></p><p>""The Exeter and the Drake family are at your service, Nika."" He said it simply and firmly, like there was no other way it would have played out. He worried about Chris, of course, as did Kiera, but helping out family was everyone's responsibility.</p>

It was irrational, but whenever Ezekiel used that tone, she knew they could take on the Universe.

Looking at her friends, Kiera raised an eyebrow.  ""So where and when ladies?  We can load up pretty quick but y'all ain't said where exactly.  I can guess but,""she shrugged, ""maybe we can see the wave?  And God forbid, make a plan?""

She leaned back in her chair with a wry grin. ""You know, so once everything goes balls up, we'll have a measurement of how bad?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>It was irrational, but whenever Ezekiel used that tone, she knew they could take on the Universe.</em></p><p>Looking at her friends, Kiera raised an eyebrow.  ""So where and when ladies?  We can load up pretty quick but y'all ain't said where exactly.  I can guess but,""she shrugged, ""maybe we can see the wave?  And God forbid, make a plan?""</p><p>She leaned back in her chair with a wry grin. ""You know, so once everything goes balls up, we'll have a measurement of how bad?""</p>

""As the Russian at the table, I anticipated that,"" Rina said, pulling her data book from her back pocket. She flipped it open, tapped the screen, and spun up the Wave. She passed it to Kiera. ""Your measurement, ma'am. As requested.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""As the Russian at the table, I anticipated that,"" Rina said, pulling her data book from her back pocket. She flipped it open, tapped the screen, and spun up the Wave. She passed it to Kiera. ""Your measurement, ma'am. As requested.""</p>

Kiera got up to go to her husband's seat so that they could read it together.  Once done, she handed the data book back to Rina.  

""Well that's damn cold to drop that name considerin'."" she said softly, thinking a thousand curses in Chinese that weren't table polite. ""So Sophia by July.  Wonder what the bloody hells is going on?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiera got up to go to her husband's seat so that they could read it together.  Once done, she handed the data book back to Rina.  </p><p>""Well that's damn cold to drop that name considerin'."" she said softly, thinking a thousand curses in Chinese that weren't table polite. ""So Sophia by July.  Wonder what the bloody hells is going on?""</p>

""Don't know."" Rina said quietly and slipped her book back in her pocket.""Whatever it is, he thought it justified using an anonymizer to muddy up his message trail. I've tried for two weeks now and I can't dig out the origination point for the wave beyond system and planet. Who or what would convince him to go to that kind of trouble?""

Rina crossed her arms on the table and frowned at the remains of her breakfast before addressing the group again.

""Nothing good, I'm sure ""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Don't know."" Over at the omelette station, BJ Long's hands are busy returning fixings to their proper containers so as to facilitate their storage in the cold box. When Rina mentions anonymizers and origination points, the corners of his mouth tug into a faint smile before he wheels the whole cart back into the kitchen.

When Rina mentions anonymizers and origination points, the corners of his mouth tug into a faint smile before he wheels the whole cart back into the kitchen.</p>

Gabe wanted to stay silent but his curiosity got the better of him.

""Wait, you gathered everyone here to go out in the black because someone signed their wave funny?"" he asked. ""I mean, it's nice to see all of you, but still ... three letters warrants a full army?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Gabe wanted to stay silent but his curiosity got the better of him.</p><p>""Wait, you gathered everyone here to go out in the black because someone signed their wave funny?"" he asked. ""I mean, it's nice to see all of you, but still ... three letters warrants a full army?""</p>

Gabe's response makes Nate have to smother a bark of laughter. When Nika shot him a look that was half-amused, half-""Heynow!"", he burst into chuckles and had to push his chair back from the table to go refill his coffee mug. 

Nika rolled her blue eyes at him and then couldn't help her own chuckles. ""Gabe... before we all lived here on the ranch, life wasn't quite so straightforward,"" she tells her 'nephew.' ""Some things I think you only really understand when you live them. But when you fly with the right crew, it becomes family. If this were Uncle Jacob callin' us  talkin' about a person we knew was dead, wouldn't you be worried?""

She has to rethink that a moment, and then shrugs. ""Jacob's probably not a good example. I swear if it weren't for bad luck, that is one Johannsen who'd have no luck at all,"" she commented wryly.

She smiled slightly at Gabe, something passing behind her eyes that was more sad than anything else. ""Beggar wouldn't have put Arden's name in a message if he weren't going for shock value. To get our attention. And he always told us if he ever used his PhD title, it would mean there was trouble with a capital T. And so... yeah... it warrants a posse and a bit of alarm. If it turns out to be nothin', then it's just a flight in the black for old times' sake. But if it is somethin' and we didn't go and he needed us... we would never forgive ourselves.""

Some things, you just did. Showing up when family called was one of them, something they'd instilled in all of the children as well.

When Nika shot him a look that was half-amused, half-""Heynow!"", he burst into chuckles and had to push his chair back from the table to go refill his coffee mug. </p><p>Nika rolled her blue eyes at him and then couldn't help her own chuckles. But when you fly with the <em>right</em> crew, it becomes family. ""Jacob's probably not a good example. If it turns out to be nothin', then it's just a flight in the black for old times' sake. But if it <em>is</em> somethin' and we didn't go and he needed us... we would never forgive ourselves.""</p><p>Some things, you just <em>did.</em> Showing up when family called was one of them, something they'd instilled in all of the children as well.</p>

""Sometimes the Lord gives us the large signs, but other times all we get are the small ones. You learn to pay attention to both, Gabriel.""

Ezekiel looked over in Nika's direction. ""July gives us some leeway time. Nika, are you going to want to take command of the Exeter for this trip? If so, we may want to use some of that time to get you up to speed on changes.""

In Ezekiel's mind, it didn't matter who captained the ship. What did matter was making it clear up front.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Sometimes the Lord gives us the large signs, but other times all we get are the small ones. You learn to pay attention to both, Gabriel.""</p><p>Ezekiel looked over in Nika's direction. ""July gives us some leeway time. Nika, are you going to want to take command of the Exeter for this trip? If so, we may want to use some of that time to get you up to speed on changes.""</p><p>In Ezekiel's mind, it didn't matter who captained the ship. What did matter was making it clear up front.</p>

A single blonde brow quirks over her eye at the query, and Nika studies the man who asked the question thoughtfully for a long moment. Over the years on the ground, the drawl that once peeped out only when she was really upset or deliberately messing with someone has become more or less common in her speech, though it's not a deep drawl. That still only shows up when she's being a mite tetchy or seriously messing with you.


That telltale signal of sarcasm is definitely not in her reply. ""Nope,"" she replies succinctly. ""You want me to pilot our girl for you, I'm thrilled. But the Exeter is your ship, Captain Drake -- she don't need me anymore and I ain't got a hankering to take on that role. Thanks for the offer, though.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A single blonde brow quirks over her eye at the query, and Nika studies the man who asked the question thoughtfully for a long moment. Over the years on the ground, the drawl that once peeped out only when she was really upset or deliberately messing with someone has become more or less common in her speech, though it's not a deep drawl. That still only shows up when she's being a mite tetchy or seriously messing with you.</p><p><br>That telltale signal of sarcasm is definitely not in her reply. ""Nope,"" she replies succinctly. ""You want me to pilot our girl for you, I'm thrilled. But the <em>Exeter</em> is your ship, Captain Drake -- she don't need me anymore and I ain't got a hankering to take on that role. Thanks for the offer, though.""</p>
Two day countdown until we clos this thread and move on.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Two day countdown until we clos this thread and move on.</p>

Rina kept a discreet eye on Gabe as first Nika and Ezekiel responded to his question. She knew his hunger for information was just as voracious as his body's was for fuel and she thought his had been a reasonable question to ask. She hadn't elaborated much on Beglan's subterfuge and yet Gabe had managed to elicit a detail she'd omitted. 

""Otlichnaya rabota, Gabriel,"" she murmured loud enough for his ears only as she pulled the platter of bacon and sausage closer to him. She knew he'd catch her meaning: Good work.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rina kept a discreet eye on Gabe as first Nika and Ezekiel responded to his question. She knew his hunger for information was just as voracious as his body's was for fuel and she thought his had been a reasonable question to ask. She hadn't elaborated much on Beglan's subterfuge and yet Gabe had managed to elicit a detail she'd omitted. </p><p>""<a href=""https://translate.google.com/?hl=en#en/ru/great%20job"">Otlichnaya rabota</a>, Gabriel,"" she murmured loud enough for his ears only as she pulled the platter of bacon and sausage closer to him. She knew he'd catch her meaning: <em>Good work.</em></p>

Ezekiel nodded. He would have missed captaining the Exeter. But he had spent many years wandering wherever the Verse and the Lord took him. He trusted that the Lord would put him in the right place. 

""Given the option, I wouldn't have anyone else piloting her, Nika."" He and Kiera could obviously fly the Exeter, but they were both solid at best. He hadn't had the chance to see her in person, but Kiera had described Nika's piloting as ""gorram exquisite"".

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Ezekiel nodded. He would have missed captaining the Exeter. But he had spent many years wandering wherever the Verse and the Lord took him. He trusted that the Lord would put him in the right place. </p><p>""Given the option, I wouldn't have anyone else piloting her, Nika."" He and Kiera could obviously fly the Exeter, but they were both solid at best. He hadn't had the chance to see her in person, but Kiera had described Nika's piloting as ""gorram exquisite"".</p>

""Uncle Drake,"" Gabe said after rapidly swallowing his food. ""Can I go on this mission? I mean, do you have a space for me? I know my skills aren't the best, being young and all, but I'll give it my all ...""

Gabe paused for a moment, realizing he'd forgotten something ... what was it ...

""Oh, yeah, my cat would be coming along. Mugen.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Uncle Drake,"" Gabe said after rapidly swallowing his food. ""Can I go on this mission? I mean, do you have a space for me? I know my skills aren't the best, being young and all, but I'll give it my all ...""</p><p>Gabe paused for a moment, realizing he'd forgotten something ... what was it ...</p><p>""Oh, yeah, my cat would be coming along. Mugen.""</p>

Ezekiel looked directly at Gabriel, giving him his full attention. This was an adult request coming from his nephew. Gabe, much like Chris, currently straddled the space between child and adult. Ezekiel had been forced early on in his life to make the jump to adult faster, leaving his home behind before he was fifteen. But he felt he had been better off for it. If Gabe was adult enough to ask, then he was adult enough to come along. 

""Gabriel, you are welcome aboard the Exeter. You and Chris can serve as stewards during the journey."" He then looked over to Rina. ""Assuming your mother gives her permission.""

He paused for a second, considering the cat. They had never had a cat during his captaincy, but that wasn't deliberate. Just how things ended up. Perhaps another place for Gabriel to demonstrate responsibility.

""A ship's interior is unpredictable, full of places for a cat to hide. It would also be a dramatic change for an animal used to the outdoors. If you take those facts into account and still feel comfortable taking care of your cat on board, then I have no problem with it."" And he didn't...but he wanted to make sure his nephew had all the facts before making the decision.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Ezekiel looked directly at Gabriel, giving him his full attention. This was an adult request coming from his nephew. Gabe, much like Chris, currently straddled the space between child and adult. Ezekiel had been forced early on in his life to make the jump to adult faster, leaving his home behind before he was fifteen. But he felt he had been better off for it. Perhaps another place for Gabriel to demonstrate responsibility.</p><p>""A ship's interior is unpredictable, full of places for a cat to hide. It would also be a dramatic change for an animal used to the outdoors. If you take those facts into account and still feel comfortable taking care of your cat on board, then I have no problem with it."" And he didn't...but he wanted to make sure his nephew had all the facts before making the decision.</p>

""Permission granted,"" Rina said without a hint of mockery or irony. She was proud of Gabriel advocating for himself on his own initiative and she was privately glad she didn't have to arrange it with Ezekiel and Kiera for him. She allowed her pride to show a little in the look she slid Gabriel's way. Nothing overt, so as to avoid embarrassing him, but he would feel the glow of her approval nonetheless.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Permission granted,"" Rina said without a hint of mockery or irony. She was proud of Gabriel advocating for himself on his own initiative and she was privately glad she didn't have to arrange it with Ezekiel and Kiera for him. She allowed her pride to show a little in the look she slid Gabriel's way. Nothing overt, so as to avoid embarrassing him, but he would feel the glow of her approval nonetheless. </p>

Gabe had been prepared to be shut down, turned away, or otherwise told no. He barely swallowed his food in time to yell, ""Thanks, Uncle Drake! Thanks, mom!"" He started cleaning his dishes as fast as he could, because he wanted to run back to his room and start packing.

column4: Stars Without Number: Vessels of Gold and Silver Campaign

The Promise arrives in the Aspor Transition Zone six days after it landed at its hour-long stop in Rivozar. Two drills has tapped out the fuel and while there is enough for intrasteller travel, she won't be able to make another drill without refueling.

Sensors indicate Aspor is three regions away, or about two weeks. There is a starship in the region, on a course toward the Transition Zone about 6 hours away. There is no transmission signal coming from it, and the ship is not registered in the ship's computer.

Region: Aspor001.366.187

Source 1: Unknown Class Starship, [UNREGISTERED], Status: [No Active Scans]

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-279237""><div class=""row"">
Sean heads up to the bridge after the Promise docks in Rivozar.  ""Any chance I have time to stretch my legs?  I'm getting some serious cabin fever here.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sean heads up to the bridge after the <em>Promise</em> docks in Rivozar.  ""Any chance I have time to stretch my legs?  I'm getting some serious cabin fever here.""</p>

Sid Merton has been spending the intervening time in study, trying to learn how to better operate the scanners and conduct basic shipboard repairs. He's been pretty quiet lately too, recalling the 'indignity' of his efforts to help out with PsiAuth.

""I sure hope we can find some fuel somewhere on Asapor, or it's going to be a loooong trip home."" He has his customary seat at the comms and sensors. ""I have another ship on scanner, it's not doing anything hostile, but I can't imagine why it would be out here.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid Merton has been spending the intervening time in study, trying to learn how to better operate the scanners and conduct basic shipboard repairs. He's been pretty quiet lately too, recalling the 'indignity' of his efforts to help out with PsiAuth.</p><p>""I sure hope we can find some fuel somewhere on Asapor, or it's going to be a loooong trip home."" He has his customary seat at the comms and sensors. ""I have another ship on scanner, it's not doing anything hostile, but I can't imagine why it would be out here.""</p>

Satisfied with his modest medical resources, Elias disconnects his datapad from the console and walks toward the bridge, his nose buried deep in sensor logs and treatises on extreme cold exposure treatments. He practically bumps into the airlock before looking up at the last second to press the open key.

Stepping onto the bridge, he gives the workstations a once-over before leaning against a rail. ""How's it looking out there?"", nudging his chin toward the viewer, ""No more unexpected company, I hope.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Satisfied with his modest medical resources, Elias disconnects his datapad from the console and walks toward the bridge, his nose buried deep in sensor logs and treatises on extreme cold exposure treatments. He practically bumps into the airlock before looking up at the last second to press the open key.</p><p>Stepping onto the bridge, he gives the workstations a once-over before leaning against a rail. ""How's it looking out there?"", nudging his chin toward the viewer, ""No more unexpected company, I hope.""</p>
As the unidentified ship closes in it becomes clear that it has no propulsion and is perhaps drifting. There are no signals coming from it, however your sensors cannot detect anything past the hull.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>As the unidentified ship closes in it becomes clear that it has no propulsion and is perhaps drifting. There are no signals coming from it, however your sensors cannot detect anything past the hull.</p>

""It seems I may get to stretch my legs after all.  Let's go take a look, shall we?""  Sean heads off to get suited up, mentally checking off the steps for boarding a drifting ship as he goes.

On comms, ""Who else is coming with?  Doc?  There might be injured over there.  Sid, maybe you could check thru the ship's records from their side?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""It seems I may get to stretch my legs after all.  Let's go take a look, shall we?""  Sean heads off to get suited up, mentally checking off the steps for boarding a drifting ship as he goes.</p><p>On comms, ""Who else is coming with?  Doc?  There might be injured over there.  Sid, maybe you could check thru the ship's records from their side?""</p>

""You know, I'm not too fond of vacuum and I don't know how much help I'd be out there anyway. I'll keep our ship close and prepare to scoop you up if needed.""

Clovis sets the Promise's transmitter to an open frequency and directs a signal towards the silent ship, ""This is the FMV Promise. If there is anyone aboard the ship, please respond.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""You know, I'm not too fond of vacuum and I don't know how much help I'd be out there anyway. I'll keep our ship close and prepare to scoop you up if needed.""</p><p>Clovis sets the Promise's transmitter to an open frequency and directs a signal towards the silent ship, ""This is the FMV Promise. If there is anyone aboard the ship, please respond.""</p>

There is no response to Clovis' transmission.

After Sean suits up and Clovis navigates Promise to align with the drifting vessel, he exits the airlock. The vastness of space expands beyond, and ahead Sean can make it a dim red star in the distance, Aspor.

WIth safety harnesses in place, Sean leaps from the Promise and floats several meters before colliding with the dark vessel. He makes is way to the airlock and sees that the panel is inert and inaccessible. The airlock door will need to be opened manually.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>There is no response to Clovis' transmission.</p><p>After Sean suits up and Clovis navigates <em>Promise</em> to align with the drifting vessel, he exits the airlock. The vastness of space expands beyond, and ahead Sean can make it a dim red star in the distance, Aspor.</p><p>WIth safety harnesses in place, Sean leaps from the <em>Promise</em> and floats several meters before colliding with the dark vessel. He makes is way to the airlock and sees that the panel is inert and inaccessible. The airlock door will need to be opened manually.</p>

Sid stops wool gathering, picks up his data slab, and suits up to join Sean in his exploration of the derelict. If there is a way they can get its systems online, maybe he can help find out who sent it. He his own safety harness and moves to join Sean.

“Any ideas on how to get in?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid stops wool gathering, picks up his data slab, and suits up to join Sean in his exploration of the derelict. If there is a way they can get its systems online, maybe he can help find out who sent it. He his own safety harness and moves to join Sean.</p><p>“Any ideas on how to get in?”</p>
Elias finishes donning his vacc suit, checking each system and readout thoroughly. Med kit gripped firmly in his gloved hand and tether affixed, Elias nods to Sean and Sid. ""After you, gentlemen.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Elias finishes donning his vacc suit, checking each system and readout thoroughly. Med kit gripped firmly in his gloved hand and tether affixed, Elias nods to Sean and Sid. ""After you, gentlemen.""</p>

""Sid, maybe check if you can power the panel using your dataslab?  I must confess I do not know how most of this stuff works.""  Sean steps back to check his tools yet again.  Grinning, Sean turns to Elias, ""How about you keep a third eye out?  I don't think our employers would be too happy if we were caught unaware by some scrappers or pirates and couldn't even get to Aspor.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Sid, maybe check if you can power the panel using your dataslab?  I must confess I do not know how most of this stuff works.""  Sean steps back to check his tools yet again.  Grinning, Sean turns to Elias, ""How about you keep a third eye out?  I don't think our employers would be too happy if we were caught unaware by some scrappers or pirates and couldn't even get to Aspor."" </p>
""Understood."" Elias pauses his gate and closes his eyes, lowering his mental walls just a crack to extend his telepathy beyond his helmet, beyond the airlock, seeking the minds beyond the bulkhead.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Understood."" Elias pauses his gate and closes his eyes, lowering his mental walls just a crack to extend his telepathy beyond his helmet, beyond the airlock, seeking the minds beyond the bulkhead.</p>

The effort is straining. A sliver of pain cuts across Elias' mind like a knife wound, and for a moment, as blood rushes to his head, he sees red. After a few short breaths the sensation passes. He cannot tell through the psionic spike if there is anyone aboard or not.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The effort is straining. A sliver of pain cuts across Elias' mind like a knife wound, and for a moment, as blood rushes to his head, he sees red. After a few short breaths the sensation passes. He cannot tell through the psionic spike if there is anyone aboard or not.</p>

Elias gasps and grits his teeth, letting out a pained moan as he steadies himself against the bulkhead.

""It...seems our run-in with the bloodhounds taxed me more than I realized.""

After a few moments, the pain begins to subside and he stands straight again. He'd like nothing more than to massage his temples, to ease the tension, but his vacc suit prevents him from attending to his usual meditations. He shakes his head to clear the last of the fog from his vision.

""I'll be fine. We should proceed.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Elias gasps and grits his teeth, letting out a pained moan as he steadies himself against the bulkhead.</p><p>""It...seems our run-in with the bloodhounds taxed me more than I realized.""</p><p>After a few moments, the pain begins to subside and he stands straight again. He'd like nothing more than to massage his temples, to ease the tension, but his vacc suit prevents him from attending to his usual meditations. He shakes his head to clear the last of the fog from his vision.</p><p>""I'll be fine. We should proceed.""</p>

Sid looks at Elias with some concern, but takes his word that he is fine.

“It’s ok Elias, take it easy for a sec.”

Sid opens a panel near the door, and connects his metapaf to the circuitry. “Let’s see if we can let ourselves in.”
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid looks at Elias with some concern, but takes his word that he is fine.</p><p>“It’s ok Elias, take it easy for a sec.”</p><p>Sid opens a panel near the door, and connects his metapaf to the circuitry. “Let’s see if we can let ourselves in.”</p>

Sid is able to reroute power from the metapaf just quickly enough to activate the airlock and open it. The same maneuver closes the spacewalkers inside and opens the interior airlock. 

The ship is completely dark and without artificial gravity. The cargo bay is in disarray, supplies floating through as if they were litter in the ocean.

The walls, floor, and panels are entirely covered in a thick layer of ice.

Just ahead, the ship's primary corridor is open, leading to the interior beyond.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid is able to reroute power from the metapaf just quickly enough to activate the airlock and open it. The same maneuver closes the spacewalkers inside and opens the interior airlock. </p><p>The ship is completely dark and without artificial gravity. The cargo bay is in disarray, supplies floating through as if they were litter in the ocean.</p><p>The walls, floor, and panels are entirely covered in a thick layer of ice.</p><p>Just ahead, the ship's primary corridor is open, leading to the interior beyond.</p>
Sean pulls his laser pistol and moves in to the lead.  ""Any idea which way to the bridge?  Maybe we can get life support back online before checking out the rest of the ship.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sean pulls his laser pistol and moves in to the lead.  ""Any idea which way to the bridge?  Maybe we can get life support back online before checking out the rest of the ship.""</p>

A quick look around from the cargo bay reveals that it is likely located in the aft of the ship. The engine room is beneath them, accessible through a hatch in the floor. The corridor ahead is the only way in or out, apart from that. Having viewed it from the outside, it would make sense that the corridor goes to the bridge directly and has cabins on either side of it.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A quick look around from the cargo bay reveals that it is likely located in the aft of the ship. The engine room is beneath them, accessible through a hatch in the floor. The corridor ahead is the only way in or out, apart from that. Having viewed it from the outside, it would make sense that the corridor goes to the bridge directly and has cabins on either side of it.</p>

Sid nods in agreement with Sean. “That makes sense, let’s get to the bridge first to see if we can restore power from there. If It’s just shut down or a computer error I can fix it, but if it’s anything mechanical...” he shakes his head. 

He starts to move cautiously in the direction of the cockpit.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid nods in agreement with Sean. “That makes sense, let’s get to the bridge first to see if we can restore power from there. If It’s just shut down or a computer error I can fix it, but if it’s anything mechanical...” he shakes his head. </p><p>He starts to move cautiously in the direction of the cockpit.</p>

Elias looks over his shoulder as the airlock slams shut. Trapped. I ought to have seen that coming. He fiddles around on his suit's control panel and activates the flashlight on his wrist lighting the way forward. He sets the medical case on the floor and retrieves a bio scanner from a sleeve affixed to his belt, scanning quickly for pathogens and life signs.

""I recommend we move cautiously. I'll keep an eye on the scanner for biological signatures."" He picks up the medical case again and follows behind Sid.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Elias looks over his shoulder as the airlock slams shut. <em>Trapped. I ought to have seen that coming.</em> He fiddles around on his suit's control panel and activates the flashlight on his wrist lighting the way forward. He sets the medical case on the floor and retrieves a bio scanner from a sleeve affixed to his belt, scanning quickly for pathogens and life signs.</p><p>""I recommend we move cautiously. I'll keep an eye on the scanner for biological signatures."" He picks up the medical case again and follows behind Sid.</p>

The crew of the Promise float cautiously through the corridor ahead. The bridge is 15 meters ahead--more of a cockpit than a bridge--with room enough for two at the helm. Even from a distance it can be determined the instruments are antiquated, using very old post-Scream technology.

To the right of the corridor is a small mess cabin, which appears to be fully-stocked but completely frozen over. To the left is a cabin with three bunks, small storage and a cryogenic chamber installed vertically into the hold. From their close proximity, they can see a human male preserved inside.

Elias' scanners pick up a living organism in stasis. The man is alive and medically well.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The crew of the <em>Promise</em> float cautiously through the corridor ahead. The bridge is 15 meters ahead--more of a cockpit than a bridge--with room enough for two at the helm. Even from a distance it can be determined the instruments are antiquated, using very old post-Scream technology.</p><p> To the right of the corridor is a small mess cabin, which appears to be fully-stocked but completely frozen over. To the left is a cabin with three bunks, small storage and a cryogenic chamber installed vertically into the hold. From their close proximity, they can see a human male preserved inside.</p><p>Elias' scanners pick up a living organism in stasis. The man is alive and medically well.</p>

""There's...there's something here. Human, male, well-preserved given all of this."" He motions a hand indicating their frozen over dead surroundings. He looks around the stasis chamber assessing its construction and looking for any informational read-outs.

""Who are you, ice man? How did you end up out here?"" he muses to himself.

Elias looks back at Sid and Sean. ""Perhaps you two can investigate the bridge while I learn more about our new friend here.""

Sean seems reluctant to split-up but since Elias seems certain, he nods his head and goes with Sid to the bridge.  Once there, Sean makes sure the room is secure before heading off to check out the other cabins, looking for any supplies and any info on the ship's purpose.

""Come on, Lady Luck, let's get ourselves a new sniper rifle!""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sean seems reluctant to split-up but since Elias seems certain, he nods his head and goes with Sid to the bridge.  Once there, Sean makes sure the room is secure before heading off to check out the other cabins, looking for any supplies and any info on the ship's purpose.</p><p>""Come on, Lady Luck, let's get ourselves a new sniper rifle!""</p>

On the bridge, Sid cracks open his metapad, hoping he can find some way to link it to the ship’s ancient equipment. “Never know what you’re going to find on a scavenging run” he mumbles to himself as he gets to work. “I sure hope Elias can help that poor bastard. Let’s see if I can figure out when he was doing all the way out here, and what happened to the ship.”

Let’s see if I can figure out when he was doing all the way out here, and what happened to the ship.”</p>

Sean finds a storage cabinet off to the side fo the bridge that holds a shotgun, box of ammo, vacc suit, compad, and med kit--all frozen over. The cabin across from the cryo chamber and bunks, was a mess hall. There are 10 boxes of preserved rations, and cookware. The bunks are largely empty, save for a locked personal crate and a toolkit. The cryogenics chamber is positioned vertically in the wall and is still carrying power. Elias is in there trying to access the data input.

On the bridge, Sid finds a way to pair the metapad with the ship's computer. It uses an old protocol, but the metapad locates an unsupported driver to uplink. The computer was in stasis and the uplink forces it to reboot. Suddenly power flickers on in the ship and the cryogenic chamber begins beeping. A green light on the panel of the chamber switches to yellow.

On the comm the crew here's Jezerin from inside The Promise.


""Not sure if you'd be alarmed by this, but your uplink just patched me an inventory. That puppy's got some nuclear warheads in its weapons bay. And this guy is about 250 years old.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>On the comm the crew here's Jezerin from inside <em>The Promise.</em></p><p><em><br></em></p><p>""Not sure if you'd be alarmed by this, but your uplink just patched me an inventory. That puppy's got some nuclear warheads in its weapons bay. And this guy is about 250 years old.""</p>

Sean grabs the shotgun, ammo, compad, and med kit, digging them out carefully from the rime.   He bundles it all up with the toolkit, wraps it in a blanket, then secures it to the personal crate.

On comms, ""I am going to move some stuff over to the Promise.  Yell if you need help.  Actually, doc, do you think it would be safer to try to transfer the cryo chamber to our ship before thawing the meat popsicle?""

After storing the locked crate and the other goods back on the Promise, Sean heads back to see Elias' progress.  The ship's eerie silence makes Sean check his corners twice.  Sean is absolutely sure if something jumped out at him now he would be cleaning his vac suit for a week.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sean grabs the shotgun, ammo, compad, and med kit, digging them out carefully from the rime.   He bundles it all up with the toolkit, wraps it in a blanket, then secures it to the personal crate.</p><p>On comms, ""I am going to move some stuff over to the <em>Promise.</em>  Yell if you need help.  Actually, doc, do you think it would be safer to try to transfer the cryo chamber to our ship before thawing the meat popsicle?""</p><p>After storing the locked crate and the other goods back on the <em>Promise</em>, Sean heads back to see Elias' progress.  The ship's eerie silence makes Sean check his corners twice.  Sean is absolutely sure if something jumped out at him now he would be cleaning his vac suit for a week.</p>

""Stand by on that, Mr. Andes. I don't know if this chamber is stable enough to be moved. I need a little more time with this relic."" Elias combs over the controls, wiping frost off of ancient gauges: pressure, temperature, etc. The green light's sudden switch to yellow raises an eyebrow. That's not encouraging.

Still something about the design of this chamber is familiar enough. Crude and old, but so is penicillin and it still does the trick. I should be able to access these controls.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Stand by on that, Mr. Andes. I don't know if this chamber is stable enough to be moved. I need a little more time with this relic."" Elias combs over the controls, wiping frost off of ancient gauges: pressure, temperature, etc. The green light's sudden switch to yellow raises an eyebrow. <em>That's not encouraging.</em></p><p>Still something about the design of this chamber is familiar enough. Crude and old, but so is penicillin and it still does the trick. <em>I should be able to access these controls.</em></p>

Elias finds some rationale to how the thing is constructed, even if he can't precisely figure out what each of the instruments do. It is clear the chamber was repurposed from something else and cobbled together with scraps and seemingly incongruent artifacts. It seems miraculously put together by a very advanced engineer, even if the parts are odd.

But after the confusion of it, the core parts can be identified. There is no way to plug in for a diagnostic, but the panel seems to use lights to communicate readings. Except for the yellow light, they are all green. Glyphs above the lights start to make sense. Inverted triangle perhaps means pressure, heart pulse perhaps means vital signs, cloud means air quality, and a star perhaps means temperature. If the assumption is correct, it's the temperature gauge that is yellow.

On the bridge, Sid's metapad confirms that the ship's data was uplinked to the Promise and provides a report:

===================

Status:

Abandoned

Governance: Terran Mandate

Mandate Category: PsiTech Manufacturing and Resource Extraction and Storage

Point of Contact: Helis Corporation of Technology Research and Resource

Management

Last

Record: #1118599, Transmission Date: 2,955-03-27 DT

 

Source:
Pilot Log

""Missed rendezvous by 2 hours, Starship Spector is now heading into deep space with 750,000 souls. I'm not on it. I figure I've got about 5 months of supplies in here, and 5 years of air.  I will shut down life support and wait this thing out in cryo. If I wake up, let's hope things are better out there. If not, I won't know the difference. End log. ""

====================

Back on the Promise, there is an incoming transmission from Aspor. It is encrypted.

Sid reviews the information with interest. What ever happened here, things went bad. From what he knows about how things went down during the Scream, the being in cryo is probably the lucky one.

He accesses his comms, and reports his findings to the rest of the crew, adding “We seem to have an incoming transmission from Asapor as well, but I thought this place was supposed to be dead. It’s encrypted too, did anyone receive a key from our benefactors?”

Elias pours over the controls, recognizing the falling temperature and finding no clear method to stabilize the pod. He responds to Sid's message.

""We may learn some answers shortly. This man's cryo chamber if failing. Interior temperature is already reaching human normal. I'm going to depressurize the chamber slowly and enrich the oxygen mixture. I estimate he'll be safe to move in 10 minutes, give or take. I may need some help moving him.""

Elias works the unfamiliar controls, hearing the familiar hiss of a valve opening, keeping one eye on his medical scanner. Don't you die on me, mystery man.

Clovis opens up a comm channel for the incoming encrypted message. ""I can't imagine there are too many people with much to say to us"" he says as he checks the message's signature against their employer's.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Clovis opens up a comm channel for the incoming encrypted message. ""I can't imagine there are too many people with much to say to us"" he says as he checks the message's signature against their employer's.</p>

Having figured out the basics of the cryo chamber, Elias is able to ease the ancient passenger to an animated state. Vital signs appear to be stable and after a time, there is a mechanical thud and the chamber lights all blink green.

Back on the Promise there doesn't seem to be a cypher anywhere in the ship's database for this particular encryption. The message protocol appears to match another star system in the sector called Kelos, which is about four spikes from Aspor. While Clovis can identify the protocol, he can't immediately bypass the encryption.

Sean has completed loading the Promise with the salvaged supplies and lockbox.

Back on comms. ""Our friend is regaining consciousness. I'll report in as soon as I've learned more.""

Elias releases the latch on the cryo chamber, opening the enclosure and letting the last of the mist escape from inside. His newly defrosted patient is just coming to, eye fluttering and finally opening. He puts on his best soothing doctor face and peers down at his newly defrosted patient. ""Hello, my name is Elias Abramson. I'm a physician. You've been asleep a very long time. Do you know your name?""

Dimitri gasps in air and then immediately proceeds to cough out a glob of transparent, viscous fluid that he spits out onto the floor to the side. As he begins taking in the room around him, pained realization washes over him. He falters for a moment and struggles to stabilize himself upright against the cryo chamber shell.

He turns quickly to the man in front of him. ""My name is Dimitri. What is the year and most importantly, who are you, baretna?"" The response is quick and heavily accented.

Sean finishes stowing equipment from the derelict ship then returns to see the doc speaking with the former ice cube.  ""Doc, can we move him.  I do not consider it a coincidence we receive an encrypted message from an unknown source just as we link up with this ship.  I would like to put some distance between us and this place ASAP.""

""Hi there.  Sean Andes.  You think we could get you transferred to our ship now?  I assure you it is a lot warmer over there than it is here.""

Dimitri nods in greeting and glances around the room quickly then back at the two, leveling an icy stare in their direction. ""I want to stay on this ship no longer than I must, but I require my gear and most importantly the navigation data and system log from the on-board computer system. Once in hand, I'll be the first one on that ship of yours.""

Noticing a sense of urgency, ""Why? What's the rush? You in a little trouble?"" A small grin spreads across his face replacing the icy stare.

""Great to hear."" Dimitri steps completely out of the cryo chamber, begins jumping up and down a bit to shake off the last bit of cold, and motions for toward the door. ""After you, baretna.""

""You must have known that you'd be waking up in a different time, if at all, but I imagine this is rather alarming nonetheless. I assure you we'll answer your question, to the best of our ability, just as soon as we're aboard the Promise.""

Elias gestures for the passage and follows Sean and Dimitri through.

After Sid acquires the rest of the ship's log, the crew and Dimitri make their way back to The Promise. Inside they gather in the cargo bay to remove their vacc suits and make introductions.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>After Sid acquires the rest of the ship's log, the crew and Dimitri make their way back to <em>The Promise. </em>Inside they gather in the cargo bay to remove their vacc suits and make introductions.</p>

Once secure back on the Promise, Sean quickly suggests, ""Jez, let's get some distance from this place.  We'll have the new guy in the med bay for introductions and hopefully some answers.""

Sean gets out of his vacc suit then helps Dmitri to the doc's table.  ""So, what's the deal, iceman?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Once secure back on the <em>Promise</em>, Sean quickly suggests, ""Jez, let's get some distance from this place.  We'll have the new guy in the med bay for introductions and hopefully some answers.""</p><p>Sean gets out of his vacc suit then helps Dmitri to the doc's table.  ""So, what's the deal, iceman?""</p>

""I was positioned on a mining and research facility on Aspor back before it happened. Then it hit and it felt like a neural explosion going off in the back of my skull. My vision swam as I crumpled to the floor right there in the middle of the facility. I was dead, at least I felt dead. And then I woke. It was difficult to piece together my past, my mission, and the reason I was there in the first place. An active notification was on my compad about a colony ship leaving from the system and I knew I needed on.""

""Something had changed. It was subtle at first, but I felt it. That little neural explosion set off something in my mind and I could do things. I blasted open doors accidentally before I could key them open among other equally terrifying experiences.""

""But I made it off that facility on one of the last ships available."" Dimitri points back over his shoulder in the general direction of his ship. ""That little rock hopper took me a long ways, but I couldn't make it to the colony ship in time. I spent countless hours on that ship floating through space, honing my abilities, and eating through most of the rations. The only option I had was stasis and hope that someone would find me.""

""But enough about me. How much trouble are we in and how can I help? When we find some time and those ship logs have been deciphered I'd like to take a look through them if you don't mind.""

""Oh, and my effects. Where did they end up?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I was positioned on a mining and research facility on Aspor back before it happened. Then it hit and it felt like a neural explosion going off in the back of my skull. My vision swam as I crumpled to the floor right there in the middle of the facility. I was dead, at least I felt dead. And then I woke. It was difficult to piece together my past, my mission, and the reason I was there in the first place. An active notification was on my compad about a colony ship leaving from the system and I knew I needed on.""</p><p>""Something had changed. It was subtle at first, but I felt it. That little neural explosion set off something in my mind and I could do things. I blasted open doors accidentally before I could key them open among other equally terrifying experiences.""</p><p>""But I made it off that facility on one of the last ships available."" Dimitri points back over his shoulder in the general direction of his ship. ""That little rock hopper took me a long ways, but I couldn't make it to the colony ship in time. I spent countless hours on that ship floating through space, honing my abilities, and eating through most of the rations. The only option I had was stasis and hope that someone would find me.""</p><p>""But enough about me. How much trouble are we in and how can I help? When we find some time and those ship logs have been deciphered I'd like to take a look through them if you don't mind.""</p><p>""Oh, and my effects. Where did they end up?""</p>

""Distance to where? To the completely uninhabited planet that's sending out an encrypted transmission? Sounds fun.""

Jezerin takes the pilot console and starts up intraspace thrusters.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Distance to where? To the completely uninhabited planet that's sending out an encrypted transmission? Sounds fun.""</p><p>Jezerin takes the pilot console and starts up intraspace thrusters.</p>

Sid moves aside the collection of ration wrappers, coffee cups, and training manuals that have been cluttering up the communications console, and hooks in his dataslab.

“Let’s see the if we can’t figure out whose talking out here, and what they’re saying”
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid moves aside the collection of ration wrappers, coffee cups, and training manuals that have been cluttering up the communications console, and hooks in his dataslab.</p><p>“Let’s see the if we can’t figure out whose talking out here, and what they’re saying”</p>

It's an older protocol, but Sid is able to crack the encryption by running through the code and finding similarities with packages in his database.

The text message says:

CAMP ISOLATION SUPPLY DESTINATION COORDINATES 40.741895,-73.989308. 


WARNING: TRANSMIT CODE A62987501-2 TO DISARM SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM UPON ASPOR INITIAL REGION PING. 


WARNING: ASPOR SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM IS ARMED AND ACTIVE.


WARNING: ASPOR SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM IS ARMED AND ACTIVE.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>It's an older protocol, but Sid is able to crack the encryption by running through the code and finding similarities with packages in his database.</p><p>The text message says:<span style=""color: rgb(118, 146, 60);""></span></p><p style=""margin-left: 40px;""><span style=""color: rgb(118, 146, 60);"">CAMP ISOLATION SUPPLY DESTINATION COORDINATES 40.741895,-73.989308. </span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);""><br></span></p><p style=""margin-left: 40px;""><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">WARNING: TRANSMIT CODE A62987501-2 TO DISARM SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM UPON ASPOR INITIAL REGION PING. </span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);""><br></span></p><p style=""margin-left: 40px;""><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">WARNING: ASPOR SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM IS ARMED AND ACTIVE.</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);""><br></span></p><p style=""margin-left: 40px;""><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">WARNING: ASPOR SATELLITE WEAPON SYSTEM IS ARMED AND ACTIVE.</span></p>

Sid yells out “Slow down, stop the ship! We have some active weapon systems out here!!”

He shows the pad to Jezerin.

“If we get any closer before transmitting this code, we could end up as space vapour. At least we can guess what happened to the last ship.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid yells out “Slow down, stop the ship! We have some active weapon systems out here!!”</p><p>He shows the pad to Jezerin.</p><p>“If we get any closer before transmitting this code, we could end up as space vapour. At least we can guess what happened to the last ship.”</p>
Jezerin immediately enables reverse thrusters, ""Okay, okay, take it easy.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Jezerin immediately enables reverse thrusters, ""Okay, okay, take it easy.""</p>
Sid carefully punches the code into the communications panel, triple checking it before  transmitting it, and waits for confirmation from the ancient weapon system.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid carefully punches the code into the communications panel, triple checking it before  transmitting it, and waits for confirmation from the ancient weapon system.</p>
The transmission is sent. The Promise will have to wait six hours for it to be received and for confirmation to arrive.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The transmission is sent. The <em>Promise</em> will have to wait six hours for it to be received and for confirmation to arrive.</p>

Elias peeks over Sid's shoulder, reading and rereading the transmission to himself. ""Curious. What are they hiding down there that would require such an aggressive response?""

It's a rhetorical question of course. He folds his arms and eyes Dimitri and then the others on the bridge. ""On the off chance that this doesn't work or is some kind of trap, is there some way to mask our signal? Fool the weapon system somehow?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Elias peeks over Sid's shoulder, reading and rereading the transmission to himself. ""Curious. What are they hiding down there that would require such an aggressive response?""</p><p>It's a rhetorical question of course. He folds his arms and eyes Dimitri and then the others on the bridge. ""On the off chance that this doesn't work or is some kind of trap, is there some way to mask our signal? Fool the weapon system somehow?""</p>

Sid’s eyes squint as he considers the question. “I’m not sure. If they already have a visual lock on us, we might have to jump out of the system, and then jump back in to break it, but... we’re out of fuel. We are going to have to find something down on the planet if we want to leave.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid’s eyes squint as he considers the question. “I’m not sure. If they already have a visual lock on us, we might have to jump out of the system, and then jump back in to break it, but... we’re out of fuel. We are going to have to find something down on the planet if we want to leave.”</p>

A transmission reaches The Promise, this one not encrypted, and in Mandate, but in a very old dialect.

SATELLITE DE-ARMED FOR GOOD SURVIVE. SPACE SHUTTLE PROCEEDING IS THEN OKAY.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A transmission reaches <em>The Promise</em>, this one not encrypted, and in Mandate, but in a very old dialect.</p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;"">SATELLITE DE-ARMED FOR GOOD SURVIVE. SPACE SHUTTLE PROCEEDING IS THEN OKAY.</p>

Catching the transmission out of the corner of his eye, Elias sighs. ""That's a relief.""

He walks toward the corridor. ""I'll go make myself useful in the lab. Dimitri, you're due for a full medical examination at your nearest convenience. We don't want any surprises.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Catching the transmission out of the corner of his eye, Elias sighs. ""That's a relief.""</p><p>He walks toward the corridor. ""I'll go make myself useful in the lab. Dimitri, you're due for a full medical examination at your nearest convenience. We don't want any surprises.""</p>

Hearing over comms that the Promise and her crew would NOT be turned in to so much dust and vapor, Sean relaxes a bit, then with a sardonic grin, ""I think I'll catch a quick nap before we land.  Start yelling if we are about to die horribly.""

Sean heads down to his bunk to catch a few winks knowing it could be a good while before he got another chance.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Hearing over comms that the <em>Promise</em> and her crew would NOT be turned in to so much dust and vapor, Sean relaxes a bit, then with a sardonic grin, ""I think I'll catch a quick nap before we land.  Start yelling if we are about to die horribly.""</p><p>Sean heads down to his bunk to catch a few winks knowing it could be a good while before he got another chance. </p>

With Jezerin at the helm, the Promise traverses three regions of empty space over the course of several days before arriving in Aspor's region. The ship pings upon entering the region and finds several inoperable artificial satellites, the weapon system, as well as two natural satellites. 

The planet, a rusty orange barren world, appears lifeless. Darkness stretches beyond the reach of the star revealing no surface lights. The star itself,  a red giant, casts dim rays over its surface, blandly refracting a dim orange hue on the planet's barely-visible atmosphere.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>With Jezerin at the helm, the <em>Promise </em>traverses three regions of empty space over the course of several days before arriving in Aspor's region. The ship pings upon entering the region and finds several inoperable artificial satellites, the weapon system, as well as two natural satellites. </p><p>The planet, a rusty orange barren world, appears lifeless. Darkness stretches beyond the reach of the star revealing no surface lights. The star itself,  a red giant, casts dim rays over its surface, blandly refracting a dim orange hue on the planet's barely-visible atmosphere.</p>

Dimitri stands speechless on the bridge for a moment staring at his apparently lifeless home planet. Then, in a hushed tone, ""Jezerin, are you the pilot? Are your scans showing anything orbiting the planet? Actually, send any data to my compad along with the decrypted ship log if you could. I need that medical evaluation.""  He motions for Doc to lead the way.

Once alone with Elias, Dimitri asks, ""How long have you been with this crew Doc? I get the sense you're a fairly close-knit group but I'm still trying to figure all this out.""

Dimitri looks thoughtful as he finds the words to continue. ""How do these things usually go? Are you all a pacifist group or... something different? I just don't want any surprises when we get down there to the surface.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dimitri stands speechless on the bridge for a moment staring at his apparently lifeless home planet. Then, in a hushed tone, ""Jezerin, are you the pilot? Are your scans showing anything orbiting the planet? Actually, send any data to my compad along with the decrypted ship log if you could. I need that medical evaluation.""  He motions for Doc to lead the way.</p><p>Once alone with Elias, Dimitri asks, ""How long have you been with this crew Doc? I get the sense you're a fairly close-knit group but I'm still trying to figure all this out.""</p><p>Dimitri looks thoughtful as he finds the words to continue. ""How do these things usually go? Are you all a pacifist group or... something different? I just don't want any surprises when we get down there to the surface.""</p>
""Not really my job,"" Jez grunts and puts his feet up, looking with a raised eyebrow at Clovis. ""Not seeing anything on visuals though.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Not really my job,"" Jez grunts and puts his feet up, looking with a raised eyebrow at Clovis. ""Not seeing anything on visuals though.""</p>

Elias checks the controls on the lab's medical examination bed, calibrating the sensors for his new patient. ""Go ahead and lay back."" As Dimitri lays down on the bed, sensors come to life on a series of actuating arms scanning slowly and filling the display on the way with data.

""Not long, I'm afraid. This crew has a knack for picking up strays. You and I are similar in that regard,"" Elias points to his own forehead ""and in another regard, it seems."" He looks over the display carefully, reading the data for anomalies.

""Tell me, Mr. Cordonov is it? How exactly did you end up on fringes? I'm curious about your journey. A man out of time. I dare say, you are quite unique.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Elias checks the controls on the lab's medical examination bed, calibrating the sensors for his new patient. ""Go ahead and lay back."" As Dimitri lays down on the bed, sensors come to life on a series of actuating arms scanning slowly and filling the display on the way with data.</p><p>""Not long, I'm afraid. This crew has a knack for picking up strays. You and I are similar in that regard,"" Elias points to his own forehead ""and in another regard, it seems."" He looks over the display carefully, reading the data for anomalies.</p><p>""Tell me, Mr. Cordonov is it? How exactly did you end up on fringes? I'm curious about your journey. A man out of time. I dare say, you are quite unique.""</p>
Medical scans come up clean, however it is clear that Dimitri is very dehydrated. Apart from that, an oddly successful de-cryo process.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Medical scans come up clean, however it is clear that Dimitri is very dehydrated. Apart from that, an oddly successful de-cryo process.</p>

Sean appears in the doorway to the bridge, ""Clovis, could you scan the surface and any satellites from this distance or do we need to close in first?""

""Jez, how far from the surface of Aspor are we currently?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sean appears in the doorway to the bridge, ""Clovis, could you scan the surface and any satellites from this distance or do we need to close in first?""</p><p>""Jez, how far from the surface of Aspor are we currently?""</p>

Dimitri lays back on the medical table completely disregarding the equipment while staying deeply in thought. ""Unique only because I missed the ship. Quite literally. Depending on how you look at it one could say that I am the lucky one. I survived after all. But here we are flying down to this tomb of a planet where my friends, family, colleagues, and entire life once existed, and for that I count myself unlucky.""

""I need the ship's data because it contains the drive vector of the colony ship that left. I need to find out what happened to them."" Dimitri turns away uncomfortably.

After a few moments, Dimitri turns to meet Docs eyes once again. ""Look Doc, my people were a resourceful people. That world down there might not be a tomb world at all. I think we need to be prepared for anything.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dimitri lays back on the medical table completely disregarding the equipment while staying deeply in thought. ""Unique only because I missed the ship. Quite literally. Depending on how you look at it one could say that I am the lucky one. I survived after all. But here we are flying down to this tomb of a planet where my friends, family, colleagues, and entire life once existed, and for that I count myself unlucky.""</p><p>""I need the ship's data because it contains the drive vector of the colony ship that left. I <em>need</em> to find out what happened to them."" Dimitri turns away uncomfortably.</p><p>After a few moments, Dimitri turns to meet Docs eyes once again. ""Look Doc, my people were a resourceful people. That world down there might not be a tomb world at all. I think we need to be prepared for anything.""</p>
He shrugs, picks at his fingernails, ""Could land in an hour if we don't care about making noise.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>He shrugs, picks at his fingernails, ""Could land in an hour if we don't care about making noise.""</p>

Sid shakes himself awake, having fallen asleep at the comms panel. Noticing the file from the other ship is ready, he clicks onto the intercom. “Dimitri, I have the files from your ship if you are still interested. If you have anything that connects to our systems, You should have no problem finding them.”

He turns his attention to the planet below, and starts to look for traces of the ship they’ve been sent to find....
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sid shakes himself awake, having fallen asleep at the comms panel. Noticing the file from the other ship is ready, he clicks onto the intercom. “Dimitri, I have the files from your ship if you are still interested. If you have anything that connects to our systems, You should have no problem finding them.”</p><p>He turns his attention to the planet below, and starts to look for traces of the ship they’ve been sent to find....</p>

Aspor is revealing inconclusive results on the scan, save for a region near the equator where there is an unusual amount of Carbon Dioxide, not to a toxic level, but higher than the rest of the planet. Apart from that, it is a breathable mix of air, with a temperate climate.

As the scans are coming in, the sensor array presents another detection lock warning.

Frigate Class Patrol Boat, Registered Lic. #855875-23, PsiAuth Fleet 1 (Parnasus Psionics Authority), Distance: 8995,066,789 kdul, Status: [Detection Lock]

And moments later everyone on the bridge witnesses from visuals a compressed beam of red energy silently release from a small speck over the horizon of Aspor, the satellite they disarmed earlier. Minutes later, the detection lock is dropped, the sensors cannot find the PsiAuth vessel, and the satellite goes dormant again.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Aspor is revealing inconclusive results on the scan, save for a region near the equator where there is an unusual amount of Carbon Dioxide, not to a toxic level, but higher than the rest of the planet. Apart from that, it is a breathable mix of air, with a temperate climate.</p><p>As the scans are coming in, the sensor array presents another detection lock warning.</p><p>Frigate Class Patrol Boat, Registered Lic. #855875-23, PsiAuth Fleet 1 (Parnasus Psionics Authority), Distance: 8995,066,789 kdul, Status: [Detection Lock]</p><p>And moments later everyone on the bridge witnesses from visuals a compressed beam of red energy silently release from a small speck over the horizon of Aspor, the satellite they disarmed earlier. Minutes later, the detection lock is dropped, the sensors cannot find the PsiAuth vessel, and the satellite goes dormant again.</p>

""Buddha's bosom!  Did the satellite just torch a tail or was that PsiAuth boat already here?!""  Still looking shocked, Sean leans heavy on the bulkhead.  ""I absolutely loathe automated defense systems.  That could have been us if Sid had fat-fingered a digit.  No...uhuh.  Give me a rifle and point me towards an enemy with a face any day.""

Semi-composing himself, ""Sid, any signs of the downed ship?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Buddha's bosom!  Did the satellite just torch a tail or was that PsiAuth boat already here?!""  Still looking shocked, Sean leans heavy on the bulkhead.  ""I absolutely loathe automated defense systems.  That could have been us if Sid had fat-fingered a digit.  No...uhuh.  Give me a rifle and point me towards an enemy with a face any day.""</p><p>Semi-composing himself, ""Sid, any signs of the downed ship?""</p>
