Nero pauses, his eyes scanning down and to his right, apparently completing a line of text he had been reading in the large book open before him on the floor.

He looks up to Coda, gently pressing the butt of his cigarette to his lips and inhaling slowly.

The ash glows a bright red hue from the long, gentle drag.

With measured casualness he removes the cigarette from his mouth and nods.  Instead of answering her question directly, his eyes lock with Coda's and he asks, ""What is your measure of the woman?"" Smoke wafts gently from his lips as he speaks.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Nero pauses, his eyes scanning down and to his right, apparently completing a line of text he had been reading in the large book open before him on the floor.</p><p>He looks up to Coda, gently pressing the butt of his cigarette to his lips and inhaling slowly.</p><p>The ash glows a bright red hue from the long, gentle drag.</p><p>With measured casualness he removes the cigarette from his mouth and nods.  Instead of answering her question directly, his eyes lock with Coda's and he asks, <strong>""What is your measure of the woman?""</strong> Smoke wafts gently from his lips as he speaks.</p>

Coda leans on the wall, pondering on her answer. ""She seems nice. Trustworthy. She doesn't necessarily approve of your style, but she's... she's good. She won't turn on us.""

She lets her eyes wander. Her heart is pounding again, the the same loop of notes ringing over and over in her head. TonightTonightTonight.

""She knows what I am, I think."" Her voice has fallen to a mere whisper. ""And she's like that too, but not like me. She said she'll come tonight, like you asked. For me. She gave me a - you know, a tune. In my head. But I don't know what it's supposed to do. I don't even know the words.""

Her voice falters. She takes a little time to regroup herself, but when she resumes talking, far more words stumble out of her mouth than she intends to. 

""And I don't even know what you want me to sing tonight. I don't know how you know her, or why you sent me there, or what was that blue thing in those bottles... I- I really don't know much about anything that's going on right now, 'Ro. A bit of explanation wouldn't hurt.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Coda leans on the wall, pondering on her answer. <strong>""She seems nice. Trustworthy. She doesn't necessarily approve of your style, but she's... she's good. She won't turn on us.""</strong></p><p><strong></strong>She lets her eyes wander. Her heart is pounding again, the the same loop of notes ringing over and over in her head. <i style=""background-color: initial;"">TonightTonightTonight</i>.</p><p><strong>""She knows what I am, I think."" </strong>Her voice has fallen to a mere whisper. ""<strong>And she's like that too, but not like me. </strong><b style=""background-color: initial;"">She said she'll come tonight, like you asked. For me. She gave me a - you know, a <em>tune</em>. In my head. But I don't know what it's supposed to do. I don't even know the words.""</b></p><p>Her voice falters. She takes a little time to regroup herself, but when she resumes talking, far more words stumble out of her mouth than she intends to. </p><p><b style=""background-color: initial;"">""And I don't even know what you want me to sing tonight. I don't know how you know her, or why you sent me there, or what was that blue thing in those bottles... I- I really don't know much about anything that's going on right now, 'Ro. A bit of explanation wouldn't hurt."" </b></p>

Nero leans back casually against the wall behind him as he takes another slow, deliberate drag from the cigarette.  His eyes meet Coda's, the pace of his movement and measured breathing seeming to try to will Coda to slow down, to relax.

""So many questions.  You are far too young to concern yourself with so many questions.""  

A peculiar statement since Nero must be about the same age as Coda, or nearly so.

""All things shall come to you with time.  For now, I would like you to consider a melody to enrapture your audience.  Bind them to you, make them fall in love with you and your words.  This is something you do and do well.""

His eyes dart to one side and linger - in the direction of the town center nearby.  ""This day shall prepare the right people for your mystical touch.  I want you to reach out to them, feel them, draw them to your bosom ... see them.""  He leans forward, a light tendril of smoke wafting lazily from the glowing ember.  ""Draw them to you so that I might get to know them as I know everything about you,"" he says with a tone that elicits both a shiver as well as a sensation of warmth and protection.

Nero leans back, another long drag from the cigarette.  ""Can you do that for me?"" he asks, his tone soft, caring, as the caress of a tender lover.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Nero leans back casually against the wall behind him as he takes another slow, deliberate drag from the cigarette.  His eyes meet Coda's, the pace of his movement and measured breathing seeming to try to will Coda to slow down, to relax.</p><p><strong>""So many questions.  You are far too young to concern yourself with so many questions.""  </strong></p><p>A peculiar statement since Nero must be about the same age as Coda, or nearly so.</p><p><strong>""All things shall come to you with time.  For now, I would like you to consider a melody to enrapture your audience.  Bind them to you, make them fall in love with you and your words.  This is something you do and do well.""</strong></p><p>His eyes dart to one side and linger - in the direction of the town center nearby.  <strong>""This day shall prepare the right people for your mystical touch.  I want you to reach out to them, feel them, draw them to your bosom ... see them.""</strong>  He leans forward, a light tendril of smoke wafting lazily from the glowing ember.  <strong>""Draw them to you so that I might get to know them as I know everything about you,""</strong> he says with a tone that elicits both a shiver as well as a sensation of warmth and protection.</p><p>Nero leans back, another long drag from the cigarette.  <strong>""Can you do that for me?""</strong> he asks, his tone soft, caring, as the caress of a tender lover.</p>

Coda merely rolls her eyes as Nero deflects her questions - half because she's used to the old trick, and half because she's pissed to see it still effects her. How is it possible for him to be so condenscending, and yet remain so ... soothing ?

As he states his intent, she squints, and grow very, very attentive. Nero, too, wants a love song ? How fortuitous that Holloway asked for the very same thing. Although Nero is far more blunt about what he want. How did Holloway say again ? A coarse pattern of weaving ? Yeah, definitely right about that.

And then Nero turns towards her, with that gaze that's like a kick in the secret can of butterflies in her guts, and she knows she can't refuse. 

""Indeed, I can"", she nods. ""At three conditions.""

She raises her index.

""First. I need to catch the audience attention, so let's go dramatic. I'll need red dye for my hair, and a new dress. Black. A bustier would be nice."" She nonchalantly flicks her wrist, so that Holloway's bracelet catch the light and sparkle. ""Show my bare arms, y'know.""

Another finger joins the first. 

""Second. No fighting during my song. If I have to yell, we risk much, and I don't want that. And if someone dares bring trouble near my stage, I'll have no choice but to defend myself. With a song."" Oh, how she's proud of her tone, right one - just detached enough to be threatening, without becoming fully cliché. ""And not a pretty one.""

She lets that sink in a few seconds, then raises a third finger. 

""Third...""

That's the big one. 

She really wants to perform Holloway's melody: she owes her that. However, without the lyrics, there's only so much she can do. Nero has been very clear about what he wants: she knows exactly what piece he intends her to perform, and she can't fuel two songs at once. She has only one voice, after all. 

But as always with her gift, there's a loophole. 

If a band accompanies her, they can take on Holloway's melody. She'll sing her own composition on top, and adjust her own accords to the band's music. She never tried it, but she's certain it could work.

But for that, she needs mundane musicians, melodies whose only magic comes from sheer artistry and dedication. And from what she gathered today on the streets, there's only one group that can provide her with what she needs. 

""I'll sing the song you want at the end of the set, when everybody will be focused on me: that'll give you enough time to figure who you want in or not in the room at this point.  But there's no chance I go in a capella. If we do something this big, I want a band. Scratch that: I want the best band.""

She slowly articulates, to be sure he understands.

""I want Three Plus Two.""

column2: Nero listens to Coda, his movements inexorable and slow as he draws the cigarette to his mouth and draws a long, languid breath, the ember glowing bright from the lengthy draw.

His eyes glance cooly at the bracelet adorning Coda's wrist; they follow the gentle movement of her hand and arm, transfixed by the adornment for a few moments before his gaze returns once more to Coda and her words.

His hand gently pulls away from his lips, Nero's chest unmoving, his eyes alive in consideration, and his hand staid and unwavering, the light tendrils of white smoke rising casually from the dimming ember.
The request ... nee, the demand, and the apparent change it signaled from somewhere within Coda, did not appear lost on Nero.
His chin tilted upward and a ring of white smoke materialized from his mouth.  Then, another.  And, a third.
The air was silent as Nero lowered his chin and met Coda's gaze.

He nods.  Once.  ""Very well.""

Nero looks beyond Coda as an Asian woman appeared in the doorway.  Fay-lin, the club's decorator and costume designer ... such as there was need for any.  She held Nero's purse strings for the productions, but what she knew of Nero's real business was anyone's guess.

""Fay-lin, Coda has some requests for tonight.  See that her needs are accommodated.""

The Asian woman appears to be about to open her mouth in reply when Nero adds, ""In full.""

With a nod to Coda, Nero leans forward off the wall and moves the open book so that it is centered back into his field of view.  He meets Coda's eyes once more and glances down towards the pages of the book.

Clearly, their meetging is over.

column1: ""Don't worry."" Coda says to Fay with a meek
smile.  ""<strong>I can take care of my hair myself. And for the dress, we can cut

something through my old rags. I think I know how I want it to look… kinda.""

She goes
towards the exit, facing Fay-lin, but raising her voice so that Nero can hear
that’s not the most important part. What matters to me is bringing Three Plus Two here. We should send our guys to look
for them. Maybe check at Proper’s place too, and spread the word around the

North Stage that we want to meet. And that we can pay.”

Well, I can’t, but you surely do, boo. Right?

She keeps
her back turned at Nero, resisting the impulse to look back at him. She's
honestly surprised it went down that easy. Not that he accepted her terms -
after all, they’re all ideas that benefit him - but that he agreed almost
instantly. He never does that. Usually, even if he agrees with her ideas, he
makes her wait, just to reaffirm his ascendant over her. But now, he doesn’t: either
because he's too thrilled about his plans falling into place to care… or
because he’s too uncertain about his chances to risk losing the asset she constitues.

No matter which is right, that’s a first.

""How that must aches...” she whispers,
Fay-lin in direction of the exit, and begins to walk away.

At Coda's insistence once more on Three Plus Two, Coda notes Fay-lin's gaze drift over her shoulder towards where Nero is sitting.

Something that she observed from Nero causes a corner of her lip to curl downward.  

A look of mild consternation narrows Fay-lin's eyes and she looks to Coda and nods.

""I presume they are a musical group at the Fling,"" she states, rather than inquiring.  ""And we shall see to suitable attire,"" she adds, her voice dripping with annoyance.

She turns to follow Coda.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><img src=""https://d2folr83karyot.cloudfront.net/image/17020.jpg"" style=""background-color: initial; float: left; width: 176px; margin: 0px 10px 10px 0px;"" alt="""">At Coda's insistence once more on Three Plus Two, Coda notes Fay-lin's gaze drift over her shoulder towards where Nero is sitting.</p><p>Something that she observed from Nero causes a corner of her lip to curl downward.  </p><p>A look of mild consternation narrows Fay-lin's eyes and she looks to Coda and nods.</p><p><strong>""I presume they are a musical group at the Fling,""</strong> she states, rather than inquiring.  <strong>""And we shall see to suitable attire,""</strong> she adds, her voice dripping with annoyance.</p><p>She turns to follow Coda.</p>

column4: The door to Ms. Lin's office is partially open.  Lin is at her desk.  She can be heard speaking Japanese to someone, and someone speaking back.  Given the conversational rhythm, it's clearly a Skype call.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-279939""><div class=""row"">
Kiele hovers for a second outside, looking back at Esme and Aedi questioningly, but then knocks at the door so she doesn’t seem like she’s easedropping.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele hovers for a second outside, looking back at Esme and Aedi questioningly, but then knocks at the door so she doesn’t seem like she’s easedropping. </p>

""This is unexpected.  Welcome, come on in.""  Lin waves the group in.  ""There's a folding chair in that closet there, so you can all have a seat.  Izumi, I need to go, but before I do, you can meet some of my students:  this is Kiele, Esme, and you must be my new student.  Aedi, right?  This is my oldest, Izumi.""

Lin turns the monitor around, showing a Japanese woman in her twenties.  The woman smiles, waves, and gives a peace sign.  ""Nice to meet all of you.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""This is unexpected.  Welcome, come on in.""  Lin waves the group in.  ""There's a folding chair in that closet there, so you can all have a seat.  Izumi, I need to go, but before I do, you can meet some of my students:  this is Kiele, Esme, and you must be my new student.  Aedi, right?  This is my oldest, Izumi.""</p><p>Lin turns the monitor around, showing a Japanese woman in her twenties.  The woman smiles, waves, and gives a peace sign.  ""Nice to meet all of you.""</p>
“Nice to meet you too,” Esme says with an enthusiastic wave.  “We are all excited to have your mom here with us.  Sorry for the interruption.”
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Nice to meet you too,” Esme says with an enthusiastic wave.  “We are all excited to have your mom here with us.  Sorry for the interruption.”</p>

""It's okay.  I'm glad to meet you.  I guess we're name-sisters.  Power sisters, too.  You're the speedster, right?""  Izumi says.  Her English is accented, but easy to understand.  ""Mom's very excited to be there.  I'm sure you guys will be good for each other.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""It's okay.  I'm glad to meet you.  I guess we're name-sisters.  Power sisters, too.  You're the speedster, right?""  Izumi says.  Her English is accented, but easy to understand.  ""Mom's very excited to be there.  I'm sure you guys will be good for each other.""</p>
Kiele leans down to see the screen. “Omygosh, are you a speedster? Are you also strong?”
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele leans down to see the screen. “Omygosh, are you a speedster? Are you also strong?”</p>

""No, just the speed,"" Izumi replies.  ""And I'm sure I'm not as fast as Esme.  Mostly it helps with reading.  But I don't want to keep you guys.  I'd love to hear from you, though.  I'm a FaceSpot junkie--I got that from mom--I'll send you all friend requests!  Bye!""

Lin turns the monitor around, says a few more words in Japanese, and signs off.  

""So.""  She folds her hands on her desk.  ""So, late night visit, serious faces.  You're probably not just hoping to get  a jump on tomorrow's lessons.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""No, just the speed,"" Izumi replies.  ""And I'm sure I'm not as fast as Esme.  Mostly it helps with reading.  But I don't want to keep you guys.  I'd love to hear from you, though.  I'm a FaceSpot junkie--I got that from mom--I'll send you all friend requests!  Bye!""</p><p>Lin turns the monitor around, says a few more words in Japanese, and signs off.  </p><p>""So.""  She folds her hands on her desk.  ""So, late night visit, serious faces.  You're probably not just hoping to get  a jump on tomorrow's lessons.""</p>

“I’m the speedster now.  Late developing power, I’m still figuring it out and running into things.”  Esme smiles and waves goodbye.

“Please explain to your daughter for me, I don’t really accept FaceSpot requests.  Because of my father.  Better safe than sorry.”

“We can get a jump on tomorrow’s lessons?” Esme asks, almost in spite of herself.  “Tell me more,” she says eagerly.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“I’m the speedster now.  Late developing power, I’m still figuring it out and running into things.”  Esme smiles and waves goodbye.</p><p>“Please explain to your daughter for me, I don’t really accept FaceSpot requests.  Because of my father.  Better safe than sorry.”</p><p>“We can get a jump on tomorrow’s lessons?” Esme asks, almost in spite of herself.  “Tell me more,” she says eagerly.</p>

“Actually,” Kiele interrupts. “We, um, we...” she had no idea how to try and start this conversation. Flailing around, she remembers what Esme had said. 

“We were hoping that maybe we could apologize. For leaving you behind in the x-wing? Six days and, er, twenty five years ago?” She looks apologetic and hopeful.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Actually,” Kiele interrupts. “We, um, we...” she had no idea how to try and start this conversation. Flailing around, she remembers what Esme had said. </p><p>“We were hoping that maybe we could apologize. For leaving you behind in the x-wing? Six days and, er, twenty five years ago?” She looks apologetic and hopeful. </p>
Esme nods.  “Yeah.  I’m really sorry.  I made a lot of mistakes and you paid for them.  It sounds like you made the best lemonade ever out of the lemons though.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Esme nods.  “Yeah.  I’m really sorry.  I made a lot of mistakes and you paid for them.  It sounds like you made the best lemonade ever out of the lemons though.”</p>

Aedi seems wordless for the most part. Tilting their head as they're introduced to the face on the screen. The technology isn't the strange part. It's the interface. Non-psitech is extremely different with man-machine interfacing.

A wave of goodbye is given to the young woman on the screen. Though no words are spoken. It's too late, really. Aedi's focus seems to flit. Perhaps everything's happening too sudden. The long-range call takes a ton out of a person after all-- All that energy fueled into the Maelstrom can be dizzying for someone not used to doing this without machine assistance.

Though, they seemingly just float there, for a while, opting to not sit, but to simply lounge in anti-grav. In this thoughtful state, would likely just take the chair with them.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Aedi seems wordless for the most part. Tilting their head as they're introduced to the face on the screen. <em>The technology isn't the strange part. It's the interface. Non-psitech is extremely different with man-machine interfacing.</em></p><p>A wave of goodbye is given to the young woman on the screen. Though no words are spoken. It's too late, really. Aedi's focus seems to flit. Perhaps everything's happening too sudden. The long-range call takes a ton out of a person after all-- All that energy fueled into the Maelstrom can be dizzying for someone not used to doing this without machine assistance.</p><p><em>Though, they seemingly just float there, for a while, opting to not sit, but to simply lounge in anti-grav. In this thoughtful state, would likely just take the chair with them.</em></p>
“Also this is Aedi, a new Emerald student,” Kiele adds.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Also this is Aedi, a new Emerald student,” Kiele adds.</p>

Lin laughs.  ""Nothing warms a teacher's heart like a student hungry for knowledge.  Tomorrow I wanted to talk about the concept of 'root causes' as opposed to 'predisposing conditions'."" 

""I'll pass the message on to Izumi.  She'll understand.  Our family is a bit extreme.  We understand that some people are more cautious, and some people don't feel the need to spend every spare moment sifting through the lives of a thousand or so online friends.""

""It's nice meeting you, Aedi.  We're both new here.  I arrived only two days ago, so we can learn how to make this our home together.""  She rises to offer Aedi her hand.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Lin laughs.  ""Nothing warms a teacher's heart like a student hungry for knowledge.  Tomorrow I wanted to talk about the concept of 'root causes' as opposed to 'predisposing conditions'."" </p><p>""I'll pass the message on to Izumi.  She'll understand.  Our family is a bit extreme.  We understand that some people are more cautious, and some people don't feel the need to spend every spare moment sifting through the lives of a thousand or so online friends.""</p><p>""It's nice meeting you, Aedi.  We're both new here.  I arrived only two days ago, so we can learn how to make this our home together.""  She rises to offer Aedi her hand.</p>

A twinge. Something about the connections beforehand, and now, in the flesh, seem to confuse them for a moment. Blinking for a moment, Lin's hand is accepted, and given a slow shake. It's a weak one though. As expected from an awkward teen. Almost as if trying to get away with mimicking the motion.

It's a shame they're using the wrong hand to shake.

""Oh. Hi."" Comes the response to Lin. It's almost the universal greeting Aedi gives. Slowly, however, comes the blinking, ""Oh. Home together?"" A blink.

""I have some prongles in my bag if you want. Nice to meet you.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A twinge. Something about the connections beforehand, and now, in the flesh, seem to confuse them for a moment. Blinking for a moment, Lin's hand is accepted, and given a slow shake. <em>It's a weak one though. As expected from an awkward teen. Almost as if trying to get away with mimicking the motion.</em></p><p><strong>It's a shame they're using the wrong hand to shake.</strong></p><p><strong>""Oh. Hi.</strong>"" Comes the response to Lin. It's almost the universal greeting Aedi gives. Slowly, however, comes the blinking, ""<strong>Oh. Home together?</strong>"" A blink.</p><p>""<strong>I have some prongles in my bag if you want. Nice to meet you.</strong>""</p>

""This is to be our home for a while, is it not?  And I'll pass on the Prongles.  I have some pressed octopus, if you'd like to try it?  Very hard to come by in the US.""  She pulls what appears to be something like a wrapped fruit leather from her desk and offers it to the group.

After a moment, she smiles and looks to Kiele.  ""When I arrived in Osaka, twenty five years ago, there were obviously no pictures of me, so they didn't know how to rebuild my face.  But I must admit, I was still a little hopeful that you'd recognise me.

""As to the apology, I understand how you feel, and I appreciate it, but think of it this way:  if you could go back and do it all again, you'd do it differently, right?  But you can't.  However, Switchblade could.  And she did.  Over and over, until she found a collection of circumstances to get her what she wanted.  You guys were playing against a seriously stacked deck.""  

""I wish Mark could hear this.  I misstepped with him on the first day.  I think it would have been better to wait a day after dropping the Misty bombshell, but it wasn't my call, and I was eager to see you guys again.""

""So, if you didn't recognise me...""  She spreads her hands in an invitation to fill in the blank.

“I can’t eat food anymore.  Violent vomiting ensues.”  Esme grimaces.

“So, it really is you.  It’s still a lot to get my head around.  You’ve had this whole life.”  Esme smiles her appreciation.

Taking a breath, Esme asks, “Questions.  How did you choose who you saved?  Knowing the future, you could have saved a lot of lives from tragedies.  Also, why do you have a gun and a silencer?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“I can’t eat food anymore.  Violent vomiting ensues.”  Esme grimaces.</p><p>“So, it really is you.  It’s still a lot to get my head around.  You’ve had this whole life.”  Esme smiles her appreciation.</p><p>Taking a breath, Esme asks, “Questions.  How did you choose who you saved?  Knowing the future, you could have saved a lot of lives from tragedies.  Also, why do you have a gun and a silencer?”</p>

Kiele leans over and hugs Ms. Lin tightly. “Oh my god, I was right? It was a crazy idea based on things that were said! We’re so sorry you got left! Does that mean the Yayoi here is Switchblade? Is she really still a teenager? How are you so calm about this?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele leans over and hugs Ms. Lin tightly. “Oh my god, I was right? It was a crazy idea based on things that were said! We’re so sorry you got left! Does that mean the Yayoi here is Switchblade? Is she really still a teenager? How are you so calm about this?”</p>

The can of knock-off brand prongles, regardless, is placed onto the table after a deft gesture of the arm. Like a stubborn Russian grandmother, there is no denying the willpower of this Outsider. Equivalent(?) exchange at its finest. Hard to find food, for... 'Hard to find food'.

Of course... The story behind the can goes unsung. Its origins a mystery.

""Octopus? I've never tried it. But if you're offering..."" Aedi plays coy with the mystery unfolding. The true mystery, and not some zany knock-off. A blink, passes, as the frenzied questions start.

""... That means there's around six Yayois somewhere along the timeline. ... I think."" Comes the curious response from Aedi. A slow blink, as they squint at the pressed octopus, curiously, ""With three, now, minimum. One of which being Switchblade. The odds of the one here being the one you want is better than the one you don't."" They blink, as if doing mental math-- And in some odd and bizarre way trying to offer comfort.

""Dunno. Stuff like this is why I left New Mex. Makes my head hurt."" They shrug their shoulders. ""But like... It'd be best to be calm about this, right?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The can of knock-off brand prongles, regardless, is placed onto the table after a deft gesture of the arm. Like a stubborn Russian grandmother, there is no denying the willpower of this Outsider. Equivalent(?) exchange at its finest. Hard to find food, for... 'Hard to find food'.</p><p><em>Of course... The story behind the can goes unsung. Its origins a mystery.</em></p><p>""<strong>Octopus? I've never tried it. But if you're offering...</strong>"" Aedi plays coy with the mystery unfolding. The true mystery, and not some zany knock-off. A blink, passes, as the frenzied questions start.</p><p>""<strong>... That means there's around six Yayois somewhere along the timeline. ... I think.</strong>"" Comes the <em>curious </em>response from Aedi. A slow blink, as they squint at the pressed octopus, curiously, ""<strong>With three, now, minimum. One of which being Switchblade. The odds of the one here being the one you want is better than the one you don't.</strong>"" They blink, as if doing mental math-- And in some odd and bizarre way trying to offer comfort.</p><p>""<strong>Dunno. Stuff like this is why I left New Mex. Makes my head hurt.</strong>"" They shrug their shoulders. ""<strong>But like... It'd be best to be calm about this, right?</strong>""</p>

""I'm sorry about the food.  But if it makes you feel any better, most westerners don't recognise pressed octopus as food.  I chose who I saved the same way you do:  opportunity and ability.  And I didn't know the future.  I knew a future.  I prevented all the tragedy I could, mitigated a few, failed to do damn thing in too many.""  Lin sighs.  ""Caused one or two because I didn't understand the situation as well as I thought I did.  You know, human stuff.""

""I knew Switchblade had a plan to take my place in the school.  I was prepared several ways to deal with it.  Nuwa has the silencer.  It is illegal, and the school already has enough legal problems.  I assume you guys told her about it.  Which is fine.  I shouldn't have let myself get talking into accepting it.""

""I didn't know what she'd be like when I finally met her again.  When she told me that she wanted to be Yayoi, I didn't think she meant it as literally.  She's worked, is working, really hard to not become Switchblade.  I'm not sure she's not dangerous, but I'm sure she wants to be not dangerous.""

Lin accepts Kiele's hug happily and returns it.

""She isn't Switchblade.  She was Switchblade in a future that hopefully will never come to pass.  She somehow rolled back the clock, on her body, on her past.  All those things she did now, are only in her memories.""

""As to how I can be so calm, I've had a while to work through it.  There are still some bad nights.  But I learned a lot about dealing with trauma from Holbeck, in the short time I was here before.  So, it's like any chronic condition.  You just get through the bad nights.""

""I missed you guys a lot.  I don't know that I would have recovered from Hobart without you.""

Lin breaks the seal on the octopus and hands it to Aedi.  ""Don't feel like you have to pretend you like it, if you don't.  I don't know about other Yayois.  Six, you say?""  Yayoi winces.  ""We should form a volleyball team.""

you have to pretend you like it, if you don't.  I don't know about other Yayois.  Six, you say?""  Yayoi winces.  ""We should form a volleyball team.""</p>

The metal arms of Esme’s chair bend and buckle under her hands with a creaking sound.  She stands up and starts pacing the office, muttering to herself.

Esme turns to Ms. Lin and asks, her voice breaking, “Why didn’t you tell my parents not to have me?  You could have saved my Mom and all those people my Dad killed.  That’s all I ever wanted in my whole life and you could have fixed it!”  

Esme feels so overwhelmed, she just leans heavily against the wall, looking like a puppet with its strings cut.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The metal arms of Esme’s chair bend and buckle under her hands with a creaking sound.  She stands up and starts pacing the office, muttering to herself.</p><p>Esme turns to Ms. Lin and asks, her voice breaking, “Why didn’t you tell my parents not to have me?  You could have saved my Mom and all those people my Dad killed.  That’s all I ever wanted in my whole life and you could have fixed it!”  </p><p>Esme feels so overwhelmed, she just leans heavily against the wall, looking like a puppet with its strings cut.</p>

Blinks a bit, tilting their head, ""If everything was a slurry, we'd be phasing in and out of existence. That'd be... Confusing. I think things mended between points. If the deck was stacked... There could be duplicates, or not."" A shrug of the shoulder, as they reach out, and taste the octopus.

... There's something familiar to the taste. Something that makes Aedi pause in appreciation. Their teeth take a while to chew it, and for a moment, it might register as disgust, or maybe some developmental problems with chewy substances. ""Never tasted anything like it before."" Comes the response, favorable, it seems, with a thumbs-up. However...

""But she chose not to do that, right?"" A blink, seemingly information has to register a little while, as Esme speaks. They stop laying on their knowledge, and slump back into ignorance, floating a bit horizontal at this point, practically glitching gravity, ""It probably means that she values you for your struggles, even if she could do it. I mean... The timelines converged. You are the crucible of you.""

A blink, though, as their eyes slowly meander on over to Ms. Lin, ""I mean, Ms. Lin probably loves you dudes a ton more than some people get to feel in their lives. From what she's saying.""

From what she's saying.</strong>""</p>

Kiele stares at Esme in anguish, her heart breaking. She’s completely at a loss.

When Aedi speaks, she looks at them in appreciation.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele stares at Esme in anguish, her heart breaking. She’s completely at a loss.</p><p>When Aedi speaks, she looks at them in appreciation. </p>

""It was slightly more complicated than that, Aedi,"" Lin says.  ""Did I try to keep your mom from having you, Emse?  No, I didn't.  But I did try to keep you from killing your mom.  There were some gene therapies available in Japan that weren't approved in the US yet.  I tried to convince your parents to look into it.  I had to be careful, though, because your father did not take advice readily from strangers, especially on very private matters.  I had to be very indirect, with limited resources, and hope for the best.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""It was <em>slightly</em> more complicated than that, Aedi,"" Lin says.  ""Did I try to keep your mom from having you, Emse?  No, I didn't.  But I did try to keep you from killing your mom.  There were some gene therapies available in Japan that weren't approved in the US yet.  I tried to convince your parents to look into it.  I had to be careful, though, because your father did not take advice readily from strangers, especially on very private matters.  I had to be very indirect, with limited resources, and hope for the best.""</p>

Could I be responsible for Kiele not being born, if there was another way?  After struggling with her thoughts, Esme nods and gives a hollow-sounding “Okay.”

“You saw another way.  It just didn’t work.  Thanks for trying.”  Esme’s words are flat, though they seem genuine.

She sits back down in the damaged chair, looking down at her hands.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Could I be responsible for Kiele not being born, if there was another way?</span></em>  After struggling with her thoughts, Esme nods and gives a hollow-sounding “Okay.”</p><p>“You saw another way.  It just didn’t work.  Thanks for trying.”  Esme’s words are flat, though they seem genuine.</p><p>She sits back down in the damaged chair, looking down at her hands.</p>

Lin nods.  ""One of the most humbling things was to realise that knowledge was not enough.  I actually got myself on a watch list because I tried to warn people about 9/11.  But some crazy Japanese computer nerd warning about a conspiracy?  I didn't know any of the names of the people involved, didn't know what countries they had come from, didn't even remember the airlines of the planes they'd hijacked.  There was no way to check.  I couldn't look at the news that day.  I did do some good.  I reported the faulty fire alarm system in PS 131, a week before the fire.  So that...never happened.  And you guys have no idea what I'm talking about.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Lin nods.  ""One of the most humbling things was to realise that knowledge was not enough.  I actually got myself on a watch list because I tried to warn people about 9/11.  But some crazy Japanese computer nerd warning about a conspiracy?  I didn't know any of the names of the people involved, didn't know what countries they had come from, didn't even remember the airlines of the planes they'd hijacked.  There was no way to check.  I couldn't look at the news that day.  I did do some good.  I reported the faulty fire alarm system in PS 131, a week before the fire.  So that...never happened.  And you guys have no idea what I'm talking about.""</p>

""(Things long since set in motion are hard to change on your own. Even little victories are better than absolute zero.)"" The thought encroaches in the back of Ms. Lin's skull. The sender quite obvious, the 'thoughts' inner voice simply Aedi's normal talking voice. Keeping that line of thought private. Allowing their eyes to scan across the room. Confusedly, for a moment.

First to the monstrous tree-woman, with a sidelong look, ""I mean... You both seem close."" “Yeah!” Kiele nods vigorously at Aedi, then looks back at Esme. “And without you here, just think: Yayoi would have never recovered from Hobart, right?” Kiele kneels down and reaches over to take Esme’s hand. “Without you, I would have been a hulking plant monster, isolated from everyone. I would have tried to punch Amanda through the wall on like the second day of school. I’d probably have been shunned, or maybe suspended, and not willing to talk with the weird new girl!”

“Without you, Amanda would have never agreed to meet with 19 or give her a chance and 19 would have spent all her time in the pool or under her bed, and she wouldn’t have had time to spend with Yayoi either!” A green tear slides down Kiele’s cheek. 

“Who’s left? Mark? He was too fixated on Tali and Dean. Dean? Pfft. Amanda?!” She gives a sort of frantic bark of laughter as another tear, and then another make jade trails down her face. “So there’s like a paradox loop! Plus... plus... plus I would have destroyed Maui when I rampaged out of control, becoming some sort of angry leviathan! How many people would have died there!?”

Eyes overflowing with a steady stream of chlorophyl tears, Kiele is barely able to hold back sobs. She clutches Esme’s hands desperately. “Your life has meaning! Your death won’t change things! It won’t save any more people! Don’t! Don’t do this! Please!” She drops her head, covered in wilting, pale leaves, onto Esme’s lap, and cries. “Pluh-uh-uh-ese...”

Esme nods to Aedi, “I try very hard to live a good life, no matter what.”

It’s hard to breathe as Kiele extols her virtues and the differences she’s made.  The tears come and she leans down, pressing her face against the back of Kiele’s head, stroking her shoulders, neck and face.

“I’m not doing anything Kiele.  I don’t have a time machine. I do want to live, a long time.  But, I’m not more deserving than all of my father’s victims.  It was just hard hearing of something I’ve dreamed about and hear it came to naught.  I’m still here and I’m still yours.”

She kisses Kiele’s ear.  “I’m still here.”

“I’m sorry, I should trust you. I’m trying. I’m sorry. I’m sorry.”

“I have a folder on my phone.  It has pictures, names, other info, about all the people my Dad has killed since my Mother’s death.  My Uncle and Aunt.  Two hundred and fourteen other people with lives and futures of their own.  Just that I know about.  Some John and Jane Does, including young children, too damaged by fire for identification.  I think they are the hardest.”

Esme sighs, petting Kiele lovingly. “I’ve lived with the knowledge of my coming death for six years.  I guess it’s easier to accept if at least I think I’ll accomplish something with it.  I’m sorry if you can’t understand it, Kiele.  But, maybe it’s better if you don’t?  I want you to be immersed in life.  Just enjoy the moment, like Aedi says.  We have now.”

The sensations of Esme’s touches and pets spreads warmth throughout Kiele’s upper body. She quiets down under the soothing touch.

“Okay,” she says, a little muffled but not moving. “Now. We have now. The future isn’t set. Switchblade became Yayoi. And we have less control over the future than we think. But here and now...”

She sniffs.

“Sorry, I stained your skirt. Sorry for making a scene. Sorry Aedi and Ms. Lin. Crying makes my one lung hurt.”

She goes quiet for a bit. Shifts slightly right and then left. 

“I... I can’t actually... I’ve grown into you and the chair,” she says apologetically. Strong roots from her torso, shoulders, and scalp have wrapped around Esme and the chair. Little pink blooms of embarrassment bud along the back of her head and neck.

Esme laughs.  “I really like how you carry on a conversation while my girlfriend is fused to my lap. It’s impressive.  One second.”  

She kisses Kiele’s cheek and then transforms into water.  Rather than falling to the floor, the warm water traverses up the roots in streams and rivulets, finding cracks and crevasses to pass in towards what is left of Kiele’s original form.  Sliding along her body from head to foot before spilling out onto the floor and reforming as a girl, free of her wooden constraints.  Esme reaches to where Kiele is wrapped around the chair and Esme’s fingers wither away the ends where they connect in relatively short order, the sensation passing up the root like warm, needy kisses all along Kiele’s upper body.

“Better?”  She helps Kiele up.  “Yes, I’m leader now.  It’s hard on me, I fret over everything.  Blame myself.”  She shrugs.

LSD, Aedi. LSD.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A few pointedly confused blinks, are directed Kiele's way, ""<strong>I mean like... Could've been someone hitting the uh.</strong>"" A blink, ""<strong>LCD, right?</strong>""</p><p><em>LSD, Aedi. LSD.</em></p>

“LCD? Oh, you mean LSD? Not unless it makes you physically turn into an alien. Apparently he was here to evaluate our species or something? Mark talked to him a lot and he somehow got put into a room with Talise. I think becuase he was fireproof.”

She looks questioningly at Esme. “He only was here a couple days. I think something happened and he got called back? I know aliens are, like, a weird idea. But I’m a tree and she’s a vampire so weird ideas are kinda par for the course here.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“LCD? Oh, you mean LSD? Not unless it makes you physically turn into an alien. Apparently he was here to evaluate our species or something? Mark talked to him a lot and he somehow got put into a room with Talise. I think becuase he was fireproof.”</p><p>She looks questioningly at Esme. “He only was here a couple days. I think something happened and he got called back? I know aliens are, like, a weird idea. But I’m a tree and she’s a vampire so weird ideas are kinda par for the course here.”</p>

Accepting Ms. Lin’s reasoning and being unaffected by the results are two different things.  Esme pushed it aside in an instinctual response to Kiele’s grief.  She knows she still has to deal with it on a deeper level.  Or do I?  What’s the point?  I’m stuck with things as they are, both the bad and the good.  No use crying over spilt milk.

Esme takes Kiele’s hand and puts it around her waist, wanting the comfort of being close to her.

“Maybe after meeting Dean, he decided we weren’t ready.” Esme smiles and then, almost in spite of herself, giggles.  

“He certainly seemed to be an alien.  And, why not?  It’s a big universe.  I can’t believe Earth is unique in hosting life.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Accepting Ms. Lin’s reasoning and being unaffected by the results are two different things.  Esme pushed it aside in an instinctual response to Kiele’s grief.  She knows she still has to deal with it on a deeper level.  <em><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Or do I?  What’s the point?  I’m stuck with things as they are, both the bad and the good.  No use crying over spilt milk</span></em>.</p><p>Esme takes Kiele’s hand and puts it around her waist, wanting the comfort of being close to her.</p><p>“Maybe after meeting Dean, he decided we weren’t ready.” Esme smiles and then, almost in spite of herself, giggles.  </p><p>“He certainly seemed to be an alien.  And, why not?  It’s a big universe.  I can’t believe Earth is unique in hosting life.”</p>

Kiele willingly moves closer to Esme when her arm is pulled. The hand around her waist grips her firmly, and Kiele wraps the other across Esme’s shoulders, eagerly seeking the trickle of sensation. She snorts in amusement at the comment about Dean. 

“Well, anyway, he’s been gone for a while. So you don’t have to worry about aliens Aedi, at least for now.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele willingly moves closer to Esme when her arm is pulled. The hand around her waist grips her firmly, and Kiele wraps the other across Esme’s shoulders, eagerly seeking the trickle of sensation. She snorts in amusement at the comment about Dean. </p><p>“Well, anyway, he’s been gone for a while. So you don’t have to worry about aliens Aedi, at least for now.”</p>

Blinks, very much parsing the information given to them. A tilt of the head, seemingly, however, a bit bewildered with a twinge of curiosity, ""Huh. Cool. Like the greenos?""

Glancing between Esme and Kiele however, they don't really have much else to say, aside from a simple question, ""Never seen Dean around. What's he do again?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Blinks, very much parsing the information given to them. A tilt of the head, seemingly, however, a bit bewildered with a twinge of curiosity, ""<strong>Huh. Cool. Like the greenos?</strong>""</p><p>Glancing between Esme and Kiele however, they don't really have much else to say, aside from a simple question, ""<strong>Never seen Dean around. What's he do again?</strong>""</p>

Not sure, who the greenos are supposed to be, Esme doesn’t respond to that question.

“As far as I can tell, Dean mostly causes trouble.  He has some great illusion powers and pretty cool teleport powers too.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Not sure, who the greenos are supposed to be, Esme doesn’t respond to that question.</p><p>“As far as I can tell, Dean mostly causes trouble.  He has some great illusion powers and pretty cool teleport powers too.”</p>
""Huh?"" Comes the response from Aedi. A blink of the eyes, almost non-comprehending, ""Oh, like. Uh."" A glance to the side for the moment, ""Those inflatable green dudes.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""<strong>Huh?</strong>"" Comes the response from Aedi. A blink of the eyes, almost non-comprehending, ""<strong>Oh, like. Uh.</strong>"" A glance to the side for the moment, ""<strong>Those inflatable green dudes.</strong>""</p>
Kiele squints slightly at Aedi in bafflement.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kiele squints slightly at Aedi in bafflement. </p>

Dean lies on the couch for a moment, considering how he's going to say the apology and how he can make it as hard to avoid problems when they inevitably arise. Having spent some time straightening up the place, more specifically making the bed and ensuring that things look more or less how they did before he left.

Looking over to a nearby table, he sees the metal stimulator that's now rendered useless by himself making what he can assume to be a full recovery. He grasps one of the metal limbs, he tries to figure out just how it does actually work, now that he doesn't have to just rely on it as it were a crutch.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dean lies on the couch for a moment, considering how he's going to say the apology and how he can make it as hard to avoid problems when they inevitably arise. Having spent some time straightening up the place, more specifically making the bed and ensuring that things look more or less how they did before he left. <br><br>Looking over to a nearby table, he sees the metal stimulator that's now rendered useless by himself making what he can assume to be a full recovery. He grasps one of the metal limbs, he tries to figure out just how it does actually work, now that he doesn't have to just rely on it as it were a crutch.</p>

Around ten in the evening, Dean hears the beep as the motion detector is triggered, and then another series of beeps as someone works the keep pad to unlock the door.  They'll be inside in seconds.  What do you do?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Around ten in the evening, Dean hears the beep as the motion detector is triggered, and then another series of beeps as someone works the keep pad to unlock the door.  They'll be inside in seconds.  What do you do?""</p>

Standing upwards at hearing the beeps, he leaves behind an illusion that remains seated at the couch as he teleports into a nearby room. He proceeds to wait behind a wall as he listens in on who could be entering this safe house. Knowing that his trail is relatively clear, he figures that it could be an actual excelsior member, but best to not take chances.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Standing upwards at hearing the beeps, he leaves behind an illusion that remains seated at the couch as he teleports into a nearby room. He proceeds to wait behind a wall as he listens in on who could be entering this safe house. Knowing that his trail is relatively clear, he figures that it could be an actual excelsior member, but best to not take chances.</p>

The door opens, someone enters and moves to the kitchen, switching on lights as they go.  The smell of onions and cabbage wafts to Dean.  Suddenly, a male voice exclaims.  ""ебать свою маму! What the hell are you doing here?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The door opens, someone enters and moves to the kitchen, switching on lights as they go.  The smell of onions and cabbage wafts to Dean.  Suddenly, a male voice exclaims.  ""ебать свою маму!  What the hell are you doing here?""</p>

The illusion waves toward the man, giving a smile toward where he thinks he is, ""So, firstly I'm gonna say, 'Hello stranger.' Secondly, I'm going to add that people know I'm here. So... don't assume I broke in."" He says the illusion tries to mimic having smelled something bad, showing some awkward expression as he tries to make it seem like it's playing cool.

Dean doesn't peek around the corner, instead relying entirely on sound, forcing the illusion to look down at the table so it doesn't have to look at anyone in particular.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The illusion waves toward the man, giving a smile toward where he thinks he is, ""<strong>So, firstly I'm gonna say, 'Hello stranger.' Secondly, I'm going to add that people know I'm here. So... don't assume I broke in.</strong>"" He says the illusion tries to mimic having smelled something bad, showing some awkward expression as he tries to make it seem like it's playing cool.<br><br>Dean doesn't peek around the corner, instead relying entirely on sound, forcing the illusion to look down at the table so it doesn't have to look at anyone in particular.</p>

""Yeah, shit, that makes it worse.  If you broke in, I could count on you a little to stay quiet.  Now?""  Codex shrugs.  Dean doesn't know him well, but the slavic shrug has a particular rhythm, so Dean doesn't need to see him to know.  ""I'm making kapusniak, sour cabbage soup, just like my grandmother used to make it.  Which wasn't very good; neither one of us are good cooks.  There will be enough to share, but if you wish to make unpleasant comment about smell, just assume I've heard it before.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Yeah, shit, that makes it worse.  If you broke in, I could count on you a little to stay quiet.  Now?""  Codex shrugs.  Dean doesn't know him well, but the slavic shrug has a particular rhythm, so Dean doesn't need to see him to know.  ""I'm making <em>kapusniak</em>, sour cabbage soup, just like my grandmother used to make it.  Which wasn't very good; neither one of us are good cooks.  There will be enough to share, but if you wish to make unpleasant comment about smell, just assume I've heard it before.""</p>

Dean stops for a moment, moving out into the open as he lets the illusion go away, ""Uh... well I gotta now ask... What are you doing here? Aside from... Kap....."" Doesn't even attempt a pronounciation given that he doesn't want to butcher it, instead just mimicking what he just heard Codex say it's name was.

""Were you followed?"" He asks Codex, figuring the answer is no, he pauses once more, ""Wait, don't answer that. You know Ramparts pissed at you, right?""

""Rampart is going to kill me.  Is just a question of when.  I'm here to eat, sleep, shower, and no, you can't ask what else.  If the person who knows you're here him, then I am truly fucked.""

He shakes his head, before he gives a laugh, ""Well, that makes two of us. I walked out on him, didn't like hearing him say I should judge the others at the school. Oh, I do also got..."" He says as he wanders over to the couch, pulling out from behind the bottle of Ouzo, Sets it onto the table as he takes a seat on the couch, ""The person I know is Nuwa, I bit the bullet and convinced her to take me back. Lot of conditions, but... I go back tomorrow.""

""Congratulations.  Haha, jokes on all of us.  He hates all mutants.  He was probably going to kill us all, regardless, when we weren't useful anymore.  If you do decide to sabotage school security for him, say good bye to the people there you like first.""  He picks up a small bottle of vodka from the bags on the kitchen table.  ""I bring my own. Essential part of all Tscharkovsky recipes, which may be why they don't turn out so well.""

""I didn't ever intend to do it, the server thing, which in hindsight was probably not a good idea if I went back and admitted that to an anti-mutant.""

""Good to know that you didn't intend to do it.  I arranged some safeguards in case you did.  But like I said, he was probably going to kill you regardless.  Sauvage and DJ don't believe me.  I think Flashdance may have known who Rampart was, because she didn't stay long after he came along. Beard and turtleneck, like alternate dimension Spock.  Never good sign.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Good to know that you didn't intend to do it.  I arranged some safeguards in case you did.  But like I said, he was probably going to kill you regardless.  Sauvage and DJ don't believe me.  I think Flashdance may have known who Rampart was, because she didn't stay long after he came along. Beard and turtleneck, like alternate dimension Spock.  Never good sign.""</p>

Dean nods in response, ""I actually was gonna suggest to someone to improve security, but... well... you got it."" He gives a very faint chuckle, ""So, what are you gonna do? Just wander around so he can't find you or are you gonna try and figure out something?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dean nods in response, ""<strong>I actually was gonna suggest to someone to improve security, but... well... you got it.</strong>"" He gives a very faint chuckle, ""<strong>So, what are you gonna do? Just wander around so he can't find you or are you gonna try and figure out something?</strong>""</p>
""No.  He will never give up until he kills me.  I made sure of that.  Now I have to make sure that it happens on my terms.""  Codex shrugs and fills a big pot with water.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""No.  He will never give up until he kills me.  I made sure of that.  Now I have to make sure that it happens on my terms.""  Codex shrugs and fills a big pot with water.</p>

Dean shakes his head at the comments, ""What if you could stop it? Find a way to literally stop him, maybe not for good, but...?"" He trails off as he seems to consider a few things about the situation.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dean shakes his head at the comments, ""<strong>What if you could stop it? Find a way to literally stop him, maybe not for good, but...?</strong>"" He trails off as he seems to consider a few things about the situation.</p>

""I have plan, thanks,"" Codex says in neutral tone.  ""Not so useless.  Power armour, technopath.  He may be surprised at the way things turn out.  I have things, obligations.  I can't let him interfere.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I have plan, thanks,"" Codex says in neutral tone.  ""Not so useless.  Power armour, technopath.  He may be surprised at the way things turn out.  I have things, obligations.  I can't let him interfere.""</p>

""Yea, but what if it doesn't turn out well at all? Guy without powers gets good at having backup plans if he deals with powered people on a regular basis, let alone criminals with powers."" He shrugs toward Codex, ""Mind if I ask what the idea is? Figure if it works I'd have something to try if I come across him as well.""

""Simple.  I give the man what he wants.  The details are...technical.  Would only bore you.  But you understand, you are illusionist and con man.  Is that offensive term?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Simple.  I give the man what he wants.  The details are...technical.  Would only bore you.  But you understand, you are illusionist and con man.  Is that offensive term?""</p>

He tilts his head as he seems lost, ""Give him what he wants? And no, it's not offensive, those are just two facts."" Dean leans forward in the seat, setting the stimulator on the small table in front of the couch.

column3: Comprehension (Aftermath of For the Greater Good...)

column4: What takes 30 minutes, turns into an hour as a group of people surround the outside of Mrs. Bentely's house as they seem upset about what had transpired. Just as you begin to hear police siren's, the sound is subsided by the sound of some black vans and some trucks moving around the building as men in black suits and uniform begin to push the crowd away. A black Sedan moves in on the road towards the incoming fuzz' car as you all see it is none other than Agent Red talking to the officer, as he flashes his own badge and waves the officer woman away. Soon enough a base is set up within the house with some security along with medical support to over look the party of their wounds and take Asha and Lucy for some needed medical care along with the others.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-279707""><div class=""row"">

After the group has been looked over and are able to walk (except for Asha), the team is brought together in the living room where Mrs. Bentley held her party that night as Agent Red walks into the room where you all are sitting as he flips around his sunglasses before he speaks.

""Snooping around, collecting information on those who you shouldn't have been doing so, causing a ruckus in a peaceful town. Placing your own teammates in the line of fire without negotiating terms with a homicidal old lady.""

Agent Red says as he takes a seat,

""Normally, I would be telling you how much of this is going to be on the news and me having to explain to the Governor of California about what happened.""

""Luckily, I don't have to.""

For a moment, chuckles as he looks to Riley,

""Agent Byrne, as much as this would be for you to clean up and speaking to the press about this incident. You seem to have brought something which could be a great value to the Agency. I know, shocking.""

Agent Red speaks bluntly,

""From what you have reported, I guess I can bring out my old dice bag and Gary Gygax books to play, cause this is some interesting read you and your team has found.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>After the group has been looked over and are able to walk (except for Asha), the team is brought together in the living room where Mrs. Bentley held her party that night as Agent Red walks into the room where you all are sitting as he flips around his sunglasses before he speaks.</p><p>""Snooping around, collecting information on those who you shouldn't have been doing so, causing a ruckus in a peaceful town. Placing your own teammates in the line of fire without negotiating terms with a homicidal old lady.""</p><p>Agent Red says as he takes a seat,</p><p>""Normally, I would be telling you how much of this is going to be on the news and me having to explain to the Governor of California about what happened.""</p><p>""Luckily, I don't have to.""</p><p>For a moment, chuckles as he looks to Riley,</p><p>""Agent Byrne, as much as this would be for you to clean up and speaking to the press about this incident. You seem to have brought something which could be a great value to the Agency. I know, shocking.""</p><p>Agent Red speaks bluntly,</p><p>""From what you have reported, I guess I can bring out my old dice bag and Gary Gygax books to play, cause this is some interesting read you and your team has found.""</p>

What Wynn wants to say:

It's a good thing we received multiple warnings against excessive force, because those fish monsters were push overs and Mrs. Bentley totally didn't overpower two women who know how to handle themselves and nearly kill one of them.  If Asha had died, it totally wouldn't have been on you, Red, for making us double think ourselves in every dangerous situation.  So, our faith you in as a boss remains at an all time high.

.

What Wynn says:

<whispering>:  Riley, we need to talk.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>What Wynn wants to say:</p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""><em>It's a good thing we received multiple warnings against excessive force, because those fish monsters were push overs and Mrs. Bentley totally didn't overpower two women who know how to handle themselves and nearly kill one of them.  If Asha had died, it totally wouldn't have been on you, Red, for making us double think ourselves in every dangerous situation.  So, our faith you in as a boss remains at an all time high.</em></p><p>.</p><p>What Wynn says:</p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""><whispering>:  Riley, we need to talk.</p>

Agent Byrne doesn’t look at Wynn but taps her foot lightly under the table with her own... a gesture that most likely signifies ‘Yes I heard you... kind of busy now... just wait a sec’.

She can’t bear to look Wynn in the eyes. She doesn’t want to think about the fact that she wouldn’t change that call she made... Even if it had been Wynn that Mrs. Bentley had had her knife up against. Unless it had been Sarah, she still wouldn’t hesitate to make that same decision.

It was the right call, and she hated herself for making it, for knowing she would always make that hard call.

“Sir... with all do respect... we are not to blame for this. We did the best anyone could under the circumstances. I made the best decision I could under the circumstances. We had no idea what kind of power we were dealing with. We investigated and found horrific amphibious monsters that attacked... how were we to not cause a “ruckus” again? Should we just have given up and died Sir? That old lady you think we should have negotiated with? She turned that poor girl’s mother into one of those monsters and was sucking the life out of that child! Hell, she managed to subdue two trained, strong, healthy and formidable women! I had to end that threat when she wouldn’t back down...  I had no idea what she was capable of in that moment.” Riley explains logically.

“When you’re dealing with an unknown threat with that kind of capacity and.. ruthless viciousness, you have to act immediately as you can, to take your shot or you risk higher loses than just the one person she was threatening. That’s what YOU and Agent Silver taught me. There is no negotiation in a situation like that! That an agent sometimes has to make tough decisions, and I will defend this one sir. If Ms. Hajjar and Ms. Wolfgang, who I’ll remind you both she and you told me that she would be responsible for, had WAITED just a few minutes for us to arrive or called in with me and met up with our team that was RIGHT there instead of trying to go in by themselves without any backup they wouldn’t have even BEEN in that situation in the first place.” Agent Byrne says, taking a deep breath as she rubs her temples in stress, this has obviously taken its toll on her. She sighs and continues, putting her hands back down by her sides. She had done her job, she hated what she had had to choose, but she had done it.

“That book... if you ask me you should burn it, not play around with it. It’s not something I’d like to see weaponized, even by our side.” Her hands tighten and unclench and clench again nervously, her jaw tense, the only signs of her frustration and anxiety.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Agent Byrne doesn’t look at Wynn but taps her foot lightly under the table with her own... a gesture that most likely signifies ‘Yes I heard you... kind of busy now... just wait a sec’.</p><p>She can’t bear to look Wynn in the eyes. She doesn’t want to think about the fact that she wouldn’t change that call she made... Even if it had been Wynn that Mrs. Bentley had had her knife up against. Unless it had been Sarah, she still wouldn’t hesitate to make that same decision.</p><p>It was the right call, and she hated herself for making it, for knowing she would always make that hard call.</p><p>“<strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);"">Sir... with all do respect... we are not to blame for this. We did the best anyone could under the circumstances. I made the best decision I could under the circumstances. We had no idea what kind of power we were dealing with. We investigated and found horrific amphibious monsters that attacked... how were we to not cause a “ruckus” again? Should we just have given up and died Sir? That old lady you think we should have negotiated with? She turned that poor girl’s mother into one of those monsters and was sucking the life out of that child! Hell, she managed to subdue two trained, strong, healthy and formidable women! I </span></strong><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);"">had to end that threat when she wouldn’t back down...  I had no idea what she was capable of in that moment.</span></strong>” Riley explains logically.</p><p>“<strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);"">When you’re dealing with an unknown threat with that kind of capacity and.. ruthless viciousness, you have to act immediately as you can, to take your shot</span></strong><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);""> or you risk higher loses than just the one person she was threatening. </span></strong><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);"">That’s what YOU and Agent Silver taught me. There is no negotiation in a situation like that! That an agent sometimes has to make tough decisions, and I will defend this one sir. If Ms. Hajjar and Ms. Wolfgang, who I’ll remind you both she and you told me that she would be responsible for, had WAITED just a few minutes for us to arrive or called in with me and met up with our team that was RIGHT there instead of trying to go in by themselves without any backup they wouldn’t have even BEEN in that situation in the first place.</span></strong>” Agent Byrne says, taking a deep breath as she rubs her temples in stress, this has obviously taken its toll on her. She sighs and continues, putting her hands back down by her sides. She had done her job, she hated what she had had to choose, but she had done it.</p><p>“<strong><span style=""color: rgb(63, 49, 81);""><span style=""color: rgb(79, 97, 40);"">That book... if you ask me you should burn it, not play around with it. It’s not something I’d like to see weaponized, even by our side.</span></span></strong>” Her hands tighten and unclench and clench again nervously, her jaw tense, the only signs of her frustration and anxiety.</p>

“I believe your superior was trying to congratulate you, yet you take it as a insult. How will you ever learn to take a compliment.” A cold but serious voice says as a man in a black suit walks in from the kitchen as he easily stares down to Riley.

“Agent Blue, you seem to have brought yourself all the way from Headquarters, to what do we owe the honor?”

Agent Blue stands as he looks to Agent Red and nods before he proceeds.

“That book you found is now of Private Property, burning it will be considered treason, if I mind you. Something of this quality should not be taken so lightly.”

Riley, you know Agent Blue is of the highest ranking member of the Agency as his known to be a man who gets the job done, not by the ethical way but ones which he deems fitting to a task.

Kara stands in the back of the group, silent, taking things in.

Why was she here in this room watching spies argue about the right way to deal with terrible magic? Why had she peered into that car? Why hadn't she just walked away? 

She looked down at her bare arms, imagined them changing, transforming into hideous, scaled, clawed things like Maggie's had been. Then she can't think about that anymore, so she stops.

Instead, she focuses. Whatever's happening here is bad - real bad. The fish monsters are bad, Bentley's book is bad, and some of the people in this room are clearly bad too. If she pays attention, maybe she can do something to help...whoever isn't bad.

Assuming she isn't about to be disappeared. She can't picture Riley, Ross or Wynn turning a gun on her, but they clearly aren't in charge here. Another reason to stay quiet.

""Because that book, you all just found. Now belongs to one of our Investors who pays for your salary Agent Bryne. So I would suggest you or the rest of your buddy pals to not ruin your reputation you have built up already.""

Agent Blue says holding out a hand notebook in one hand as he looks at it for a moment as he continues,

""If anything, this will simply be chalked up to some punk kids who came into this woman's house and shot her. End of story, file a report and we can get onto some more important business, like your case Agent Bryne.""

""It so happens, the Board is close to making their verdict on your case with the Texas Arsonist  in the State, which does not look good on your behalf.""

""However, I am able to bring about this to be a mistrial, though that will be something which will come at a price.""

That scene of seeing Asha's neck being cut was something which would bring her discomfort and something to add to her life, since she had feelings for her boss. Though she knew the world was cruel, but in some fashion, there was some goodness in there as well.

“Sir... what do you mean by price?” Her face is now more placid and professional except for a slightly concerned hint to it.

Agent Blue comments,

“Since we work on a tight budget we take donations from other foundations to keep our operations funded for the fiscal year.”

""I will get the necessary paperwork to you before you leave, and thank you for the opportunity.  May I add however, you should be pinning a metal on Agent Byrne here, but instead you are talking about misdemeanors and squabbling?  Are you fucking kidding me?  Wipe that shit under the rug already, we are a damn family and this lady fucking saved this whole god-forsaken town, and countless others I am sure. But that's all she says; she's still acutely aware of being out of her depth. She keeps her arms crossed and watches to see what the others will do now - particularly Riley.

“Ms. Wolfgang...?”

""I'm gonna teach you some stuff, and get you a gun.  That is, if you want to hang around and help us out, like a consultant...""

""Don't speak, I'm sure that cut around your neck is still new. I know for sure its hell to speak.""

As she grabs her note pad and pencil she had those agents return to her or pretty much end up with a bloody nose for not giving her back her own property as she hands them both over to Asha.

""Just use this to say what you want. Don't worry I can get another note pad later.""

""Hang around...?"" 

Kara frowns. She hasn't given much thought to the future yet. And when she does, her mind goes blank. None of her plans, none of her dreams, accounted for a world where people turn into fish monsters, where kindly old women sacrifice children for magic powers. 

She knows she can't just go back, can't just go back to assisting GPs down at the clinic. She definitely doesn't trust this agency, but right now she doesn't have any other options. And these people seem alright, at least. 

So she nods slowly. ""Thanks,"" she tells Ross. ""I'd like that. Assuming it's ok with Riley. Er, and the people with the color names.""

A bit more relaxed, he raises a curious eyebrow while offering a slight grin. ""Hey Riley! What's gonna happen with Sarah?""

Make a post for your feeding attempt. I will keep the top most post (this one) updated with the stats I use for your rolls (so you can verify that all bonuses get in). I will do a single post response if the feeding attempt ""just resolves"". if it results in a scene, I'll create it and we can proceed from there. Reminder: You just describe your plan of feeding and I'll make a roll for you, using a different RPG system with custom dice. 

East Passyunk Social Difficulty 3

Presence 4

Socialize 3

Persuasion 2

Feeding Grounds +2

Lash Out +4 -1

I finally earned a breather. Doli thought as she parked her bike next to one of the clubs she liked. Hot-headed sheriff mode was gone as she allowed herself to join the stream of people who gave into the music. During the night she'd target some tipsier of clientele, beast bringing out their lust and willingness as she went for kisses, literal and more metaphorical ones.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em> I finally earned a breather</em>. Doli thought as she parked her bike next to one of the clubs she liked. Hot-headed sheriff mode was gone as she allowed herself to join the stream of people who gave into the music. During the night she'd target some tipsier of clientele, beast bringing out their lust and willingness as she went for kisses, literal and more metaphorical ones.</p>

The confiscated drug forced her to leave the club. She went on her way to check on the interrogated man and give in the vial. On the way she noticed a newly opened bar and she had to admit that she still was hungry, so she went in, looking for some additional snacks before getting back to work.

Doli was trying to be effective this time. No time for drinks, no time for idle chatter. She quickly isolated her targets in the bar, came over for a quick chat and beast gave out it's all to make them submit to her kisses. After all, it's been a while since it tasted the blood.

column4:
When the hurly-burly's done, Brigit and Aden carry Gitta's body through the camp. They speak to no-one, avoiding even eye contact.

At Brigit's hovel, they lay out the body on her bed, still wrapped in the thick, oiled sailcloth. She feels tired, tired and angry. But her day is not yet done.

No sooner is she dismissing Aden when there is knock on the replaced door. Outside, there is a young man, nervous and anxious, hopping impatiently.

""Please, Brigit,"" he says, looking her in the eye, fear in his face. ""My daughter, she's sick. Burning up, she is. She needs help, or she'll die, I know it.""

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-280374""><div class=""row"">

Brigit can't stop herself from sighing deeply, but she nods. ""Of course. Give me just a moment."" 

She goes inside and pours water into a basin, and thoroughly washes her hands and face, scrubbing with a small bar of soap kept for the purpose. Back home the Folk made gentle scented soaps; here the soap is medicinal-smelling and harsh, but it does the job. The Witches come into contact with the sick and dead more than most, and they have time-tested strategies for hygiene before and after each.

In this instance, Brigit wishes she could fully bathe, not to mention start the preparations for Gitta's funeral, not to mention find Oppida and drink and rut this awful feeling away. 

But sickness is a horrible danger in the cramped, dirty condition of Queen's Refuge. Gitta wouldn't want the child to suffer a minute longer than she has to. And this is not the time for the Witch's to appear weak or distant. This is when the Folk need them most - and when they need the Folk most. 

With one more splash of cold water across her face to steady her, she takes a quick moment to gather what she'll need in a parcel. Spices, salves, tonics, incense, pigments, implements: a witch's apothecary and ritual supplies in one.

""Take me,"" she says, as stoutly as she can. But even she can hear the exhaustion in her voice.
