Rhaecyn turns as she hears footsteps in the hall above. A grunt of pain and the sound of someone collapsing.

""Caelynn, we are needed"" she shouts out, down a second hall.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rhaecyn turns as she hears footsteps in the hall above. A grunt of pain and the sound of someone collapsing.</p><p><strong>""Caelynn, we are needed""</strong> she shouts out, down a second hall.</p>

Hearing the summons from her superior, Caelynn rushes over to Rhaecyn's location.

Having found her.

"" Yes Goodsister, where to?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Hearing the summons from her superior, Caelynn rushes over to Rhaecyn's location. </p><p>Having found her.</p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""><strong>"" Yes Goodsister, where to?"" </strong></p>

""I heard him near the entry"" Rhaecyn says, hoisting her heavy skirts as she ascends the sticky, webbed stairs. Not many under-spire midwives still wear the traditional garments, which are inherently impractical, but Rhaecyn is an old romantic.

As you reach the entry, you find a lone man, missing one long ear from an old wound and covered in blood from his stomach down. Collapsing against the wall, he utters a whisper ""Hurt.""

Exhaling hard through clenched teeth Rhaecyn snatches a collapsed stretcher from a mount on the wall by the entrance. With one hand she shakes it open, laying it on the floor, while guiding him into it with the other. A well practiced move she has executed countless time before.

""Help me carry him"" she says to you, lifting one end of the stretcher.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""I heard him near the entry""</strong> Rhaecyn says, hoisting her heavy skirts as she ascends the sticky, webbed stairs. Not many under-spire midwives still wear the traditional garments, which are inherently impractical, but Rhaecyn is an old romantic.</p><p>As you reach the entry, you find a lone man, missing one long ear from an old wound and covered in blood from his stomach down. Collapsing against the wall, he utters a whisper <strong>""Hurt.""</strong></p><p>Exhaling hard through clenched teeth Rhaecyn snatches a collapsed stretcher from a mount on the wall by the entrance. With one hand she shakes it open, laying it on the floor, while guiding him into it with the other. A well practiced move she has executed countless time before.</p><p><strong>""Help me carry him"" </strong>she says to you, lifting one end of the stretcher. </p>

Caelynn immediately moves to the other end of the stretcher and lifts it up. Whilst the two midwives move in sync, Caelynn looks over the form of the man to see if she can discern anything about his injury.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn immediately moves to the other end of the stretcher and lifts it up. Whilst the two midwives move in sync, Caelynn looks over the form of the man to see if she can discern anything about his injury. </p>
There is a lot of blood, but you cant see a wound without removing some clothing. You guess it would be abdominal, however.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>There is a lot of blood, but you cant see a wound without removing some clothing. You guess it would be abdominal, however.</p>

Rhaecyn moves toward a make shift infirmary, free of eggs. Thousands of tiny black spiders scatter from a bench as the stretcher approaches, and the man is laid down on it. 

""Remove his shirt"" she says, handing you a small sharp knife. 

""I'll get something to clean him with""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rhaecyn moves toward a make shift infirmary, free of eggs. Thousands of tiny black spiders scatter from a bench as the stretcher approaches, and the man is laid down on it. </p><p><strong>""Remove his shirt""</strong> she says, handing you a small sharp knife. </p><p><strong>""I'll get something to clean him with""</strong></p>

As she goes to leave, Goodmother Baryth appears in the doorway.

""Can he pay?""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>As she goes to leave, Goodmother Baryth appears in the doorway.</p><p><strong>""Can he pay?""</strong></p>

Caelynn uses the knife to remove his shirt. She casts a glance towards Marianne,

""We will see, but payment isn't limited to money Sister. Service for service, favour for favour; there are many ways to make a person pay.""

Caelynn looks back down to the man's injury and starts doing what she can to stem the bleeding. She dips a finger in the blood and studies it for a second, before turning back Marianne. 

""Fetch a bucket if you can Sister, this one may not have need for blood come the dawn but the little ones are always thirsty.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn uses the knife to remove his shirt. She casts a glance towards Marianne,</p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""><strong>""We will see, but payment isn't limited to money Sister. Service for service, favour for favour; there are many ways to make a person pay."" <br></strong></p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;"">Caelynn looks back down to the man's injury and starts doing what she can to stem the bleeding. She dips a finger in the blood and studies it for a second, before turning back Marianne. </p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""><strong>""Fetch a bucket if you can Sister, this one may not have need for blood come the dawn but the little ones are always thirsty.""</strong> </p><p style=""margin-left: 20px;""></p>

As you feel around the abdomen, you cannot find a wound anywhere. When you look at the man he is making direct eye contact with you. The blood has already begun to dry and you cannot find the source of any more.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>As you feel around the abdomen, you cannot find a wound anywhere. When you look at the man he is making direct eye contact with you. The blood has already begun to dry and you cannot find the source of any more.</em></p>
""We're not a charity and we can't spend time on this if he cannot pay. We have to tend to the young. He won't be the only man on Red Row to die of a gut wound tonight. We cannot help them all""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""We're not a charity and we can't spend time on this if he cannot pay. We have to tend to the young. He won't be the only man on Red Row to die of a gut wound tonight. We cannot help them all""</strong></p>

Rhaecyn steps out of the doorway to argue the man's case to Mother Baryth. 

As she does the man lying in front of you grabs your wrist and hoists himself up from the bench. Leaning toward your ear he whispers

""Your cell is compromised. Do not go back to the water works. Do not go near it. Your magister is captured and as good as dead. Do not try to make contact with the cell. One of them was a traitor. We are working it out. You will join cell 44. Meet the magister in Threadneedle Square the bells after moonrise. She has a dog."" At the end of the rehearsed staccato he glances to the doorway, leaning back to the bench.
""Now do as your Goodmother says and toss me out.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rhaecyn steps out of the doorway to argue the man's case to Mother Baryth. </p><p><em>As she does the man lying in front of you grabs your wrist and hoists himself up from the bench. Leaning toward your ear he whispers</em></p><p><strong>""Your cell is compromised. Do not go back to the water works. Do not go near it. Your magister is captured and as good as dead. Do not try to make contact with the cell. One of them was a traitor. <em>We</em> are working it out. You will join cell 44. Meet the magister in Threadneedle Square the bells after moonrise. She has a dog."" </strong>At the end of the rehearsed staccato he glances to the doorway, leaning back to the bench.<br><strong>""Now do as your Goodmother says and toss me out.""</strong></p>

Caelynn looks at the man with understanding in her eyes.

""Understood."" She whispers to the man. She turns to speak to Marianne and Rhaecyn.

""Goodmother Baryth is right Sister Rhaecyn. This man has no place here if he can't pay for it. I'll see to it that he leaves the hatchery.""

Without waiting for acknowledgement, she takes the man by the arm and guides him to the exit. Caelynn does not attempt to make any conversation with the man as they make their way to the exit.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn looks at the man with understanding in her eyes. </p><p><strong>""Understood.""</strong> She whispers to the man. She turns to speak to Marianne and Rhaecyn.</p><p><strong>""Goodmother Baryth is right Sister Rhaecyn. This man has no place here if he can't pay for it. I'll see to it that he leaves the hatchery.""<br></strong></p><p>Without waiting for acknowledgement, she takes the man by the arm and guides him to the exit. Caelynn does not attempt to make any conversation with the man as they make their way to the exit. </p>

""No!"" Rhaecyn strides forward and puts her hand on the man's shoulder.

""We'll figure something out, Caelynn""

Her eyes drift to the man, now walking, then back to you. Realisation begins to dawn.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""No!"" </strong>Rhaecyn strides forward and puts her hand on the man's shoulder.</p><p><strong>""We'll figure something out, Caelynn""</strong></p><p>Her eyes drift to the man, now walking, then back to you. Realisation begins to dawn.</p>

""I want to help too Sister Rhaecyn, but GoodMother Baryth is right here. It is true that we midwives must preserve the future of the Drow, but we do not render this service to free. He must leave here."" She explains to Rhaecyn in a slow understanding voice. Caelynn turns to Goodmother Baryth before speaking again.

""After I've ensure this Drow has left I would like to head out. There must be poor souls in need of solace and have the Darnarian to pay for it. Some of the young ones I'm tending are in need of purer blood than we can provide; blood I might be able to bargain for, with Darnarian or service. Of course if I happen upon any purer blood ripe for the taking, I'll be sure to bring it back. Would that be alright with you Goodmother?""
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""I want to help too Sister Rhaecyn, but GoodMother Baryth is right here. It is true that we midwives must preserve the future of the Drow, but we do not render this service to free. He must leave here.""</strong> She explains to Rhaecyn in a slow understanding voice. Caelynn turns to Goodmother Baryth before speaking again.</p><p><strong>""After I've ensure this Drow has left I would like to head out. There must be poor souls in need of solace and have the Darnarian to pay for it. Some of the young ones I'm tending are in need of purer blood than we can provide; blood I might be able to bargain for, with Darnarian or service. Of course if I happen upon any purer blood ripe for the taking, I'll be sure to bring it back. Would that be alright with you Goodmother?"" </strong><br><strong></strong></p><p><strong><br></strong></p><p><strong></strong></p>

Baryth nods and wanders back into the egg chambers “Very good, Lynn. You deserve some fresh air”

Rhaecyn stares daggers at you. “Get out!” She hisses at the messenger, who follows her order without delay.

“Do not bring this here. Never bring this here again!”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Baryth nods and wanders back into the egg chambers<strong> “Very good, Lynn. You deserve some fresh air”</strong></p><p>Rhaecyn stares daggers at you. <strong>“Get out!” </strong>She hisses at the messenger, who follows her order without delay.</p><p><strong>“Do not bring this here. Never bring this here again!”</strong></p>

Caelynn watches Baryth wander off before giving Rhaecyn an apologetic look and making her way to her nook of the hatchery. Caelynn gathers the blood vials she has stored away and leaves it in the open so the other midwives can use it for her brood while she is away. 

Running her hands over the edge of a decrepit door obscured completely by eggs, Caelynn finds a handhold  and pulls to reveal a small cavity. She pulls out the meager supplies she has to serve the ministry leaving the cavity empty. Securing the door back in place, Caelynn makes her way to the other midwives and informs them that she has left out blood for her brood. Her preparations completed, Caelynn makes her way to the exit of the hatchery. 

Exiting the hatchery, Caelynn takes a moment to orient herself before heading towards the outskirts of Threadneedle Court.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn watches Baryth wander off before giving Rhaecyn an apologetic look and making her way to her nook of the hatchery. Caelynn gathers the blood vials she has stored away and leaves it in the open so the other midwives can use it for her brood while she is away. </p><p>Running her hands over the edge of a decrepit door obscured completely by eggs, Caelynn finds a handhold  and pulls to reveal a small cavity. She pulls out the meager supplies she has to serve the ministry leaving the cavity empty. Securing the door back in place, Caelynn makes her way to the other midwives and informs them that she has left out blood for her brood. Her preparations completed, Caelynn makes her way to the exit of the hatchery. </p><p>Exiting the hatchery, Caelynn takes a moment to orient herself before heading towards the outskirts of Threadneedle Court. </p>

Waxing Crescent - Cycle 8 (Toad), Red Row (Threadneedle Square)

After ducking through alley ways of burned, collapsed and rotting homes, you approach Threadneedle square. Water is leaking from tall ceilings of Red Row; more than usual. This sometimes happens when they dammed the rivers in Blue Port to bring cargo ships higher for easy dispatch of goods.  It was almost like rain, but more like standing under a leaking gutter, where holes had rusted through in particular places.

Unlike the orange light of most Spireblack lamps, lamps in Threadneedle Square cast a white light, grey shadows arching from every crate and the ruined walls that once surrounded it. White light makes it harder to spot that your Dagger is cut with dried algae powder.

You glance around for a Magister with a dog. You can't see anyone who might match.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p style=""text-align: center;""><strong style='font-family: ""Open Sans"", sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: center; background-color: initial;'>Waxing Crescent - Cycle 8 (Toad), Red Row (Threadneedle Square)</strong></p><p>After ducking through alley ways of burned, collapsed and rotting homes, you approach Threadneedle square. Water is leaking from tall ceilings of Red Row; more than usual. This sometimes happens when they dammed the rivers in Blue Port to bring cargo ships higher for easy dispatch of goods.  It was almost like rain, but more like standing under a leaking gutter, where holes had rusted through in particular places.</p><p>Unlike the orange light of most Spireblack lamps, lamps in Threadneedle Square cast a white light, grey shadows arching from every crate and the ruined walls that once surrounded it. White light makes it harder to spot that your Dagger is cut with dried algae powder.</p><p><em>You glance around for a Magister with a dog. You can't see anyone who might match.</em></p>

Caelynn cracks the knuckles in both her hands. Her long pale fingers writhe as she continues on to stretch them out. Her right hand goes on get a solid grip on her concealed weighted chain. Assuming as much pose as she can as a midwife she strides towards the middle of the square, her robed form illuminated by the white lights.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn cracks the knuckles in both her hands. Her long pale fingers writhe as she continues on to stretch them out. Her right hand goes on get a solid grip on her concealed weighted chain. Assuming as much pose as she can as a midwife she strides towards the middle of the square, her robed form illuminated by the white lights.</p>

In the square, you are surrounded by moving bodies. Many faces are covered, those that are not bear grim expression or a menacing snarl.

Around you, hushed voices whisper products and prices. You hear the chink of coins and shuffling feet.  A huge white lamp shines in your eyes. You stand alone in the middle of the square. 

""Malak is 15 stens, this week""

""No one sells blue down here, step off""

""I'll sell forty four, OK?""

""What's the mushroom look like?""

You close your eyes and focus. One phrase is repeated again.

""I'll sell forty four, OK?""

...and again.

""I'll CELL 44, OK?""

Your eyes snap open on look into a the white glow immediately to your left. The man had said Cell 44. This was a test. Darting to the location of the voice, you find an empty space, with a faint smell of dog. People in the area are beginning to look at you strangely.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>In the square, you are surrounded by moving bodies. Many faces are covered, those that are not bear grim expression or a menacing snarl.</p><p>Around you, hushed voices whisper products and prices. You hear the chink of coins and shuffling feet.  A huge white lamp shines in your eyes. You stand alone in the middle of the square. </p><p><strong>""Malak is 15 stens, this week""</strong></p><p><strong>""No one sells blue down here, step off""</strong></p><p><strong>""I'll sell forty four, OK?""</strong></p><p><strong>""What's the mushroom look like?""</strong></p><p>You close your eyes and focus. One phrase is repeated again.</p><p><strong>""I'll sell forty four, OK?""</strong></p><p>...and again.</p><p><strong>""I'll <em>CELL 44</em>, OK?""</strong></p><p>Your eyes snap open on look into a the white glow immediately to your left. The man had said Cell 44. This was a test. Darting to the location of the voice, you find an empty space, with a faint smell of dog. People in the area are beginning to look at you strangely.</p>

""Hahaha, I thought I had heard a good deal here. These markets get really crowded and disorienting with their bustle."" Caelynn says out loud with a small chuckle. 

""Buying in bulk favours us midwives in completing our duties. Anyone of you see or hear where the vendor selling in bulk went?"" Caelynn asks a coupe of people closest to her.

At the same time her eyes and ear focus as much as they can, searching for a trail that the magister may have left for her to pursue.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Hahaha, I thought I had heard a good deal here. These markets get really crowded and disorienting with their bustle."" </strong>Caelynn says out loud with a small chuckle. </p><p><strong>""Buying in bulk favours us midwives in completing our duties. Anyone of you see or hear where the vendor selling in bulk went?"" </strong>Caelynn asks a coupe of people closest to her.</p><p>At the same time her eyes and ear focus as much as they can, searching for a trail that the magister may have left<strong></strong> for her to pursue. </p>
No one responds, moving away as you speak. The square has a haunted look in this light. The smell of dog begins to fade.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>No one responds, moving away as you speak. The square has a haunted look in this light. The smell of dog begins to fade.</em></p>

You have found the sound. You have found the smell. Your eyes are beginning to adjust to the light.

Just as your senses focus on one point, beneath a tall, extinguished lampost, a match strikes and its flare shows between cupped hands. The end of a cigarette glows as the match is shaken out.

""Well done."" says the Magister. Shorter than you, but with a wiry frame and long fingers that betray a brutal strength. ""You'll do well with us. My condolences for your previous cell... that must be difficult. They assure me you were not involved in that darkness"". Her cigarette glows brightly as she pulls in.

Suddenly it seems as if no one is around, at least in this section of the market square.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You have found the sound. You have found the smell. Your eyes are beginning to adjust to the light.</p><p>Just as your senses focus on one point, beneath a tall, extinguished lampost, a match strikes and its flare shows between cupped hands. The end of a cigarette glows as the match is shaken out.</p><p><strong>""Well done.""</strong> says the Magister. Shorter than you, but with a wiry frame and long fingers that betray a brutal strength. <strong>""You'll do well with us. My condolences for your previous cell... that must be difficult. They assure me you were not involved in that darkness""</strong>. Her cigarette glows brightly as she pulls in.</p><p>Suddenly it seems as if no one is around, at least in this section of the market square.</p>

The smoke burns in Caelynn's nostril as she does her best to avoid a grimace at the smell. 

""I remain steadfast to the preservation and glory for the Drow. It is more angering than anything: the thought of one of us turning on their brethren. It must be more difficult for your end, all those leaks to plug."" Caelynn says as she takes pointed look to the roof of the square, gazing at the water from up-Spire leaking below. Turning back to the Magister she continues,

""I understand that it was an emergency but If I need to be reached again at a hatchery, the informant having some Darnarian to feign paying for an injury would be most helpful. The money can be easily returned but any doubts the other midwives have in me is hard to wipe away. I think we can both agree more compromises to ministers is something we would like to avoid. Now then Magister, what would you ask of this minister of yours?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The smoke burns in Caelynn's nostril as she does her best to avoid a grimace at the smell. </p><p><strong>""I remain steadfast to the preservation and glory for the Drow. It is more angering than anything: the thought of one of us turning on their brethren. It must be more difficult for your end, all those leaks to plug.""</strong> Caelynn says as she takes pointed look to the roof of the square, gazing at the water from up-Spire leaking below. Turning back to the Magister she continues,</p><p><strong>""I understand that it was an emergency but If I need to be reached again at a hatchery, the informant having some Darnarian to feign paying for an injury would be most helpful. The money can be easily returned but any doubts the other midwives have in me is hard to wipe away. I think we can both agree more compromises to ministers is something we would like to avoid. Now then Magister, what would you ask of this minister of yours?""</strong></p>

""Desperate time, desperate measures. Though I don't imagine you'll be bothered in the hatchery again. Of course, he was sent without money on purpose. Old Baryth is famously pedantic about payment, and it wouldn't do if he actually got medical care by anyone but you now, would it?""

She stamps out the end of her cigarette on the wet ground.

""I'll need you to start in earnest... I can arrange an excuse for the hatchery. I sent the boys up to the ground floor earlier this evening, but I've seen Turlan twice now down here. Last I saw he was headed in the direction of the Circus. Lots of uniforms tonight. More than I have ever seen down here. 

The job is just supply acquisition... but... sometimes I get a feeling.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Desperate time, desperate measures. Though I don't imagine you'll be bothered in the hatchery again. Of course, he was sent without money on purpose. Old Baryth is famously pedantic about payment, and it wouldn't do if he <em>actually</em> got medical care by anyone but you now, would it?""</strong></p><p>She stamps out the end of her cigarette on the wet ground.</p><p><strong>""I'll need you to start in earnest... I can arrange an excuse for the hatchery. I sent the boys up to the ground floor earlier this evening, but I've seen Turlan twice now down here. Last I saw he was headed in the direction of the Circus. Lots of uniforms tonight. More than I have ever seen down here. </strong></p><p><strong>The job is just supply acquisition... but... sometimes I get a feeling.""</strong></p>

Caelynn lets out a chuckle at the Magister's remark about Baryth. 

"" What kind of feeling are you getting Magister? You've survived a lot to end up in your position, I'll take your gut feeling as a good predictor. What exactly are we looking to acquire? Beyond that, I'll make my way to the Circus. Do I have a way of confirming the cell?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Caelynn lets out a chuckle at the Magister's remark about Baryth. </p><p><strong>"" What kind of feeling are you getting Magister? You've survived a lot to end up in your position, I'll take your gut feeling as a good predictor. What exactly are we looking to acquire? Beyond that, I'll make my way to the Circus. Do I have a way of confirming the cell?""</strong></p>

She gives you a description of Turlan, Val, Tal and Shenn. She tells you that they're not expecting you, but that if you mention Simmian, the great Mastiff at her feet, they'll know you're on the inside.

As she continues to run through the necessary details, the camera pulls back up out of Threadneedle Square, away from the white light, and turning to look at a bright tower in the distance. Covered in icicles and topped with an enormous glowing sphere.


Fade to black. End of Prologue.

column4: The Governor's Manor sits at the center of the Upper District, along the primary stream that curls down from the far mountain lake, a part of which is diverted into the manor itself. Purple banners of the Iuchi decorate the boundary walls of the richly colored wooden walls.

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-280314""><div class=""row"">

1152. 6th day of the Horse. Early Evening. Clear.

A officious looking man stands near the great doors of the Manor, the fur trimmed collar of his cloak is held tightly against his neck to ward off the seeping cold of the evening.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p style=""text-align: center;""><strong>1152. 6th day of the Horse. Early Evening. Clear.</strong></p><p>A officious looking man stands near the great doors of the Manor, the fur trimmed collar of his cloak is held tightly against his neck to ward off the seeping cold of the evening.</p>

""Shinjo Rudhra,"" says the yoriki, doing the usual introductions, businesslike but not condescending, ""arriving at the invitation of Lord Iuchi Tsubei-sama. I escort the shugenja Shiba Tsunemura and Agasha Mayoko, also at the invitation of our lord.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Shinjo Rudhra,""</span> <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);""></span><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">says the yoriki, doing the usual introductions, businesslike but not condescending,</span> <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""arriving at the invitation of Lord Iuchi Tsubei-sama. I escort the shugenja Shiba Tsunemura and Agasha Mayoko, also at the invitation of our lord.""</span></p>

Shiba, dressed in a decorative but warm, layered kimono, bows, smiling, but happy to let Rudhra do the talking here. The man was ever-capable at dealing with these matters and Shiba appreciated his company more and more each day. 

Agasha and he, he expects, would have tripped over their own sandles several times already without his assistance. The unicorn were not the brutes he had been lead to believe, just very different in their manner and priority.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shiba, dressed in a decorative but warm, layered kimono, bows, smiling, but happy to let Rudhra do the talking here. The man was ever-capable at dealing with these matters and Shiba appreciated his company more and more each day. </p><p>Agasha and he, he expects, would have tripped over their own sandles several times already without his assistance. The unicorn were not the brutes he had been lead to believe, just very different in their manner and priority.</p>
Mayoko seems absentminded; she follows Shiba and lets him speak, supporting him with a bow if needed. The only 'persons' who catch her interest are large fires.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko seems absentminded; she follows Shiba and lets him speak, supporting him with a bow if needed. The only 'persons' who catch her interest are large fires.</p>

The official gives Rudhra a blank look as he holds out his hand, ""Shinjo Rudhra-san, I am required by our lord to inspect such invitations before allowing entrance into the private areas of our lord's estate. Please, before the open sky invites us to freeze on the spot.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The official gives Rudhra a blank look as he holds out his hand,<span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""> </span><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Shinjo Rudhra-san, I am required by our lord to inspect such invitations before allowing entrance into the private areas of our lord's estate. Please, before the open sky invites us to freeze on the spot.""</span></strong></p>

Mayoko takes her head up and focuses on the man before Shinjo. She eyes him with narrowed eyes, but relaxes shortly afterwards. After all, it's only a man who has to fulfil his obligations...

She smoothes her kimono, musing about how soon she has to order a new one if she has to partake more frequently on such occasions. Looking at the apricots, she thinks about a little changed copy of her existing garment - she likes fruits.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko takes her head up and focuses on the man before Shinjo. She eyes him with narrowed eyes, but relaxes shortly afterwards. After all, it's only a man who has to fulfil his obligations...</p><p>She smoothes her kimono, musing about how soon she has to order a new one if she has to partake more frequently on such occasions. Looking at the apricots, she thinks about a little changed copy of her existing garment - she likes fruits.</p>
""Of course,"" Rudhra nods, producing the invitation letter.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Of course,"" Rudhra nods, producing the invitation letter.</p>

The man takes the scroll and quickly skims it to confirm what he already knew, then returns it to Rudhra, ""Excellent, let us out of the cold, I will escort you to the waiting room where there is hot tea waiting,"" The man bows deeply. ""I welcome you to Lord Iuchi Tsubei's estate."" 

Not waiting for reply, the man deftly enters the building, shaking off the cold in the warm room ahead. A purple clad guard steps forward and holds the door open for the party.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The man takes the scroll and quickly skims it to confirm what he already knew, then returns it to Rudhra, <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Excellent, let us out of the cold, I will escort you to the waiting room where there is hot tea waiting,""</strong></span> The man bows deeply. <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""I welcome you to Lord Iuchi Tsubei's estate."" </strong></span></p><p>Not waiting for reply, the man deftly enters the building, shaking off the cold in the warm room ahead. A purple clad guard steps forward and holds the door open for the party. </p>
Rudhra ushers the shugenja inside ahead of him.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rudhra ushers the shugenja inside ahead of him. </p>
Attentive, Mayoko steps inside, making room for Shiba and Shinjo as she steps aside as soon as she clears the door.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Attentive, Mayoko steps inside, making room for Shiba and Shinjo as she steps aside as soon as she clears the door.</p>

The man escorts the group through the spacious private entry chamber, to an adjacent room with a small hearth at the back and a wide, doorless threshold, giving the occupants full view of the previous room. The aroma of Golden Needle tea lifts up from the pot, giving the area an extra layer of warmth. There are three place settings, and kneeling cushions, around the short table. 

""Please enjoy Lord Iuchi's hospitality."" The official gives another well practiced bow.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The man escorts the group through the spacious private entry chamber, to an adjacent room with a small hearth at the back and a wide, doorless threshold, giving the occupants full view of the previous room. The aroma of Golden Needle tea lifts up from the pot, giving the area an extra layer of warmth. There are three place settings, and kneeling cushions, around the short table. </p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Please enjoy Lord Iuchi's hospitality.""</strong> </span>The official gives another well practiced bow. </p>

Shiba kneels in place. His heart warmed by the smell of the tea. I strong sense of gratitude fills him, though Lord Iuchi could not have possibly known. It was a Pheonix favourite, that would be it. A kind gesture.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shiba kneels in place. His heart warmed by the smell of the tea. I strong sense of gratitude fills him, though Lord Iuchi could not have possibly known. It was a Pheonix favourite, that would be it. A kind gesture.</p>
Rudhra thanks the servant quietly, and then takes a seat and pours himself a cup of tea. He hoists the pot in the direction of the shugenja, his eyes asking if they would like some, too.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rudhra thanks the servant quietly, and then takes a seat and pours himself a cup of tea. He hoists the pot in the direction of the shugenja, his eyes asking if they would like some, too. </p>
Shiba attempts to hold back his enthusiasm, but nods quickly. His tight lips holding back an eager smile.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shiba attempts to hold back his enthusiasm, but nods quickly. His tight lips holding back an eager smile.</p>
After Mayoko sits down on the last seat, she takes her time to let the room atmosphere sink in. Shortly, she nods at the offer of tea.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>After Mayoko sits down on the last seat, she takes her time to let the room atmosphere sink in. Shortly, she nods at the offer of tea. </p>

Lord Iuchi Tsubei and his mentor Iuchi Yoshi walk into the antechamber from the main entrance, both men are covered in great fur lined cloaks of humble design, their faces peeking out like bearded men in baby swaddling. They could have been mistaken for a pair of itinerant priest, had not the guards and vassals in the room immediately begun to bow and set to work toward their comfort.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Lord Iuchi Tsubei and his mentor Iuchi Yoshi walk into the antechamber from the main entrance, both men are covered in great fur lined cloaks of humble design, their faces peeking out like bearded men in baby swaddling. They could have been mistaken for a pair of itinerant priest, had not the guards and vassals in the room immediately begun to bow and set to work toward their comfort.</p>

Shiba, already on the floor, bows deeply, restoring his tea cup to the short table. Once the two men are arranged and comfortable, he speaks.

“Lord Iuchi Tsubei-sama, Iuchi Yoshi-sama. It is an honour to meet you both again so soon.” 

He shoots a look at Yoshi, hoping to avoid being called a Crane again, for simple courtesies.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shiba, already on the floor, bows deeply, restoring his tea cup to the short table. Once the two men are arranged and comfortable, he speaks.</p><p><strong>“Lord Iuchi Tsubei-sama, Iuchi Yoshi-sama. It is an honour to meet you both again so soon.”</strong> </p><p>He shoots a look at Yoshi, hoping to avoid being called a Crane again, for simple courtesies.</p>
Mayoko stands likewise up, half a step behind Tsunemura she bows deep to both superiors. After that, she'd sit down after the others do it.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko stands likewise up, half a step behind Tsunemura she bows deep to both superiors. After that, she'd sit down after the others do it.</p>

Lord Tsubei nods in return, ""Welcome, I thank you for showing tact and mindfulness in following my instructions. Let us begin out business at once, our dinner will be forthcoming."" Servants carrying two chairs, one larger than the other, move into the room and place them at the back of the table. Tsubei sits in the larger one, and towers over the party on their cushions; Yoshi takes his place on the smaller chair.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Lord Tsubei nods in return, <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Welcome, I thank you for showing tact and mindfulness in following my instructions. Let us begin out business at once, our dinner will be forthcoming.""</strong></span> Servants carrying two chairs, one larger than the other, move into the room and place them at the back of the table. Tsubei sits in the larger one, and towers over the party on their cushions; Yoshi takes his place on the smaller chair. </p>

Yoshi gives a knowing smile to Tsunemura as he bows his greeting, announcing himself and his position as Lord Tsubei's chief adviser. He carries with him a large mahogany scroll case inlaid with a simple crystal pattern, an item of immense value. 

After he sits, be takes out a scroll, inkwell and pen from the case, and looks around. ""Tell me of the strange man you encountered this morning.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Yoshi gives a knowing smile to Tsunemura as he bows his greeting, announcing himself and his position as Lord Tsubei's chief adviser. He carries with him a large mahogany scroll case inlaid with a simple crystal pattern, an item of immense value. </p><p>After he sits, be takes out a scroll, inkwell and pen from the case, and looks around. <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Tell me of the strange man you encountered this morning.""</strong></span></p>

Shiba provides as detailed account as he can. Giving several detailed observations, of which he is unable to draw any conclusions but the one he stated previously; that the man had been cut from the celestial wheel.

""I have never seen anything of the like, Iuchi-sama. It was unsettling to say the least.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shiba provides as detailed account as he can. Giving several detailed observations, of which he is unable to draw any conclusions but the one he stated previously; that the man had been cut from the celestial wheel.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);"">""I have never seen anything of the like, Iuchi-sama. It was unsettling to say the least.""</span></strong></p>

Mayoko sits with the others, but doesn't speak; instead, she seems to soak in all informations like a sponge, carefully noting every word, every pronounciation, every accompanying gesture. She even seems to have forgotten her teacup.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko sits with the others, but doesn't speak; instead, she seems to soak in all informations like a sponge, carefully noting every word, every pronounciation, every accompanying gesture. She even seems to have forgotten her teacup.</p>
Rudhra adds what few details he can, but otherwise stays attentive.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Rudhra adds what few details he can, but otherwise stays attentive.</p>
""What about the man unsettled you Tsunemura-san?"" he waits patiently for a response.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""What about the man unsettled you Tsunemura-san?"" </span></strong>he waits patiently for a response.</p>
""It was impossible to focus on him. Something kept removing him from my attention, trying to shift me away from noticing him.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);""><strong>""It was impossible to focus on him. Something kept removing him from my attention, trying to shift me away from noticing him.""</strong></span></p>
""Did you recognize the man?""
""I'm afraid I can't remember. I can not remember recognising him, though I cannot remember not recognising him. I hope I am not being too confusing with my language.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);"">""I'm afraid I can't remember. I can not remember recognising him, though I cannot remember<em> not</em> recognising him. I hope I am not being too confusing with my language.""</span></strong></p>

""We experienced a similar encounter when we met the man at the temple. Having seen him with my own eyes, I could hardly comprehend that he had ever been a person. Unfortunately, there is no way to save such a cursed being, in fact, should you encounter any more of the unpersons, you are to dispatch them at once. They may seem innocuous, but they carry the taint of the Lying Darkness, which attempts to unmake the very fabric of reality itself."" Lord Tsubei looks over to Yoshi, who simply nods his head.

""Further more, it took some effort, but Magistrate Ide Tang-san was finally able to divine the man's identity. I am told that all three of you are familiar with Kabu of, hrm, Hotei's Cup. While I am pleased that such a stain has been removed from our city, the greater threat looms large, and Kabu's destruction is surely of some import. What are your thoughts on this?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""We experienced a similar encounter when we met the man at the temple. Having seen him with my own eyes, I could hardly comprehend that he had ever been a person. Unfortunately, there is no way to save such a cursed being, in fact, should you encounter any more of the unpersons, you are to dispatch them at once. They may seem innocuous, but they carry the taint of the Lying Darkness, which attempts to unmake the very fabric of reality itself."" </strong></span>Lord Tsubei looks over to Yoshi, who simply nods his head.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Further more, it took some effort, but Magistrate Ide Tang-san was finally able to divine the man's identity. I am told that all three of you are familiar with Kabu of, hrm, Hotei's Cup. While I am pleased that such a stain has been removed from our city, the greater threat looms large, and Kabu's destruction is surely of some import. What are your thoughts on this?""</strong></span></p>

""Ah."" Shiba's jaw drops

""Well. Perhaps that brings us to our original cause to meet, Iuchi-sama. Though... with worrying implications.""

This is not what had happened to Benjiro.  What did that mean? The honour of Isawa's family, Shiba's family was at stake here. In these lands that might extend to the whole Phoenix clan. What if a samurai had been affected in this way. One might still. If Benjiro was responsible for bringing this curse... Shiba's mind was racing.

No. Snap out of it. Shiba would be the sterile knife. He had to be ready to cut.

""It seems, from what little I know of these things, that the Lying Darkness has become apparent in Hisatu-Kesu. My cousin is somehow involved, apparently willingly. He has not shown the same signs as the man from this morning. It is my duty and honour to pledge my whole efforts and life in assistance to clearing this threat from your home.""

Shiba bows his head to the floor.

""Will you accept my pledge, Lord Iuchi-sama?""

Shiba hoped this is what his uncle would want. He couldn't back down now.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(31, 73, 125);"">""Ah."" </span></strong>Shiba's jaw drops</p><p><b style=""background-color: initial;""><span style=""color: rgb(31, 73, 125);"">""Well. Perhaps that brings us to our original cause to meet, Iuchi-sama. Though... with worrying implications.""</span></b></p><p>This is not what had happened to Benjiro.  What did that mean? The honour of Isawa's family, Shiba's family was at stake here. In these lands that might extend to the whole Phoenix clan. What if a samurai had been affected in this way. One might still. If Benjiro was responsible for bringing this curse... Shiba's mind was racing.</p><p>No. Snap out of it. Shiba would be the sterile knife. He had to be ready to cut.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(31, 73, 125);"">""It seems, from what little I know of these things, that the Lying Darkness has become apparent in Hisatu-Kesu. My cousin is somehow involved, apparently willingly. He has not shown the same signs as the man from this morning. It is my duty and honour to pledge my whole efforts and<em> life </em>in assistance to clearing this threat from your home.""</span></strong></p><p>Shiba bows his head to the floor.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(31, 73, 125);"">""Will you accept my pledge, Lord Iuchi-sama?""</span></strong></p><p>Shiba hoped this is what his uncle would want. He couldn't back down now.</p>

Rudhra is unobtrusively lifting his teacup when Tsubei mentions Kabu. The cup freezes midway to Rudhra's face, hesitates a moment, and then is placed back on the table.

""My lord, there are, for lack of a better word ... political ... ramifications to a man like Kabu being destroyed in this way. He is, or perhaps was, not a man wisely crossed in the Lower City.""

Rudhra takes a deep breath. ""If devotees of dark powers feel they can lay such a man as Kabu low, and then leave him to walk the streets and be found and identified, the danger may be dire indeed. Whoever is doing this must be very sure of themselves to be so bold. Or,"" Rudhra hesitates a moment, ""completely mad.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Rudhra is unobtrusively lifting his teacup when Tsubei mentions Kabu. The cup freezes midway to Rudhra's face, hesitates a moment, and then is placed back on the table.</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""My lord, there are, for lack of a better word ... political ... ramifications to a man like Kabu being destroyed in this way. He is, or perhaps was, not a man wisely crossed in the Lower City.""</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Rudhra takes a deep breath. <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""></span></span><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""If devotees of dark powers feel they can lay such a man as Kabu low, and then leave him to walk the streets and be found and identified, the danger may be dire indeed. Whoever is doing this must be very sure of themselves to be so bold. Or,"" <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Rudhra hesitates a moment, </span>""completely mad.""</span></p>

Mayoko lifts her gaze as Kabu is named and furrows her brows.

""Iuchi Tsubei-sama, I don't understand your choice of words. With destruction, you don't speak of his death only, I think.""

Looking at Tsunemura, she thinks shortly about offering the same, but decides it's not needed. But if Iuchi Tsubei would look at her after the Shiba's proposal, she would give a decisive nod.

After Rudhra spoke, she adds:

""The difference between boldness and madness is simply success. For us as opponents, it'll be the same.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko lifts her gaze as Kabu is named and furrows her brows.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""Iuchi Tsubei-sama, I don't understand your choice of words. With destruction, you don't speak of his death only, I think.""</span></p><p>Looking at Tsunemura, she thinks shortly about offering the same, but decides it's not needed. But if Iuchi Tsubei would look at her after the Shiba's proposal, she would give a decisive nod.</p><p>After Rudhra spoke, she adds:</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""The difference between boldness and madness is simply success. For us as opponents, it'll be the same.""</span></p>

Tsubei nods to Tsunemura, ""Shiba's legacy of nobly protecting others through self-sacrifice lives on in you Shiba Tsunemura-san. We accept your aid."" 

To Rudhra he speaks: ""Your desire for Hisatu-Kesu's stability says much about your character, and your service in this has not gone unnoticed. Should you succeed in this current endeavor, I will grant you oversight of the Lower District, to ensure that stability yourself.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Tsubei nods to Tsunemura<strong>, <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Shiba's legacy of nobly protecting others through self-sacrifice lives on in you Shiba Tsunemura-san. We accept your aid."" </span></strong></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><span style=""color: rgb(127, 127, 127);""><span style=""color: rgb(127, 127, 127);""><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);"">To Rudhra he speaks:</span></span> </span><strong>""Your desire for Hisatu-Kesu's stability says much about your character, and your service in this has not gone unnoticed. Should you succeed in this current endeavor, I will grant you oversight of the Lower District, to ensure that stability yourself.""</strong></span><b style=""background-color: initial; color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""> </b></p>

""Yes, that would be so,"" interjects Iuchi Yoshi as he turns to Mayoko, ""however the path of Bushido gives us a measure by which true boldness may be judged. One need only seek out the stories of the past to know that more than one ill fated samurai has acted in madness and called it otherwise. We must leave such issues in the capable hands of you and your companions."" 

He sighs, and pauses for a moment, ""It is true, when our Lord Iuchi speaks of Kabu's destruction he means that Kabu was almost entirely unmade, even his close associates at Hotei's Cup could barely remember him at all. His end by the sword was more mercy than justice, he was truly lost well before then, and his soul unable to return to the mortal realm to find any manner of peace. That is the terror of the Lying Darkness, once it has taken you, there is little hope, perhaps no hope, of escaping it.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Yes, that would be so,""</span></strong> interjects Iuchi Yoshi as he turns to Mayoko, <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""however the path of Bushido gives us a measure by which true boldness may be judged. One need only seek out the stories of the past to know that more than one ill fated samurai has acted in madness and called it otherwise. We must leave such issues in the capable hands of you and your companions."" </strong></span></p><p>He sighs, and pauses for a moment, <span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""It is true, when our Lord Iuchi speaks of Kabu's destruction he means that Kabu was almost entirely unmade, even his close associates at Hotei's Cup could barely remember him at all. His end by the sword was more mercy than justice, he was truly lost well before then, and his soul unable to return to the mortal realm to find any manner of peace. That is the terror of the Lying Darkness, once it has taken you, there is little hope, perhaps no hope, of escaping it.""</strong></span></p>

Mayoko bows before Iuchi Yoshi.

""I beg for forgiveness for the error in my train of thought.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mayoko bows before Iuchi Yoshi.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""I beg for forgiveness for the error in my train of thought.""</span></p>

""Do you know of any way that we can act. My capable hands have been hampered by a less capable head, of late. A head which can bounce off broomsticks, but not demons, I fear."" Shiba looks up from a self effacing bow.

""Should we simply hunt signs of the creature in the lower district? Or is there some wisdom for problems such as this?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);""><strong>""Do you know of any way that we can act. My capable hands have been hampered by a less capable head, of late. A head which can bounce off broomsticks, but not demons, I fear.""</strong></span> Shiba looks up from a self effacing bow.<span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);""></span></p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);"">""Should we simply hunt signs of the creature in the lower district? Or is there some wisdom for problems such as this?""</span></strong></p>
""I believe the evidence points us back to Hotei's Cup.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""I believe the evidence points us back to Hotei's Cup.""</span></strong></p>

Rudhra nods. ""I will question the staff of Hotei's Cup, and whatever of their customers can be found. Esteemed Phoenix,"" he looks from one shugenja to the next, ""I shall assist you in whatever way I can. Yoshi-sama, if I may, what defense could exist for such an assault as this?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Rudhra nods.</span><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""> ""I will question the staff of Hotei's Cup, and whatever of their customers can be found. Esteemed Phoenix,"" <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">he looks from one shugenja to the next, </span>""I shall assist you in whatever way I can. Yoshi-sama, if I may, what defense could exist for such an assault as this?""</span></p>
""Crystal and the powers of the Kami, fortunately there is an abundance of the latter at your disposal. Crystal is rare, perhaps the merchants of the Lower District may be able to accommodate you.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><strong>""Crystal and the powers of the Kami, fortunately there is an abundance of the latter at your disposal. Crystal is rare, perhaps the merchants of the Lower District may be able to accommodate you.""</strong></span></p>
""I see. Is there a specific configuration or size of crystal we should seek?""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""I see. Is there a specific configuration or size of crystal we should seek?""</span></p>
“I believe, like Jade and the shadow, the material itself will suffice, Rudhra-san. I know something of the properties. We can explore the markets in the morning for something suitable.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);"">“I believe, like Jade and the shadow, the material itself will suffice, Rudhra-san. I know something of the properties. We can explore the markets in the morning for something suitable.”</span></strong></p>
""Ah. Excellent,"" nods Rudhra. ""I shall consider tonight which merchants to visit, and you can judge their quality.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Ah. column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-280694""><div class=""row"">

EVENING

With the events of past night gone by and now being aware of the new policies, Waldo's curiosity has activated an assertiveness. This assertiveness, Waldo knows, is what allows him to set in motion a stream of events, which later he can sit back to and observe. ""Ohhh the joy..""

For the moment he is struck by the complete stupidity of this girl that flaunted the masquerade and decides to see if he can find more information about how she flaunted the masquerade and where she could be hiding...

He decides to check out if there are any rumors going around about this incident. First he decides to visit the Nosferatu priscus Toos Bentinck to evaluate the matter...

(wits3+politics4+clan status1)
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>EVENING</p><p>With the events of past night gone by and now being aware of the new policies, Waldo's curiosity has activated an assertiveness. This assertiveness, Waldo knows, is what allows him to set in motion a stream of events, which later he can sit back to and observe. ""Ohhh the joy..""</p><p>For the moment he is struck by the complete stupidity of this girl that flaunted the masquerade and decides to see if he can find more information about how she flaunted the masquerade and where she could be hiding...</p><p>He decides to check out if there are any rumors going around about this incident. First he decides to visit the Nosferatu priscus Toos Bentinck to evaluate the matter...</p><p>(wits3+politics4+clan status1)</p>

Toos Bentinck has an office at the Ice Palace, a building that houses the city’s municipal offices. You catch your Priscus in a side alley, off the side of train station the Hague Central.

She is glad that you’ve taken an interest in Gwen Kok. She and your Primogen, Koen van Buuren, have tried to convince the Steward to allow the clan to resolve this matter. However, the Steward and her council have decided otherwise, relaying the responsibility for Gwen’s capture to the Sheriff and the hounds. Toos fears the unfortunate neonate will be used as a means to curry favour with Amsterdam. She asks you to keep her updated.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Toos Bentinck has an office at the <em>Ice</em> <em>Palace, </em>a building that houses<em> </em>the city’s municipal offices. You catch your Priscus in a side alley, off the side of train station the Hague Central.</p><p>She is glad that you’ve taken an interest in Gwen Kok. She and your Primogen, Koen van Buuren, have tried to convince the Steward to allow the clan to resolve this matter. However, the Steward and her council have decided otherwise, relaying the responsibility for Gwen’s capture to the Sheriff and the hounds. Toos fears the unfortunate neonate will be used as a means to curry favour with Amsterdam. She asks you to keep her updated.</p>

In the mean while, Fred sends Jesse to figure out more about the Night Mayors assets.

He remembers that Jonathan Kahman has a succesfull emporium of gamble sites, illegal boxing rings and the like. One site, a divebar called ""xxx"" is such a place with lots of illigal gambling and poker.

Jesse is just the right guy for these places. He is sent there to scout and map all the people that are running the place. He should participate, be interested and casually ask around if there are more of ""such places"", where he can bring his friends etc. It would be nice if he can find out who are imporant players and who are just customers.

In order to help with the search for Gwen, Fred decides to see if he can gain access to the surveillence network around stations in Zuid-Holland. He knows this computer guy, with some dark hobies, that has some handy skills that might help (Claude).
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>In the mean while, Fred sends Jesse to figure out more about the Night Mayors assets.</p><p>He remembers that Jonathan Kahman has a succesfull emporium of gamble sites, illegal boxing rings and the like. He knows this computer guy, with some dark hobies, that has some handy skills that might help (Claude).</p>
dice roll

Around 11 in the evening, Jesse de Bruyn rings. The clatter of glasses can be heard in the background and the chittering of pub conversation, a classic rock tune ties the sounds together into a unified whole. Jesse comes across as giddy, no doubt he’s had a few already. He’s made friends with the bartender, he says, all set up to dive in deeper. So far he’s seen a few of the city’s minor criminal celebrities, weed growers, catburglars and fences. No one major. He asks if you want him to hang around longer, he’s sure he’ll be able to find out more.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Around 11 in the evening, Jesse de Bruyn rings. The clatter of glasses can be heard in the background and the chittering of pub conversation, a classic rock tune ties the sounds together into a unified whole. Jesse comes across as giddy, no doubt he’s had a few already. He’s made friends with the bartender, he says, all set up to dive in deeper. So far he’s seen a few of the city’s minor criminal celebrities, weed growers, catburglars and fences. No one major. He asks if you want him to hang around longer, he’s sure he’ll be able to find out more.</p>

You receive an e-mail from Claude. 

“This her?,” is all it says.

Attached you find a video-file. It contains footage of a young woman, fitting Gwen Kok’s general description. She seems to be masquerading as a homeless woman. The video is taken from camera’s around station Gouda.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You receive an e-mail from Claude. </p><p>“This her?,” is all it says.</p><p> Attached you find a video-file. It contains footage of a young woman, fitting Gwen Kok’s general description. She seems to be masquerading as a homeless woman. The video is taken from camera’s around station Gouda. </p>

MIDNIGHT

In reply to Jesse Waldo tells him to take all the time he needs and not to get overly greedy for information. ""This is a long game.""

Claude is gets as a reply ""Yes, good. One more thing, while you're at it, try if you can locate the movement of -insert description of Tom Naaktgeboren here-""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>MIDNIGHT</p><p>In reply to Jesse Waldo tells him to take all the time he needs and not to get overly greedy for information. ""This is a long game.""</p><p>Claude is gets as a reply ""Yes, good. One more thing, while you're at it, try if you can locate the movement of -insert description of Tom Naaktgeboren here-""</p>

With the information regarding the location of Gwen Kok, Fred decides to go visit Koen van Buuren. He will propose approaching Gwen and convincing her to come along with the familiy. But before he will do this there is a need for a suitable hiding place and some decision making regarding the clans actions.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>With the information regarding the location of Gwen Kok, Fred decides to go visit Koen van Buuren. He will propose approaching Gwen and convincing her to come along with the familiy. But before he will do this there is a need for a suitable hiding place and some decision making regarding the clans actions.</p>

You text Koen van Buuren, it doesn’t take long for him to get back to you:

“Don’t know what you’re on about

If you found GK contact sheriff “

 Koen van Buuren is a primogen and you realize he is therefore obligated to maintain the Court’s official position on domain affairs.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You text Koen van Buuren, it doesn’t take long for him to get back to you:</p><p>“Don’t know what you’re on about</p><p>If you found GK contact sheriff “</p><p> Koen van Buuren is a primogen and you realize he is therefore obligated to maintain the Court’s official position on domain affairs.</p>

Jesse’s clearly off his head when he rings back. It’s almost three o’clock in the morning.

He blathers on about how great the place is. Danny, the bartender, is a real sound guy. Bought Jesse all his drinks, or almost all. Danny’s there every night. Knows everyone that comes through. Some real big fish. And anyway, there’s a poker tourny every Thursday night. That’s when the fat cats come out. Buy in is 20k, if you want to get an invite for the VIP table at the back.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Jesse’s clearly off his head when he rings back. It’s almost three o’clock in the morning.</p><p>He blathers on about how great the place is. Danny, the bartender, is a real sound guy. Bought Jesse all his drinks, or almost all. Danny’s there every night. Knows everyone that comes through. Some real big fish. And anyway, there’s a poker tourny every Thursday night. That’s when the fat cats come out. Buy in is 20k, if you want to get an invite for the VIP table at the back.</p>

You receive another e-mail with a video file attached.

Tom Naaktgeboren picks someone up from a kick-boxing gym in Feyenoord, presumably the Night Mayor. The car drives to the edge of Rotterdam harbor, to the abandoned warehouse where this month’s Elysium was held. They stay in until the early morning. Tom leaves by himself, he drives to an appartment complex near the gym.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You receive another e-mail with a video file attached.</p><p>Tom Naaktgeboren picks someone up from a kick-boxing gym in Feyenoord, presumably the Night Mayor. The car drives to the edge of Rotterdam harbor, to the abandoned warehouse where this month’s Elysium was held. They stay in until the early morning. Tom leaves by himself, he drives to an appartment complex near the gym.</p>

Fred decides to go by Toos Bentinck again in The Hague, it is on the way to Gouda anyways.

""Koen is maintaining his primogen role in this matter and suggests contacting the sheriff. I disagree.""

""If you got an enforcer, I can show where GK can be found.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Fred decides to go by Toos Bentinck again in The Hague, it is on the way to Gouda anyways.</p><p>""Koen is maintaining his primogen role in this matter and suggests contacting the sheriff. I disagree.""</p><p>""If you got an enforcer, I can show where GK can be found.""</p>

You ring the priscus’ office number. A secretary picks up and connects you through.

Toos Bentinck suggests that Primogen van Buuren is simply keeping up appearances. She herself is otherwise engaged currently, so she asks you to go have a talk with Gwen Kok yourself. No enforcers, lets not turn to violence just yet.

“Offer the girl a safe haven or encourage her to flee the domain. She’s not safe out in the open.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You ring the priscus’ office number. A secretary picks up and connects you through.</p><p>Toos Bentinck suggests that Primogen van Buuren is simply keeping up appearances. She herself is otherwise engaged currently, so she asks you to go have a talk with Gwen Kok yourself. No enforcers, lets not turn to violence just yet.</p><p>“Offer the girl a safe haven or encourage her to flee the domain. She’s not safe out in the open.”</p>

Waldo will try to turn this problem to his benefit and moves to Gouda, with the intention to give this neonate a chance..

He approaches using Obfuscate ""Face in the Crowd"" and will try to locate Gwen first by looking around where the video pointed. If he is unsuccesful he will try Auspex to see if she is hiding using the vampiric discipline. 

Clash of Wills: Auspex + Blood Potency = 3d10!

Look around Wits + investigation = 6d10!
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Waldo will try to turn this problem to his benefit and moves to Gouda, with the intention to give this neonate a chance..<br><br>He approaches using Obfuscate ""Face in the Crowd"" and will try to locate Gwen first by looking around where the video pointed. If he is unsuccesful he will try Auspex to see if she is hiding using the vampiric discipline. </p><p class=""content""></p><p>Clash of Wills: Auspex + Blood Potency = 3d10!</p><p>Look around Wits + investigation = 6d10!</p>

Gwen is no where to be found. After a good hour of searching around you locate what seems to’ve been her temporary haven for the day, the door to an electricity division hut has been forced. Inside you find some cardbord boxes, used as an improvised bed, and a shopping bag filled with clothes and a few cosmetics. On closer inspection, some of the clothes turn out to be stained with days old blood.

The girl might still me around.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Gwen is no where to be found. After a good hour of searching around you locate what seems to’ve been her temporary haven for the day, the door to an electricity division hut has been forced. Inside you find some cardbord boxes, used as an improvised bed, and a shopping bag filled with clothes and a few cosmetics. On closer inspection, some of the clothes turn out to be stained with days old blood.</p><p>The girl might still me around.</p>

Fred will stay around the improvised haven. He spends a vitae to become Cloaked, and waits...

No underlings will be instructed

moving on the MORNING

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Fred will stay around the improvised haven. He spends a vitae to become Cloaked, and waits...<br><br>No underlings will be instructed<br><br>moving on the MORNING</p>

MORNING 

You’d not have spotted the figure, if there was anyone else around to distract you from your ward. She’s obfuscated herself, but you figure that that must be her, entering the improvised haven a few hourss before sunrise.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>MORNING </p><p>You’d not have spotted the figure, if there was anyone else around to distract you from your ward. She’s obfuscated herself, but you figure that that must be her, entering the improvised haven a few hourss before sunrise.</p>

Still cloaked Fred follows the figure to the entrance of the haven. When Gwen is on the doostep she hears a crisp voice:

""By the grace of our priscus and the family, childe, I can offer you a safe place...""

""You are not to be wandering around like this, as for me it took only a few hours to find you when I put my effort into it. More will be searching by impetus of the new policies.""

Waldo waits to see how she reacts.

manipulation II + persuation I + clan status I = 4d10
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Still cloaked Fred follows the figure to the entrance of the haven. When Gwen is on the doostep she hears a crisp voice:</p><p>""By the grace of our priscus and the family, childe, I can offer you a safe place..."" <br><br>""You are not to be wandering around like this, as for me it took only a few hours to find you when I put my effort into it. More will be searching by impetus of the new policies.""</p><p>Waldo waits to see how she reacts.</p><p>manipulation II + persuation I + clan status I = 4d10</p>

You startle Gwen Kok . No - more like you scare the living shit out of her. She utters a single “Fuck!” and sprints off towards the train station.

You catch up with her just as she runs through the sliding doors.

“Piss off,” she spits at you, “I know my rights. Public transport is governed by the rules of Elysium. I’m safe here. And besides, I’ve done nothing wrong. Certainly not in this domain.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You startle Gwen Kok . No - more like you scare the living shit out of her. She utters a single “Fuck!” and sprints off towards the train station.</p><p>You catch up with her just as she runs through the sliding doors.</p><p>“Piss off,” she spits at you, “I know my rights. Public transport is governed by the rules of Elysium. I’m safe here. And besides, I’ve done nothing wrong. Certainly not in this domain.”</p>

""I have no intention of harming you Gwen."" Fred says when he casually leans against a lantern post. ""Shut your mouth so you dont make a scene, I am obfuscated towards the rest""

""If you refuse our offer of a safe haven to hide, I advise you to leave this domain. Here you will be hunted, eventually caught and traded for leverage in Amsterdam ...

... Perhaps the Nosferatu in Breda can give you asylum. ""

Fred takes a few steps closer, stops right in front of the doorstep, looks her in the eye and says: ""Make no mistake childe, if you break the masquerade around here we are forced to withdraw our generosity.""

Waldo walks away, leaving her standing in the train station.

Here you will be hunted, eventually caught and traded for leverage in Amsterdam ... </p><p>... Perhaps the Nosferatu in Breda can give you asylum. ""</p><p>Fred takes a few steps closer, stops right in front of the doorstep, looks her in the eye and says: ""Make no mistake childe, if you break the masquerade around here we are forced to withdraw our generosity.""</p><p>Waldo walks away, leaving her standing in the train station.</p>

Instruct underlings:

Henry (Investigation) ••, a contracter who got in league with the wrong people is instructed to check if there has been construction work contracted by Jonathan Kahman in the past years. If so, more details are needed on the locations.

Karin (Investigation) •••, a corrupt politician of the province of Zuid-Holland is instructed to see if she can find any evidence of money laundering originating from the divebar ""xxx"" and to track the movements of this money.

Luc (Investigation) ••, a hobo that is constantly travelling via public transport to go begging in either Den Haag, Delft or Rotterdam is instructed to keep an eye on the divebar ""xxx"". He should make note of all the people entering and leaving, and check if any shady bussiness is done outside.

Jesse is ordered to leave that place and to sober up.

He should make note of all the people entering and leaving, and check if any shady bussiness is done outside.</p><p class=""MsoNormal"" style=""margin-bottom: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt; line-height: normal;""></p><p class=""MsoNormal"" style=""margin-bottom: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt; line-height: normal;"">Jesse is ordered to leave that place and to sober up.</p>
3x Int or Man + Investigation for Instruction
dice roll
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>3x Int or Man + Investigation for Instruction</p>

Henry Kerkhof is groggy, but already awake when you call on him. He mumbels something, an affirmative of sorts, and hangs up.

Only minutes before dawn he gets back to you with a short message, saying he’s found the company name that contracted some few repairs at the xxx-bar. 

Give him more time and he might be able to follow the paper trail.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Henry Kerkhof is groggy, but already awake when you call on him. He mumbels something, an affirmative of sorts, and hangs up.</p><p>Only minutes before dawn he gets back to you with a short message, saying he’s found the company name that contracted some few repairs at the xxx-bar. </p><p>Give him more time and he might be able to follow the paper trail.</p>

The Province’s representative is snappy and groggy when she picks up the phone.

She knows the place you’re on about, a thieves’ den. No doubt she’ll be able to dig something up.

Only an hour later she rings back: this’ll take a while, she’s already being stone walled.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The Province’s representative is snappy and groggy when she picks up the phone.</p><p>She knows the place you’re on about, a thieves’ den. No doubt she’ll be able to dig something up.</p><p>Only an hour later she rings back: this’ll take a while, she’s already being stone walled.</p>

Luc hurries to the xxx.

He provides you with a list of names of people who leave when the bar closes. Most notably: Tom Naaktgeboren, the Night Mayor’s body guard, in the company of a man holding a leather attache case, Thijs Brinkhof, a bookkeeper known to sell his services in the underworld.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Luc hurries to the xxx.</p><p>He provides you with a list of names of people who leave when the bar closes.
