Her curiosity was definitely ablaze, though. </p><p>""Well,"" she told Alieh. ""Guess I've got two jobs to do, then. Unless there's anything else...?""</p>

Alieh did not have anything else for Damson, and wished her well (and a hasty return.) The gardens were struggling, and time was, not yet critical --but the worry had started. 

Maenna, still under some of the flower's influence, continued to whisper. Sometimes direct questions and comments to Damson, but sometimes just random things like . . . 

...though the ship didn't have a Central-mind....

...yes, I know, I don't care what fell to the ocean...

...like origami, just folded in on itself until there was nothing left...

Did Damson take any special precautions taking Maenna? To the Source or to the SL-5 rendezvous?

If so, tell us what that looked like and then, Act Under Fire. The fire being watchful eyes of those you'd rather not be watching (i.e., Nasak).

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Alieh did not have anything else for Damson, and wished her well (and a hasty return.) The gardens were struggling, and time was, not yet critical --but the worry had started. </p><p>Maenna, still under some of the flower's influence, continued to whisper. Sometimes direct questions and comments to Damson, but sometimes just random things like . . . </p><p><em>...though the ship didn't have a Central-mind....</em></p><p><em>...yes, I know, I don't care what fell to the ocean...</em></p><p><em>...like origami, just folded in on itself until there was nothing left...</em></p><p><strong>Did Damson take any special precautions taking Maenna? To the Source or to the SL-5 rendezvous?</strong></p><p><strong>If so, tell us what that looked like and then, Act Under Fire. The fire being watchful eyes of those you'd rather not be watching (i.e., Nasak). </strong></p>

Vedan's fueling station wasn't all that close to the Source, actually, which meant that Damson had to go the long way around.

The White Gardens bordered on Come-and-Go, one of the larger holds. The market there was busy, and Damson had to keep Maenna close to avoid losing her in the crowd, wrapping an arm around her waist and walking side-by-side. But it was a safe way to cover some ground, and a good way to lose anyone who might be following.

From the south gate of Come-and-Go, there were two obvious ways forward. The Green had been an affluent neighborhood once, lots of single-family homes spaced between small, neat lawns. The name came from the lawns, although they weren't so green anymore. It was easy terrain, nice flat pre-attack roads - easy to navigate for a tripping woman prone to trip - but it was also an especially chaotic stretch, filled with petty gangs holding down dead-end streets or traffic islands or even single houses. Damson preferred to steer clear. 

And the other choice, the thoroughly destroyed South End neighborhood, suited Damson's purposes perfectly. The South End had consisted of narrow streets and tall brick townhouses; whatever had blown through here in the attack had ripped holes in some buildings, knocked others over, and left some intact. The result was a chaotic labyrinth, and any path through the area involved cutting through ruined buildings, knowing the right alleys that weren't blocked off, and scrambling over occasional obstacles. 

Getting Maenna through was a real bitch, but choosing the right moment to turn aside and start heading west instead of north - to the fueling station instead of the Source - without her discombobulated charge noticing was easy in the chaotic landscape. 

From there it was just a quick pass through South Kassa. It had been an industrial neighborhood, long streets, fences, warehouses. Damson vaguely remembered it being a rough neighborhood, but now it was mostly undestroyed, and filled with big, defensible structures. There were a few stable, relatively stable holds here - still risky to pass through for strangers, but Damson had plenty of friends here. 

Of course, it wasn't the way to the Source, and as they got past the last hold, into the wilder, more visibly wrecked area surrounding the fueling station, she was starting to get a quizzical look on her face. But she still hadn't said anything by the time Damson spied the fueling station.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Vedan's fueling station wasn't all that close to the Source, actually, which meant that Damson had to go the long way around.</p><p>The White Gardens bordered on Come-and-Go, one of the larger holds. The market there was busy, and Damson had to keep Maenna close to avoid losing her in the crowd, wrapping an arm around her waist and walking side-by-side. But it was a safe way to cover some ground, and a good way to lose anyone who might be following.</p><p>From the south gate of Come-and-Go, there were two obvious ways forward. The Green had been an affluent neighborhood once, lots of single-family homes spaced between small, neat lawns. The name came from the lawns, although they weren't so green anymore. It was easy terrain, nice flat pre-attack roads - easy to navigate for a tripping woman prone to trip - but it was also an especially chaotic stretch, filled with petty gangs holding down dead-end streets or traffic islands or even single houses. Damson preferred to steer clear. </p><p>And the other choice, the thoroughly destroyed South End neighborhood, suited Damson's purposes perfectly. The South End had consisted of narrow streets and tall brick townhouses; whatever had blown through here in the attack had ripped holes in some buildings, knocked others over, and left some intact. The result was a chaotic labyrinth, and any path through the area involved cutting through ruined buildings, knowing the right alleys that weren't blocked off, and scrambling over occasional obstacles. </p><p>Getting Maenna through was a real bitch, but choosing the right moment to turn aside and start heading west instead of north - to the fueling station instead of the Source - without her discombobulated charge noticing was easy in the chaotic landscape. </p><p>From there it was just a quick pass through South Kassa. It had been an industrial neighborhood, long streets, fences, warehouses. Damson vaguely remembered it being a rough neighborhood, but now it was mostly undestroyed, and filled with big, defensible structures. There were a few stable, relatively stable holds here - still risky to pass through for strangers, but Damson had plenty of friends here. </p><p>Of course, it wasn't the way to the Source, and as they got past the last hold, into the wilder, more visibly wrecked area surrounding the fueling station, she was starting to get a quizzical look on her face. But she still hadn't said anything by the time Damson spied the fueling station.</p>

Damson knew that Nasak had been following her, of course, and she also knew the exact spot she'd lost him. The thought made her smile.

There was this one spot in the South End that not a lot of people knew about You scrambled up a pile of bricks onto the second floor of an old house. You passed through the house and out onto a fire escape, which led down to an old alleyway. The alleyway was completely blocked in on both sides, and the only egress was through a big iron door - the back entrance into Tapestry.

Tapestry was a pretty friendly, chill hold. It was big enough to defend itself and prosperous enough to attract visitors. The back door usually stood open, albeit with a heavy guard. 

But Tapestry was also the center of orthodox Woven in the city.

The twisting South End was too close to Tapestry for Nasak to regularly visit; he'd have no idea where he was until it was too late. And he certainly wouldn't know about the hole in the floorboards in one corner of that ruined house that led out into another passage, and from there to South Kassa. Getting the drugged Maenna through that hole was enough to drive Damson half-mad; but when she pictured Nasak trying to explain himself to a half-dozen armed Woven, she knew it was worth it.

And he certainly wouldn't know about the hole in the floorboards in one corner of that ruined house that led out into another passage, and from there to South Kassa. Getting the drugged Maenna through that hole was enough to drive Damson half-mad; but when she pictured Nasak trying to explain himself to a half-dozen armed Woven, she knew it was worth it. </p>

column4:
The newly opened bar had quite a lot of people in it. Doli quickly located the lonesome man sitting by himself having a drink. It was rather easy to approach him, get him to buy her a drink. Quickly words started falling out of him - telling Doli of his business, and how it's all falling apart because of some gang. 

Touching him was easy - he yearned for touch - so soon she was no longer hungry. And yet, the man now was both in a very bad position and even weaker to fend off against the gangsters.

Doli's exhale was almost theatrical, yet she decided to sit down and listen the man out. She sat down facing from the bar, leaning her back onto it, surveying the half-empty place. Not turning around she asked:

""So what do those assholes want from you?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Doli's exhale was almost theatrical, yet she decided to sit down and listen the man out. She sat down facing from the bar, leaning her back onto it, surveying the half-empty place. Not turning around she asked:</p><p>""So what do those assholes want from you?""</p>
""Money, of course. Protection shit... And they want more every week, but c'mon. How can a small artist coffee pay that sort of money... I have enough taxes to pay to the actual government.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Money, of course. Protection shit... And they want more every week, but c'mon. How can a small artist coffee pay that sort of money... I have enough taxes to pay to the actual government."" </p>
""Thought that kind of shit happened only in movies. Say, Ronald, is your coffee shop close by?"" Doli asked lightly swaying in her chair with a rythmic bump on counter.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Thought that kind of shit happened only in movies. Say, Ronald, is your coffee shop close by?"" Doli asked lightly swaying in her chair with a rythmic bump on counter.</p>

The man glanced at Doli, when she mistaken the name ,but he didn't linger on it.

""Yeah, just around the corner. I have no idea what I'll do tomorrow... I should go home. I'm pretty tired now. Thanks for listening to me.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The man glanced at Doli, when she mistaken the name ,but he didn't linger on it.<br><br>""Yeah, just around the corner. I have no idea what I'll do tomorrow... I should go home. I'm pretty tired now. Thanks for listening to me."" </p>

""And what's the name of the gang? Or you where can I find them?"" She moved her head around in a circle until her neck made a satisfying crunch. ""I feel like I have had a lot of anger issues lately. Might be good to let myself be free for a bit.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""And what's the name of the gang? Or you where can I find them?"" She moved her head around in a circle until her neck made a satisfying crunch. ""I feel like I have had a lot of anger issues lately. Might be good to let myself be free for a bit.""</p>

""Merlino's... I don't really know where to find them. They just show up at my door. Tho, I've heard that they often hang out in a bar on a crossing between S6th and Lombard St. Best avoid that place."" 

Saying that he downed his drink, and between the alcohol and lack of blood he seemed fairly wasted.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Merlino's... I don't really know where to find them. They just show up at my door. Tho, I've heard that they often hang out in a bar on a crossing between S6th and Lombard St. Best avoid that place."" <br><br>Saying that he downed his drink, and between the alcohol and lack of blood he seemed fairly wasted. </p>

""Get a cab home, kid. Looking a bit pale."" Doli answered and pushed herself forward to stand up. Chair tipped over balance crashed next to her, yet she was walking already to the exit, phone in her hand.

""Has anyone claimed Merlino's gang?"" she typed out and sent to her favorite computer lady.

Chair tipped over balance crashed next to her, yet she was walking already to the exit, phone in her hand.</p><p>""Has anyone claimed Merlino's gang?"" she typed out and sent to her favorite computer lady.</p>
""Most gangs are with the Carthians. So you should talk with Nathalie. Or maybe just go to Willaim Cross, I've heard he's their main influence guy there.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Most gangs are with the Carthians. So you should talk with Nathalie. Or maybe just go to Willaim Cross, I've heard he's their main influence guy there."" </p>

""Thanks. Gonna drop by you soon to check on our dear crazy friend."" she typed out and checked the maps app to figure out where was the bar located. Disappointed that it was out in Society Hill, she just cursed and started her bike.

column3: [Greg] W2D2 Legs or no legs

column4: Greg arranged the meeting in a restaurant.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-281474""><div class=""row"">

Kimberlee strolled into the restaurant as if it was her own. Everyone's eyes just naturally slid on her and Greg could hardly find that surprising. Her whole attire was evocative, barely leaving things to the imagination. She wouldn't have looked out of place in a show with her corset barely holding her tits in, and her tight pants forcing every mans, and quite a few womens, pulse race in their veins. 

She slid over to Greg. 


""Good evening, Alder Gills."" she smiled, her make up was done perfectly, her lips were lush, filled and lustful. ""I'm happy to meet you.""

Her whole attire was evocative, barely leaving things to the imagination. She wouldn't have looked out of place in a show with her corset barely holding her tits in, and her tight pants forcing every mans, and quite a few womens, pulse race in their veins. <br><br>She slid over to Greg. </p><p><br>""Good evening, Alder Gills."" she smiled, her make up was done perfectly, her lips were lush, filled and lustful. ""I'm happy to meet you."" </p>

Greg instinctively felt the need to spruce himself up.

""My my... Good evening, Miss Temple. It's a pleasure to see you"" Greg cleared his throat ""I've got a job offer that would be perfect for you. You're probably all too familiar with the concept. Controlling a few key persons, all that jazz. Interested?"" Greg smiled.

It's a pleasure to see you"" Greg cleared his throat ""I've got a job offer that would be perfect for you. You're probably all too familiar with the concept. Controlling a few key persons, all that jazz. Interested?"" Greg smiled.</p>

She thought for a moment. ""I'm certainly the right girl to talk with about that. Twisting minds around my finger is one of my many specialties after all."" 

The bartender quickly approached, asking for drinks. ""Vieux Carré, please."" 


At that, Greg noticed the confusion in Bartenders face, but it seemed that rather risking embarrassment he nodded, heard out Greg and left. 

Kimberlee smiled. ""It's always so interesting to see how close.. or far they get... The drink is usualy made in New Orleans and it's fairly complex. Anyways, back to the matter at hand. Who? Where? And most importantly... Why?""

column4:
Callum went to see Nestor again.

He came into his room, and saw him flipping through a fairly old picture album. Callum never saw it before.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-281603""><div class=""row"">

Callum Kelly knocked on the door before entering. That’s right, it was a timid knock. His posture, likewise, was timid. His shoulders were hunched, one hand nervously fixed his tie. He coughed, with his face still half turned away. He was afraid, afraid of showing the old man his face after so many years, afraid of facing the reality of his actions, soon to be read in Nestor’s eyes as C.K. would unburden himself. Again. 

When was the last time he’d confided in his old friend?

“Evening, Neddy,” he coughed again, “Been a while. How you doin’? Mind if I sit down?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Callum Kelly knocked on the door before entering. That’s right, it was a timid knock. His posture, likewise, was timid. His shoulders were hunched, one hand nervously fixed his tie. He coughed, with his face still half turned away. He was afraid, afraid of showing the old man his face after so many years, afraid of facing the reality of his actions, soon to be read in Nestor’s eyes as C.K. would unburden himself. Again. </p><p>When was the last time he’d confided in his old friend?</p><p>“Evening, Neddy,” he coughed again, “Been a while. How you doin’? Mind if I sit down?”</p>

His dreamy gaze barely turned, looked at Callum, before he looked back at the album. 

""Oh, please. Come in, come in. Sit down. I'm... doing better than usual, I'd say. Got these pictures... Thought they were lost. Memory's not good as it used to be, pictures are nice.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>His dreamy gaze barely turned, looked at Callum, before he looked back at the album. <br><br>""Oh, please. Come in, come in. Sit down. I'm... doing better than usual, I'd say. Got these pictures... Thought they were lost. Memory's not good as it used to be, pictures are nice."" </p>

C.K. moved over to the bed and sat himself down next to Nestor. He looked over at the picture album and smiled, a tad melancholy.

“I’m happy you’re doing well, old friend. What’re these photographs off?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>C.K. moved over to the bed and sat himself down next to Nestor. He looked over at the picture album and smiled, a tad melancholy.</p><p>“I’m happy you’re doing well, old friend. What’re these photographs off?”</p>

Callum could see a much younger Nestor in the pictures, together with his children. Most of the photos however, were of little Kerry - his daughter. 

""Oh, my family. I gave this to Kerry when she was leaving to study to Europe. She must have sent it back by now.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Callum could see a much younger Nestor in the pictures, together with his children. Most of the photos however, were of little Kerry - his daughter. </p><p>""Oh, my family. I gave this to Kerry when she was leaving to study to Europe. She must have sent it back by now."" </p>

“I’m pretty sure she herself is back from the Old Country too, Neddy,” C.K. looks up to try and catch Nestor’s eye, “She looks so much like you at that age, though. Do you remember? When you were a kid and we first met?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“I’m pretty sure she herself is back from the Old Country too, Neddy,” C.K. looks up to try and catch Nestor’s eye, “She looks so much like you at that age, though. Do you remember? When you were a kid and we first met?”</p>

He looked at Callum trying to remember. ""Are you joking? When I was a kid... your parents were still kids."" he smiled. ""She's nothing like me. Much braver. Never scared of monsters under the bed.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>He looked at Callum trying to remember. ""Are you joking? When I was a kid... your parents were still kids."" he smiled. ""She's nothing like me. Much braver. Never scared of monsters under the bed."" </p>

“ I’m much, much older than I look, Neddy.”

C.K. gently took Nestor’s hand in his, stroking it with his thumb.

“And I’m probably the monster you’ve been scared of all this time. Remember the Magpies of center square? Did you ever forgive me? Did you ever realize that I saved your life?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“ I’m much, much older than I look, Neddy.”</p><p style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">C.K. gently took Nestor’s hand in his, stroking it with his thumb.</p><p>“And I’m probably the monster you’ve been scared of all this time. Remember the Magpies of center square? Did you ever forgive me? Did you ever realize that I saved your life?”</p>

Nestor thought for a moment, before his eyes filled with fear.

""You... it's... you..."" he started shaking slightly, he looked around and tried to grab the knife he used for dinner, but he clumsily hit it instead, the knife sliding through the room's floor.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Nestor thought for a moment, before his eyes filled with fear.<br><br>""You... it's... you..."" he started shaking slightly, he looked around and tried to grab the knife he used for dinner, but he clumsily hit it instead, the knife sliding through the room's floor. </p>

“Shhhh-“ C.K. reached down to pick up the knife, “It’s all right, I’ve never and would never hurt you.”

He put the knife back in Nestor’s hand.

“I need you to know that. I‘d never do to you what I’ve done to others, what I did just days ago.”

C.K. pulled up his shirt with one hand, exposing the pale skin and scarred flesh of his belly. With the other hand he brought Nestor’s hand, still holding the knife, up to his belly button.

“I need you to forgive me, Ned. Forgive me. Or finish me.”

He winked, deviously.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Shhhh-“ C.K. reached down to pick up the knife, “It’s all right, I’ve never and would never hurt you.”</p><p>He put the knife back in Nestor’s hand.</p><p>“I need you to know that. I‘d never do to you what I’ve done to others, what I did just days ago.”</p><p>C.K. pulled up his shirt with one hand, exposing the pale skin and scarred flesh of his belly. With the other hand he brought Nestor’s hand, still holding the knife, up to his belly button.</p><p>“I need you to forgive me, Ned. Forgive me. Or finish me.”</p><p>He winked, deviously.</p>

Nestor's eyes filled with anger, as he tried to stab Callum, however, as his hand lunged forward he fell out of his chair and fell to the ground, barelly touching Callum. 

""You monster!"" he tried to scream out, but it barelly came out as a normal man's talking.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Nestor's eyes filled with anger, as he tried to stab Callum, however, as his hand lunged forward he fell out of his chair and fell to the ground, barelly touching Callum. <br><br>""You monster!"" he tried to scream out, but it barelly came out as a normal man's talking. </p>

“Yeah!,” C.K. laughed, “That’s it! That’s the brave little Magpie I know. Neddy boy, you’ve still got it! After all these years.”

He sniffed the air, breathing in deep. The smell of Nestor’s sweat, laced with fear and adrenaline, sparked memories of that night, so many decades ago. The clamouring of frenzied children. The sounds of wood racheting against metal bars, tapping against brick and scraping off mortar. A hint of burning and smoke in the air. Their tiny hands pulling at the fabric of his clothes. Tears of anger, glinting off apple-red cheeks. They were his life, they confirmed his death. Their ghosts were all he had left to remember him of days gone by, afternoons passed basking in the sun at Centre Square while waiting for the Magpies to line his pockets with stolen silver, their voices whispering the city’s hidden truths.

He stood over the now sobbing Nestor White. It occured to C.K. how fragile age had left the man. He kneeled down to stroke Nestor’s hair.

“Calm down now,” he said, as he, gently as he could, helped the old man back in his seat, “Say the word and I’ll make you forget again.”
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Yeah!,” C.K. laughed, “That’s it! That’s the brave little Magpie I know. Neddy boy, you’ve still got it! After all these years.”</p><p>He sniffed the air, breathing in deep. The smell of Nestor’s sweat, laced with fear and adrenaline, sparked memories of that night, so many decades ago. The clamouring of frenzied children. The sounds of wood racheting against metal bars, tapping against brick and scraping off mortar. A hint of burning and smoke in the air. Their tiny hands pulling at the fabric of his clothes. Tears of anger, glinting off apple-red cheeks. They were his life, they confirmed his death. Their ghosts were all he had left to remember him of days gone by, afternoons passed basking in the sun at Centre Square while waiting for the Magpies to line his pockets with stolen silver, their voices whispering the city’s hidden truths.</p><p>He stood over the now sobbing Nestor White. It occured to C.K. how fragile age had left the man. He kneeled down to stroke Nestor’s hair.</p><p>“<strong>Calm down now</strong>,” he said, as he, gently as he could, helped the old man back in his seat, “Say the word and I’ll make you forget again.”</p>
""What..."" he sobbed, breathing heavily. ""You're gonna die."" his breaths were slowing somewhat.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""What..."" he sobbed, breathing heavily. ""You're gonna die."" his breaths were slowing somewhat. </p>

“Maybe,” he said. C.K. rifled through his pockets and pulled out his deck of cigarettes, “Maybe not.”

He put a cigarette in his mouth and started chewing the filter end. His eye fell on the picture album on the floor. He bent over, picked it up and leafed through it. There were many moments in there he recognized, moments where he’d been present just before or after, always in the shadows.

“Mind if I borrow this, Ned?,” he said, “Nah - of course you won’t. You’ll just forget I was here anyway.”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“Maybe,” he said. C.K. rifled through his pockets and pulled out his deck of cigarettes, “Maybe not.”</p><p>He put a cigarette in his mouth and started chewing the filter end. His eye fell on the picture album on the floor. He bent over, picked it up and leafed through it. There were many moments in there he recognized, moments where he’d been present just before or after, always in the shadows.</p><p>“Mind if I borrow this, Ned?,” he said, “Nah - of course you won’t. You’ll just <strong>forget I was here</strong> anyway.”</p>

column3: [Matthew] W2D2 Brilliance has a cost

column4: Matthew met with Erza in her small haven, which also contained some of her library.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-281476""><div class=""row"">
""Ah, Matthew. How is your work going?"" she asked, without much of an intro as soon as he stepped into the room.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Ah, Matthew. How is your work going?"" she asked, without much of an intro as soon as he stepped into the room. </p>

""I recently found one of the books that grandsire had. I am studying it and I think soon I will be able to improve myself. His handwriting is... mysterious and horrible, hard to read. But I am here for a different reason. I was contacted by one of the members of the Invictus and I learned that some humans are using sanctified rituals, so I wanted to ask you if I could access your library, I never knew they could do that with out as training them""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I recently found one of the books that grandsire had. I am studying it and I think soon I will be able to improve myself. His handwriting is... mysterious and horrible, hard to read. But I am here for a different reason. I was contacted by one of the members of the Invictus and I learned that some humans are using sanctified rituals, so I wanted to ask you if I could access your library, I never knew they could do that with out as training them""</p>

""Why do you think they are using Sanctified rituals? There are many humans with magical capability, and just like Kindred, who dress their powers in the trappings of religion, so do they."" she asked, while flipping over a note book on her table.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Why do you think they are using <em>Sanctified </em>rituals? There are many humans with magical capability, and just like Kindred, who dress their powers in the trappings of religion, so do they."" she asked, while flipping over a note book on her table. </p>

""I guessed as much, but Giacomo described it as ""sanctified"" ritual. So before I go in there to investigate, I want to read about the subject more and I assumed you have at least some information about it""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I guessed as much, but Giacomo described it as ""sanctified"" ritual. So before I go in there to investigate, I want to read about the subject more and I assumed you have at least some information about it""</p>

""As far as I looked into the religious ritual magic of Kindred, Sanctified magic is undoable by mortals. Unlike the acolyte one. But as I said, I haven't looked into this matter that much. No value to be gained there.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""As far as I looked into the religious ritual magic of Kindred, Sanctified magic is undoable by mortals. Unlike the acolyte one. But as I said, I haven't looked into this matter that much. No value to be gained there."" </p>
""May I then read everything you have on the subject and use your library? At least I will get a favor from the Invictus member. Sometimes they are useful""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""May I then read everything you have on the subject and use your library? At least I will get a favor from the Invictus member. Sometimes they are useful""</p>

""I will get Kathe to deliver you the books and help you with the information searching, but I doubt you're gonna find much of use among those tomes. If anything, you should probably request a report from Zena. Maybe her research is not such a waste of time after all, if it will aid you.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I will get Kathe to deliver you the books and help you with the information searching, but I doubt you're gonna find much of use among those tomes. If anything, you should probably request a report from Zena. Maybe her research is not such a waste of time after all, if it will aid you."" <br><br></p>

""Thank You sire. I will probably take Zena to see their rituals as well. If she is researching them at least she'll learn something and maybe see what I missed, but highly doubted"" Matt smirks in a cocky way

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Thank You sire. I will probably take Zena to see their rituals as well. If she is researching them at least she'll learn something and maybe see what I missed, but highly doubted"" Matt smirks in a cocky way</p>
Soon, Kathe delivered the books to Matthew and the two looked into the mortal powers. Once that was done, she took the books back to Erza.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Soon, Kathe delivered the books to Matthew and the two looked into the mortal powers. Once that was done, she took the books back to Erza. </p>
dice roll

with Kathe's help, Matthew  confirmed quite a few things he already knew, and read about some more mortals who exhibit magical powers.

As far as Erza's books could tell, Circles and Lanceas magic is not that much different from Disciplines. Or more like a set of devotions, with similar thematic usage, of course, coloured by the so called faith, as proven by the fact that some of the Lancea rituals have been found used among the Circle, but, with different motifs. 

Among humans, there's a wide variety of shamans, wizards, or even humans with simple tricks up their sleeves, of which a lot claim them to be religious. In fact, it makes sense, in terms, that as humans believe in something, often, magical powers manifest in accordance to the said beliefs.

A similar explanation could follow then, what kind of powers the religious covenants have, as it seems they are all devotions on a single discipline, yet the discipline is based on faith.

In fact, it makes sense, in terms, that as humans believe in something, often, magical powers manifest in accordance to the said beliefs.</p><p>A similar explanation could follow then, what kind of powers the religious covenants have, as it seems they are all devotions on a single discipline, yet the discipline is based on faith. </p>

column4: Balthasaar is initiating the meeting, but I'll leave it up to you two to figure out the details. First poster can probably set the scene, to either be in Balthasaar's church, or Giacomo's restaurant. Or another place.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-281693""><div class=""row"">

(Giacomo's restaurant is fine with me, especially since I am initiating the scene and requested the meeting)

Balthasaar enters the restaurant and leaves his ghoul bodyguard at the door.  Balthasaar looks about tentatively and then approaches Giacomo.

""Ahhh, the most honorable Alder, Baron, and Judex!!!  At last we meet.  I am Bishop Spacek of the Lancea et Sanctum.  We serve God and the Dark Prophet to stand as advisors to the Invictus in these troubled nights."", Balthasaar says.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>(Giacomo's restaurant is fine with me, especially since I am initiating the scene and requested the meeting)</p><p>Balthasaar enters the restaurant and leaves his ghoul bodyguard at the door.  Balthasaar looks about tentatively and then approaches Giacomo.</p><p>""Ahhh, the most honorable Alder, Baron, and Judex!!!  At last we meet.  I am Bishop Spacek of the Lancea et Sanctum.  We serve God and the Dark Prophet to stand as advisors to the Invictus in these troubled nights."", Balthasaar says.   </p>

""Bishop, It is good to meet you!  Please, come to my office where we can more privacy.""

As Giacomo leads Balthasaar to his office, upstairs, they enter the quaint, smaller room.  A bit disheveled, papers stacked up on his desk and about the room, pictures waiting to be hung.  

""Please excuse the mess, the work of a lawyer I tell you...thank you for sending word of your coming.  I had some interest in speaking with you as well.  How may I be of service?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Bishop, It is good to meet you!  Please, come to my office where we can more privacy.""</p><p>As Giacomo leads Balthasaar to his office, upstairs, they enter the quaint, smaller room.  A bit disheveled, papers stacked up on his desk and about the room, pictures waiting to be hung.  </p><p>""Please excuse the mess, the work of a lawyer I tell you...thank you for sending word of your coming.  I had some interest in speaking with you as well.  How may I be of service?"" </p>

""Well, as a matter of fact, I am here to offer you my services, be they as they may.  The Lancea Sanctum is once again coming back to its roots.  For too long many in the Invictus have gone without spiritual advisors and confessors on their Requiems.  As Bishop I have ordered all in the Lancea Sanctum clergy to attach themselves to members of the Invictus and fulfill our duties as the Second Estate.

I have chosen you as the one I would advise, if you will accept me?  You are especially interested in breaches in the Masquerade, are you not?  In the Sanguineous Catechism the second canon deals exclusively with the inalienable wisdom of the Masquerade.  In the Lancea Sanctum we do not just see the Masquerade as a necessity for survival or common sense - instead we see it as a heavenly mandate for all kindred.

Thus you are on a holy mission.  However, there are considerations - spiritual, personal, and practical.  I would like the opportunity to help you on your quest."", Balthasaar says.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Well, as a matter of fact, I am here to offer you my services, be they as they may.  The Lancea Sanctum is once again coming back to its roots.  For too long many in the Invictus have gone without spiritual advisors and confessors on their Requiems.  As Bishop I have ordered all in the Lancea Sanctum clergy to attach themselves to members of the Invictus and fulfill our duties as the Second Estate.</p><p>I have chosen you as the one I would advise, if you will accept me?  You are especially interested in breaches in the Masquerade, are you not?  In the <em>Sanguineous Catechism</em> the second canon deals exclusively with the inalienable wisdom of the Masquerade.  In the Lancea Sanctum we do not just see the Masquerade as a necessity for survival or common sense - instead we see it as a heavenly mandate for all kindred.</p><p>Thus you are on a holy mission.  However, there are considerations - spiritual, personal, and practical.  I would like the opportunity to help you on your quest."", Balthasaar says.  </p>

""The First Estate has always had the Second to advise, however indirectly it may be, I for one am glad to have you as our Bishop.  In the past, I have not seen the full value of the Lancea Sanctum, to be honest.  Though more so these last few years, I have come to see the error of my ways.  The masquerade is paramount in our survival,, and if it be a heavenly mandate, then so be it; as long as the Masquerade is upheld.

I welcome your service Balthasaar, and have recently come to knowledge of a cabal of humans wielding similar ritual magic of that as the Crones, among other news which seems trivial compared to this. 

They could shine an unwanted light onto us and the consequences would have dire potential.  Have you hear of this news?"" asks Castucci.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""The First Estate has always had the Second to advise, however indirectly it may be, I for one am glad to have you as our Bishop.  In the past, I have not seen the full value of the Lancea Sanctum, to be honest.  Though more so these last few years, I have come to see the error of my ways.  The masquerade is paramount in our survival,, and if it be a heavenly mandate, then so be it; as long as the Masquerade is upheld.</p><p>I welcome your service Balthasaar, and have recently come to knowledge of a cabal of humans wielding similar ritual magic of that as the Crones, among other news which seems trivial compared to this. </p><p>They could shine an unwanted light onto us and the consequences would have dire potential.  Have you hear of this news?"" asks Castucci.</p>

""Mortals wielding Crúac?  No, I haven't heard.  That doesn't seem possible unless someone among the Acolytes is helping them.  Crúac is very different from Theban Miracles, the Crones burn up blood and their own sense of morality to ancient pagan goddesses to achieve their results.  In the Lancea Sanctum we use our will and faith in the Almighty, mortals can assist us in our rituals, but they cannot direct or lead them.  I would believe the same is true of Crúac.

The only other thing I can think of is the Strix.  From what little I know is that the Strix can use Crúac with an equal proficiency as an Acolyte, though they have to use kindred blood to fuel it.

Are you able to provide any more details on this matter?"", Balthasaar asks.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Mortals wielding Crúac?  No, I haven't heard.  That doesn't seem possible unless someone among the Acolytes is helping them.  Crúac is very different from Theban Miracles, the Crones burn up blood and their own sense of morality to ancient pagan goddesses to achieve their results.  In the Lancea Sanctum we use our will and faith in the Almighty, mortals can assist us in our rituals, but they cannot direct or lead them.  I would believe the same is true of Crúac.</p><p>The only other thing I can think of is the Strix.  From what little I know is that the Strix can use Crúac with an equal proficiency as an Acolyte, though they have to use kindred blood to fuel it.</p><p>Are you able to provide any more details on this matter?"", Balthasaar asks.</p>

FOr some reason or another, he asked my opinion on allowing the werewolves to hunt in our lands...upon further thought, I do not know why I agreed to this...""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Exact details, no.  I can tell you though, I learned this from Matthew."" states Giacomo.  ""I've advised him to bring this to the Sanctum. FOr some reason or another, he asked my opinion on allowing the werewolves to hunt in our lands...upon further thought, I do not know why I agreed to this...""</p>

""I can't say I know who Matthew is, but he can bring anything he'd like to my attention.  Allow werewolves into the city to hunt?  Yes, that does seem to be a mistake - but I won't presume to give you advice unless you ask me for it."", Balthasaar says.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I can't say I know who Matthew is, but he can bring anything he'd like to my attention.  Allow werewolves into the city to hunt?  Yes, that does seem to be a mistake - but I won't presume to give you advice unless you ask me for it."", Balthasaar says.</p>

Your opinion is always welcome, just know that it what it will be."" Giacomo says bluntly. ""I am curious to know if he had used a power of the blood on me, I will find out in due time.

""I would like to hear your opinion in a certain matter. It has come to my attention that on of our kind has been able to become human, for a short period of time.  It amazes me that they could somehow loose their beast in this manner. What are your thought on this?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Your opinion is always welcome, just know that it what it will be."" Giacomo says bluntly. ""I am curious to know if he had used a power of the blood on me, I will find out in due time.</p><p>""I would like to hear your opinion in a certain matter. It has come to my attention that on of our kind has been able to become human, for a short period of time.  It amazes me that they could somehow loose their beast in this manner. ""If we weren't in Elysium I could tell you if a discipline were being used on you.  I am a master of Auspex, very little escapes my notice when I choose to focus on it.  But my hands are tied because I will not violate the Prince's peace and laws.

A kindred able to become human?  It is an abomination in the eyes of God - we were damned with purpose, it is not our place to go back.  Two possibilities that I can think of: 1) They are a member of the Ordo Dracul and are able to shrug off some of our weaknesses.  2)  Some type of temporary Golconda perhaps.  If I could examine the kindred in question I could come up with a great deal more."", Balthasaar replies.

""Well, we could most certainly do this on the roof of this establishment?  I wouldn't want to assume I could break the laws of the Elysium at my order."" says Giacomo.  

""The Kindred in question is part of my clan, his name is Frank Redd. Please keep me informed of the progress should you find out...""

""Yes, I will interview this Frank Redd.""

Balthasaar stands up and is ready to follow Giacomo to the roof.

Giacomo moves across the room to the window.  He steps onto the fire-escapeand and motions Balthasaar to follow.  

The night is crisp, as was every night.  he wondered about Frank and how he had done it.  Giacomo had started to get used being a vampire.  How long could Frank revert, he wondered.

Arriving on the roof, he stared at Balthasaar.   It was a bit funny.  A preist and lawyer standing on the roof of a building.

Giacomo smiles thinking of the thought.

dice roll

Balthasaar saw himself standing in front of Matthew. The topic at hand was over and Matthew changed the direction towards werewolves.

""Let me know if you find out something"" Matt smiles ""Yes, there is one more thing I want to discuss with you, the werewolf issue""

Upon hearing the words, Balthasaar got terrified. He knew werewolves are a big problem, and he had to do whatever it takes to stop fighting."" 

Balthasaar then spoke ""Yes, yes....the werewolf issue.  Please explain, how can I help?"" 

Matt smiles ""Well, they want to hunt in our lands one day a year. For the first time we'll just do the ""trial run"", if everything goes smoothly, they will be allowed to hunt spirits once a year. Do you agree with that? That will drastically improve relationship between our species""

Balthasaar agreed, in his own mind he knew that he had to stop possible werewolf aggression and this just made sense ""Sounds like that would work nicely.""

column4: Beyond the Wall: Save the Children! Campaign

Sunny and Kyffin, (and anyone else joining them) make their way out of the town and along the road east. The sun is shining and the sky is a bright blue with only a dusting of clouds to the south. The only sounds in the fields next to the road are the songs of birds and the chirping of insects. The breeze carries the scents of rich soil and grain. 


Farmer Hansen's steading is south-east of town, comprising some 150 acres. He farms mostly maize, amaranth, and quinoa. The path from the road to his farmhouse runs north to south, and as you walk into his circle of land you see him at the first intersection. He's a stocky man of 50+ years, with skin a dark, leathery tan, deep brown eyes and a sharp nose. He is standing on the road, looking in toward the field, and doesn't see you approaching.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282757""><div class=""row"">

The fields of Farmer Hansen's are just as Sunny remembers them.  Even herself as a child she would spend time here playing in them.""I remember how the children loved to play among the haystacks."" she says.  ""I can still see Mancy running with Wilhelm and Mako they were so happy!"" Walking through the fields she approaches the Hansen Farm House ""I bet Farmer Hansen will remember more about where the children liked to spend their days"" she said.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The fields of Farmer Hansen's are just as Sunny remembers them.  Even herself as a child she would spend time here playing in them.<strong>""I remember how the children loved to play among the haystacks.""</strong> she says. <strong> ""I can still see Mancy running with Wilhelm and Mako they were so happy!""</strong> Walking through the fields she approaches the Hansen Farm House <strong>""I bet Farmer Hansen will remember more about where the children liked to spend their days""</strong> she said.</p>

Usually, Kyffin does not keep to roads or footpaths, preferring to range freely across fields and undergrowth, exploring all sorts of nooks and crannies by the wayside. As they approach farmer Hansen's fields, though, Kyffin walks quietly and orderly behind Sunny on the path. Right before they reach the old farmer where he stands along the path, Kyffin whispers:

""Uh... Sunny, look... maybe you can talk to old Hansen? I bet he still remembers me, even if it was a couple of years ago. I didn't take THAT many, but boy was he mad when his corn cobs went missing! I was lucky I almost ran into a rabbit, 'cause that big, angry dog of his set off after it like an arrow and forgot all about me!""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Usually, Kyffin does not keep to roads or footpaths, preferring to range freely across fields and undergrowth, exploring all sorts of nooks and crannies by the wayside. As they approach farmer Hansen's fields, though, Kyffin walks quietly and orderly behind Sunny on the path. Right before they reach the old farmer where he stands along the path, Kyffin whispers:</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(127, 96, 0);"">""Uh... Sunny, look... maybe you can talk to old Hansen? I bet he still remembers me, even if it was a couple of years ago. I didn't take THAT many, but boy was he mad when his corn cobs went missing! I was lucky I almost ran into a rabbit, 'cause that big, angry dog of his set off after it like an arrow and forgot all about me!""</span></p>

Sunny walks gracefully through the fields towards the old farm house and knocks on the door hoping that Farmer Hansen will remember her from when she was a child she turns to Kyffin ""Let's see if the old man is home,he may have been the last person to see the children"" she says.  Her knocking echos inside the farm house, the sounds of the old wood of the house creak in the wind.  ""What a beautiful day, i wish i was younger"" she muses.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sunny walks gracefully through the fields towards the old farm house and knocks on the door hoping that Farmer Hansen will remember her from when she was a child she turns to Kyffin<strong> ""Let's see if the old man is home,he may have been the last person to see the children"" </strong>she says.  Her knocking echos inside the farm house, the sounds of the old wood of the house creak in the wind. <strong> ""What a beautiful day, i wish i was younger""</strong> she muses.</p>

The farmhouse is a small one-story building, old and weathered as its main occupant. Farmer Hansen used to have a wife, and children, but his youngest son eldest son left for the cities and his second oldest left for the sea; his daughters married and his wife and firstborn son died of the Great Sickness nearly 20 years ago. He works the farm alone now. His house was painted, once, bright yellow and blue, but most of it has long since chipped away, and the patches that are left are so soiled it's hard to tell which of the two colors they once were. The roof is made of wooden shingles, many missing, and the whole lot sagging inward. For all of that, Hansen is accounted to be a good man, however stern or melancholy.

He was outside when Sunnny rapped on the door, and comes along the path now having heard the knocking. He has aged, perhaps, since you last saw him: his gait is uneven, as though one of his legs has grown longer than the other, or gone crooked, and the lines on his face are more pronounced. His eyes seem to be sunken slightly in their sockets, but there is a light behind them.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The farmhouse is a small one-story building, old and weathered as its main occupant. Farmer Hansen used to have a wife, and children, but his youngest son eldest son left for the cities and his second oldest left for the sea; his daughters married and his wife and firstborn son died of the Great Sickness nearly 20 years ago. He works the farm alone now. His house was painted, once, bright yellow and blue, but most of it has long since chipped away, and the patches that are left are so soiled it's hard to tell which of the two colors they once were. The roof is made of wooden shingles, many missing, and the whole lot sagging inward. For all of that, Hansen is accounted to be a good man, however stern or melancholy.</p><p>He was outside when Sunnny rapped on the door, and comes along the path now having heard the knocking. He has aged, perhaps, since you last saw him: his gait is uneven, as though one of his legs has grown longer than the other, or gone crooked, and the lines on his face are more pronounced. His eyes seem to be sunken slightly in their sockets, but there is a light behind them.  </p>
""Fair weather to you this afternoon,"" he says in a wheezy sort of voice. ""Forgive me, I wasn't expecting visitors today. What can I do for you, Miss...Darkgem, is it?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Fair weather to you this afternoon,"" he says in a wheezy sort of voice. ""Forgive me, I wasn't expecting visitors today. What can I do for you, Miss...Darkgem, is it?""</p>

column4:
October, Tor, Beats, Sisqo, Dana, Gritch, and (presumably) Scarlet arrive at October's apartment after a short walk from the North Stage at the Spring Fling.

October, describe the abode that the others see.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282011""><div class=""row"">

""Welcome to our humble home,"" October chimes as she opens the door. Walking up the stairs, it's seems to have been an old apartment or project tenement, though years of graffiti, broken flooring, blown out walls and minor structural damage make it hard to know for sure.

""I'm not quite sure why DK chose this place to hunker down, there are nicer buildings out here."" October comments as they finish the climb to the top of the stairs, walking on wooden planks in some places ""Something about it being 'defensible' or something...""

Shrugging, she pulls out a small set of keys and with a klik-grunck she forcibly twists the lock open...though at first glance it's hard to see why she bothers as half the door is missing. Noting their confusion, she points to a fire axe on the ceiling, cleverly hidden from sight and perfectly aimed to brain any intruders.

Upon entering, it's clear that the 'loft' is actually three neighboring Pre Shit apartments conjoined by the haphazard use of explosives on the shared walls, with edges of drywall and visible studs now reduced to splinters and parts of the floor and ceiling obviously sagging, with buckets and old coolers located beneath obvious wet spots to collect any leaking.

The loft itself sits in the corner of the building, with small windows, thick brick walls reinforced with random scrap salvaged from what might have been car bodies once, and a blown out window that leads to a fire escape. The large center room is sparsely decorated and furnished; old cork boards with empty shells pushed into them poorly spelling TOILIT, OCKTOBURS ROOM and ARMORY while pointing different directions make up the majority of what could be called wall art, with several desks, a table and a workbench being the most notable furniture in the main room, alongside a very badly bowing couch. And on every available flat surface is evidence of Dylan's profession: gun parts, cleaning oil, empty magazines and cartridges, pieces of scrap metal, old treated timber. And most recently there are a number of children's toys lying in one corner, sun bleached and with most of them missing pieces, inevitably lost to time.

Still, all things considered, it's surprisingly clean, with the only notable mess due to the dust and debris from Dylan's most recent 'expansion,' the fortification of the new area clearly taking precedence. All in all, a comparatively spacious and simple housing fit for a mercenary. 
Something interesting though...it takes a moment for the realization to gestate, but eventually it becomes clear that as much as this place fits Dylan (or, at least the description of him), it doesn't fit October. It doesn't feel like a teenage girl lives here or that a musician would call this home. In fact, aside from the poorly spelled sign pointing to her room, you'd be forgiven for thinking she doesn't live here at all...

""Dylan! Hope? Stokes? Anybody home?"" October calls out hopefully, nervously.

And most recently there are a number of children's toys lying in one corner, sun bleached and with most of them missing pieces, inevitably lost to time.</p><p>Still, all things considered, it's surprisingly clean, with the only notable mess due to the dust and debris from Dylan's most recent 'expansion,' the fortification of the new area clearly taking precedence. All in all, a comparatively spacious and simple housing fit for a mercenary. <br>Something interesting though...it takes a moment for the realization to gestate, but eventually it becomes clear that as much as this place fits Dylan (or, at least the description of him), it doesn't fit October. It doesn't <em>feel</em> like a teenage girl lives here or that a musician would call this home. In fact, aside from the poorly spelled sign pointing to her room, you'd be forgiven for thinking she doesn't live here at all...</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""Dylan! Hope? Stokes? Anybody home?""</span></strong> October calls out hopefully, nervously.</p>

Sisqo looks around the spacious apartment. He hasn’t had four walls put together with wood and screws that he called a home for... well as long as he can remember. Growing up, his mom took him on the road after his father left her in the middle of the night, maybe when he was 7. Or was it 8? Either way, this place looks nothing like where he grew up, yet still it reminds him of that place - more than anything has since he left it anyway. 

As he peers around, he quietly whispers to himself. “Paradise. She lives in a paradise. Good on her.” As spacious and luxurious as it is, it’s not for him. Doesn’t have wheels.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo looks around the spacious apartment. He hasn’t had four walls put together with wood and screws that he called a home for... well as long as he can remember. Growing up, his mom took him on the road after his father left her in the middle of the night, maybe when he was 7. Or was it 8? Either way, this place looks nothing like where he grew up, yet still it reminds him of that place - more than anything has since he left it anyway. </p><p>As he peers around, he quietly whispers to himself. “Paradise. She lives in a paradise. Good on her.” As spacious and luxurious as it is, it’s not for him. Doesn’t have wheels. </p>

""Ock-to-bur-s ..."" Gritch enunciates carefully, reading the corkboard.

He chuckles. ""Good sense of humor.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Ock-to-bur-s ...""</strong> Gritch enunciates carefully, reading the corkboard.</p><p>He chuckles. <strong>""Good sense of humor.""</strong></p>

At some point during the tour, when Sisqo has some meters of separation from the girls, Tor steps up beside him.

""My name is Tor."" He says, holding out a firm but gentle hand to shake. ""Thank you for the save back there, things could have gotten out of hand if you had not stepped in at just the right time.""

Tor looks a bit sheepish, ""Could you... explain to Scarlet that I meant no offence with my comment. My brain was in 'little girl in trouble. protect little girl' mode and my mouth... well my mouth saw that as an opportunity to do that... As October said, I have no right to say what she should wear, am not judging."" He says, even though his tone suggests some judgement.

Looking around the place, Tor wonders at the weapons and traps scattered all over, Is this really a safe environment for a child? But he says nothing, choosing to withhold his judgement there too... for now.

Please don't tell me 'bad spelling' is what passes for humor in these parts. He silently begs the universe, catching Dana's eye with a sad shake of his head.

My brain was in 'little girl in trouble. protect little girl' mode and my mouth... well my mouth saw that as an opportunity to do that... As October said, I have no right to say what she should wear, am not judging.""</strong> He says, even though his tone suggests <em>some</em> judgement.</p><p>Looking around the place, Tor wonders at the weapons and traps scattered all over, <em>Is this really a safe environment for a child?</em> But he says nothing, choosing to withhold his judgement there too... for now.</p><p><em>Please don't tell me 'bad spelling' is what passes for humor in these parts.</em> He silently begs the universe, catching Dana's eye with a sad shake of his head.</p>
There is no response to October's call from either of the two  men, and no sign of them or of Hope.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>There is no response to <strong>October's</strong> call from either of the two  men, and no sign of them or of Hope.</p>

Dana follows the others inside.  She lets out an appreciative whistle.

""Wow!"" Is all she can say as she looks about in reverence at the apartment.

Dana steps to the stack of toys and kneels down, carefully examining them, a faint, wistful smile on her lips.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dana follows the others inside.  She lets out an appreciative whistle.</p><p><strong>""Wow!""</strong> Is all she can say as she looks about in reverence at the apartment.</p><p>Dana steps to the stack of toys and kneels down, carefully examining them, a faint, wistful smile on her lips.</p>

Tor offers his hand to Sisqo. Sisqo looks at it for a moment, looks up at Tor’s stature, and his face. He looks to a broken mirror on the wall, intact enough to see the contrast between him and Tor. He looks back to his hand. Good god! This guy is good looking. If this were another life, and I wanted to be a douche bag, I would want to be this guy he thinks. 

Sisqo shakes Tor’s hand, making sure it is a stronger grip than Tor was expecting. “Sisqo” he says. Sisqo wasn’t expecting this from Tor. Usually guys that look like Tor treat him like shit, beat on him, throw him under the bus, make him a punchline to the joke. But this is new. There is potential here he thinks to himself. Whatever the fuck that means nowadays. The fact that October trusts him...well he deserves a test drive in my books. 

When Tor finishes, Sisqo replies vainly - almost in defense from past interactions with similar people “ya well, that’s what I do. I drive. I navigate. You know, I pay attention. And when my people are in the shit, I get them out. That sitch there was about to go to shit, and I don’t know - it’s like cruise control was on or something. I just jumped in.” He finishes, realizing that he doesn’t need to impress Tor. Not right now anyway. 

He claps Tor on the side of the arm (as high as he can reach - it’s a bit awkward) and leans in. “Tor, don’t worry about Scarlet. She’s cool. And she can hold her own. If she has a fucking problem with you, you will know it. Hell, we all will.”

Sisqo says to him, in a genuine tone “hey man, for what it’s worth, I got your back.” Feeling better, Sisqo approaches Dana. 

“What the hell is worth smiling about here Dana?”

If this were another life, and I wanted to be a douche bag, I would want to be this guy</em> he thinks. </p><p><strong>Sisqo</strong> shakes <strong>Tor’s</strong> hand, making sure it is a stronger grip than Tor was expecting. “<strong>Sisqo</strong>” he says. <strong>Sisqo</strong> wasn’t expecting this from <strong>Tor</strong>. Usually guys that look like <strong>Tor</strong> treat him like shit, beat on him, throw him under the bus, make him a punchline to the joke. But this is new. <em>There is potential here</em> he thinks to himself. <em>Whatever the fuck that means nowadays. The fact that October trusts him...well he deserves a test drive in my books. </em></p><p>When <strong>Tor</strong> finishes, <strong>Sisqo</strong> replies vainly - almost in defense from past interactions with similar people “<strong>ya well, that’s what I do. I drive. I navigate. You know, I pay attention. And when my people are in the shit, I get them out. That sitch there was about to go to shit, and I don’t know - it’s like cruise control was on or something. I just jumped in.</strong>” He finishes, realizing that he doesn’t need to impress <strong>Tor</strong>. Not right now anyway. </p><p>He claps <strong>Tor</strong> on the side of the arm (as high as he can reach - it’s a bit awkward) and leans in. “<strong>Tor, don’t worry about Scarlet. She’s cool. And she can hold her own. If she has a fucking problem with you, you will know it. Hell, we all will.</strong>”</p><p><strong style="""">Sisqo</strong> says to him, in a genuine tone “<strong style="""">hey man, for what it’s worth, I got your back.</strong>” Feeling better, <strong style="""">Sisqo</strong> approaches <strong style="""">Dana</strong>. </p><p>“<strong>What the hell is worth smiling about here Dana?</strong>”</p>

Shaken from her momentary revery, Dana stands quickly, stiffening.

She looks to Sisqo and then the toys.

""Those.  Some children don't have things like that to play with,"" she says, her expression neutral.

An indifferent shrug.

""Just an observation,"" she says.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Shaken from her momentary revery, Dana stands quickly, stiffening.</p><p>She looks to <strong>Sisqo </strong>and then the toys.</p><p><strong>""Those.  Some children don't have things like that to play with,""</strong> she says, her expression neutral.</p><p>An indifferent shrug.</p><p><strong>""Just an observation,""</strong> she says.</p>

Having followed Sisqo over to Dana, Tor looks at the toys. ""Are those good?"" He asks, not sure about what passes for toys these days. ""She looks to be cared for."" He agrees, not surprised. ""But what did you expect, she lives with October.""

 He glances again at the weapons and traps with a critical eye. ""At least the axe-trap it too high to hurt her and there is no ammo lying around. Right?"" The care is apparent, but he is still dubious about the safety.

Addressing Sisqo again he returns to subject he understands better. ""So, you beat a bike while driving a truck?"" He says, sounding impressed. ""I assume it was not just a slow bike."" He smiles. ""And that you did not just drive faster. That must have taken some fancy driving."" He remembers another detail. ""And this was on their turf?"" This precludes the old trick of using shortcut-cheats, making it all the more impressive.

That must have taken some fancy driving.""</strong> He remembers another detail. <strong>""And this was on <em>their</em> turf?""</strong> This precludes the old trick of using shortcut-cheats, making it all the more impressive.</p>

Dana stares back at the toys and grunts as she nods her apparent agreement with Tor's statement that the girl was well cared for.

Her eyes glance in October's direction and then back to the toys.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dana stares back at the toys and grunts as she nods her apparent agreement with <strong>Tor's</strong> statement that the girl was well cared for.</p><p>Her eyes glance in October's direction and then back to the toys.</p>
“hmph” Sisqo smiles at Tor’s questions. “Have you ever heard the story from long before called... well I don’t know what it was called. It’s about a rabbit and a turtle that have a race?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“hmph” Sisqo smiles at Tor’s questions. “Have you ever heard the story from long before called... well I don’t know what it was called. It’s about a rabbit and a turtle that have a race?”</p>

""Oh, the bike broke down?"" Tor says, disappointed. He knows what the story actually says.

""My trusty vehicle is broken at the moment. It is at Lazlo's place. Not that it would win any races, except in that tortoise way. Well, normally trusty."" He adds with some resentment, its unusual hand-crafted nature making it hard to fix.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Oh, the bike broke down?""</strong> Tor says, disappointed. He knows what the story actually says.</p><p><strong>""My trusty vehicle is broken at the moment. It is at Lazlo's place. Not that it would win any races, except in that <em>tortoise</em> way. Well, normally trusty.""</strong> He adds with some resentment, its unusual hand-crafted nature making it hard to fix.</p>

Sisqo snorts as he laughs. He most certainly doesn’t know the story, only the one his mom told him. “No the bike didn’t break down!” He gains his composure. “You see, driving isn’t just about speed. It’s about technique” he says. “In the story, the turtle takes the time to observe every corner, every crack and bump in the road. He makes the right decision every time - takes corners tight. The rabbit, well he’s just an asshole. At least that’s what mama always said.” He pauses for a moment then quickly finishes “There’s that and the fact that he doesn’t know how to shift the damn gears. The bike was fast, sure, but with another driver it could have been a hell of a lot faster.”

“No it was a fair race, and although it was his turf, it was not my first race there. Not by a long shot.”

“What do you drive?” Sisqo finishes, almost on his tip toes. A glint in his eye. He is excited to talk shop.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo snorts as he laughs. Not by a long shot.”</p><p>“What do you drive?” Sisqo finishes, almost on his tip toes. A glint in his eye. He is excited to talk shop. </p>

""Oh, yeah. I suppose that is like the story. Drive clever. Still,"" he says with a gesture of appreciation, ""beating someone faster that you takes some skill.""

Tor does not seem overly interested in discussing his vehicle. ""Mine? It is nothing special... except, apparently, the fuel system is something special, so something broke and it has proved hard to get working properly. It just limps along,and only when the sun is bright."" He shrugs. ""We can go look at it after this, if you want. I need to talk to Lazlo about it anyway.""

Sisqo says to Tor “if we get the chance I would love to see it!” Thinking about what the vehicle could be - the possibilities are endless!

Sisqo kind of bobs up and down, rocking on his heels with his hands in his pockets. He sees Gritch and remembers what he said about his vision. He takes out an oily rag and nervously rubs it on his hands, not even realizing he is doing it. He recently had a vision as well, perhaps Gritch can provide some insight. “Does he have visions often?” Sisqo asks, nodding to Gritch.

He sees <strong>Gritch</strong> and remembers what he said about his vision. He takes out an oily rag and nervously rubs it on his hands, not even realizing he is doing it. He recently had a vision as well, perhaps Gritch can provide some insight. “<strong>Does he have visions often?</strong>” <strong>Sisqo</strong> asks, nodding to <strong>Gritch</strong>. </p>
""All the time, from what I have seen."" Tor says, ""But then I just met him.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""All the time, from what I have seen.""</strong> Tor says, <strong>""But then I just met him.""</strong></p>

Gritch puts his pink umbrella down and wanders over to the exterior door's frame. He opens up his medical bag, finds a small object (size of a key fob) and presses it against the frame up at about 7' height where it sticks.

""I don't think this is the place,"" he comments quietly.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Gritch puts his pink umbrella down and wanders over to the exterior door's frame. He opens up his medical bag, finds a small object (size of a key fob) and presses it against the frame up at about 7' height where it sticks.</p><p><strong>""I don't think this is the place,""</strong> he comments quietly.</p>

""Thanks guys, DK likes to keep it tidy. 'Don't care if it's the 'Pocolypse, always keep your space clean,'"" October quotes with an offhand casualness, other concerns clearly on her mind. When there's no answer, no muffled shout from the armory or tell tale flush of the working commode, that sinking feeling she had been denying slowly bubbles its way up...

""Where the fuck are they..."" October asks, going from room to room, opening every closet, not bothering to close the doors behind her as her search becomes more and more frantic.

By the time she comes back to the rest of the group, she's in a proper state again. ""They're not here..."" she says, worry now clear in her voice. But strangely, Dana's calm demeanor is infectious, and, drawn to the corner where they had set up a small play area.

""Jeffers had most of these. Stokes, Gemma and Dylan took an overnight job to Pike Pine to pay for them; I was on stage at the Red Salmon till midnight and asked Proper if it was okay to bring her. He put her to work; had her pouring tea at the bar, straight from the kettle...."" she explains, smiling at the memory. ""She had a blast. Almost made more in tips than I did. Lyssa called it a 'tea party,' whatever that is...""

Shifting her attention to Tor, her voice loses the softness of memory, but not that of care. ""DK keeps all the ammo and working guns in the armory; only brings out parts to work with, nothing that can go off. He's careful. We're careful...""

He's careful. We're careful...""</span></strong></p>

""I see that."" Tor says, agreeing with October.

""We did not expect them to be here."" He reminds her, trying to reduce her panic. ""So, don't start worrying. 'K?

""Is there anywhere else, anyone who would know anything? Otherwise I suggest talking to the sheriff, see if he can explain were Dylan went."" Tor says, willing to take control, but also to follow October's lead, she is the one who would best know where to start.

'K?</strong></p><p><strong>""Is there anywhere else, anyone who would know anything? Otherwise I suggest talking to the sheriff, see if he can explain were Dylan went.""</strong> Tor says, willing to take control, but also to follow <strong>October's</strong> lead, she is the one who would best know where to start.</p>
Sisqo nods at Tor after his explanation of Gritch. He turns and walks towards the armory to look around, keeping his eye out for traps along the way.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo nods at Tor after his explanation of Gritch. He turns and walks towards the armory to look around, keeping his eye out for traps along the way. </p>

Scarlet looks around the loft admiringly. It's huge, to a girl who spent most if her life living on boats. She feels a little choke in her throat at the sight of the toys, and she turns away, in time to overhear Tor and Sisqo's conversation. 

""Well,"" she says, looking at October. ""It looks like you took good care of her. Did Dylan have a room of his own, or is it the armory?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Scarlet looks around the loft admiringly. It's huge, to a girl who spent most if her life living on boats. She feels a little choke in her throat at the sight of the toys, and she turns away, in time to overhear Tor and Sisqo's conversation. </p><p>""Well,"" she says, looking at October. ""It looks like you took good care of her. Did Dylan have a room of his own, or is it the armory?""</p>

The armory door, normally secured by a rotten door reinforced with the tailgate of a very large truck (and a pair of tripwire booby traps recently disabled because of Hope's presence), is unsecured after October poked her head inside to call for her friends.

It occurs to October that she did not have to unlock the door to the armory as the lock was already undone.  Had it been locked, there would have been no call to yell out inside for Dylan or for Stokes as they could not have been inside with the lock secure from the outside.

As yet, no one has entered the dark room.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The armory door, normally secured by a rotten door reinforced with the tailgate of a very large truck (and a pair of tripwire booby traps recently disabled because of Hope's presence), is unsecured after <strong>October </strong>poked her head inside to call for her friends.</p><p>It occurs to October that she did not have to unlock the door to the armory as the lock was already undone.  Had it been locked, there would have been no call to yell out inside for Dylan or for Stokes as they could not have been inside with the lock secure from the outside.</p><p>As yet, no one has entered the dark room.</p>

Sisqo, noticing the disarmed trip wire, looks into the dark room. He reaches his hand around either side of the door frame just inside the room, looking for a light switch. He intends to investigate the room.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo, noticing the disarmed trip wire, looks into the dark room. He reaches his hand around either side of the door frame just inside the room, looking for a light switch. He intends to investigate the room. </p>

""DK prefers to sleep on the couch out front, actually. Always keeps his....wait a minute...""

In her haste to search the loft, October rushed past a small detail that she only now really noticed. Making her way back to the armory, she pokes at the lock, only now realizing that she didn't have to unlock it.

""That's odd...DK never leaves this unlocked...""

Noticing Sisqo's movement, it takes October a second before she realizes what he's doing and why. ""There's no power in the building. Use this,"" she says, picking up a large flashlight with the directional lens missing and tossing it to him.
