Making her way back to the armory, she pokes at the lock, only now realizing that she didn't have to unlock it.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""That's odd...DK never leaves this unlocked...""</span></strong></p><p>Noticing Sisqo's movement, it takes October a second before she realizes what he's doing and why. <strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""There's no power in the building. Use this,""</span></strong> she says, picking up a large flashlight with the directional lens missing and tossing it to him.</p>

Sisqo hears October and at the last second turns around to catch the flashlight. As any time that Sisqo tries to catch something, it’s awkward. He fumbles with the flashlight but gets ends up grasping it. He clicks it on, light pouring from the end. 

He nods at October, then looks at the others. “Here we go”. He turns the light towards the dark room.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo hears October and at the last second turns around to catch the flashlight. As any time that Sisqo tries to catch something, it’s awkward. He fumbles with the flashlight but gets ends up grasping it. He clicks it on, light pouring from the end. </p><p>He nods at October, then looks at the others. “Here we go”. He turns the light towards the dark room. </p>

From his vantage in the doorway, Sisqo can see a work table to the right, 3 levels of handcrafted shelves at the back of the room, and a makeshift gun rack to the left.

The table has scattered parts and pieces of metal - could be parts of assorted firearms and tools, dirty cloths, cable and string, some haphazardly discarded metal bottles with narrow points and plastic tips, and a half dozen loosely scattered rounds of differing calibers.

The shelves have folded cloths, small cans and bottles of oils, some metal trays with small tools, and a couple of metal boxes that may well contain additional tools.

The gun rack is empty.  A pair of cables and a small chain sit discarded at the base of the rack, the combination locks unlatched and left in their open state.  It's hard to say how many weapons the wooden rack once held, but, it has a place for six longarms.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>From his vantage in the doorway, <strong>Sisqo</strong> can see a work table to the right, 3 levels of handcrafted shelves at the back of the room, and a makeshift gun rack to the left.</p><p>The table has scattered parts and pieces of metal - could be parts of assorted firearms and tools, dirty cloths, cable and string, some haphazardly discarded metal bottles with narrow points and plastic tips, and a half dozen loosely scattered rounds of differing calibers.</p><p>The shelves have folded cloths, small cans and bottles of oils, some metal trays with small tools, and a couple of metal boxes that may well contain additional tools.</p><p>The gun rack is empty.  A pair of cables and a small chain sit discarded at the base of the rack, the combination locks unlatched and left in their open state.  It's hard to say how many weapons the wooden rack once held, but, it has a place for six longarms.</p>

Scarlet looks past Sisqo into the armory and clicks her tongue.

""Not how it's usually stocked, I take it?"" she says to October. ""Who else was Blake tight with? If this was full, it looks like a heavy load for one man with a child to hump on his own.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Scarlet looks past Sisqo into the armory and clicks her tongue.</p><p><strong>""Not how it's usually stocked, I take it?""</strong> she says to October.<strong> ""Who else was Blake tight with? If this was full, it looks like a heavy load for one man with a child to hump on his own.""</strong></p>

Sisqo hands the flash light to October and walks over to Gritch. 

“Hey there. I’m Sisqo, we haven’t t met yet.” He says. 

“I’m wondering - you had a vision about a girl in a place... pretty vague. I recently had a similar vision, something that has never happened to me before. But it sounds a lot like what you experienced...” he pauses, then continues hesitantly. “How does this happen? I’m wondering if you could show me and maybe I” he pauses again “or YOU could try to get a vision about this Dylan character?” He seems hesitant to do it himself, but he is very curious about the process and up for the challenge. But he is oblivious as to what to do.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>Sisqo</strong> hands the flash light to <strong>October</strong> and walks over to <strong>Gritch</strong>. </p><p>“<strong>Hey there. I’m wondering if you could show me and maybe I” he pauses again “or YOU could try to get a vision about this Dylan character?</strong>” He seems hesitant to do it himself, but he is very curious about the process and up for the challenge. But he is oblivious as to what to do. </p>

Tor glanced into the armory showing no real interest in the weapons (or parts thereof) or the tools, but appreciating the organisational setup.

His ears perk up when Scarlet asks about the emptiness. That is a good point. He thinks. No wonder she is the lawgiver.

But then he is distracted by Sisqo's question to Gritch. He. too. is interested in how this 'vision' business works, it sounds a lot like 'magic'... and that is exiting.

He. too. is interested in how this 'vision' business works, it sounds a lot like 'magic'... and that is exiting.</p>

column2: Gritch stares hard at Sisqo, obviously a little confused. He asks, "" 'We haven't met yet?' When will we meet? I like to be ready for things.""

Gritch pokes Sisqo to make sure he's real and not a hallucination like the rusted and torn underwater diver suit floating through the room. The disturbing part was the bright, yellow crabs inside the suit.

column3:
"" 'How does this happen?' Well... you can access it using several different means: physical exhaustion, illness, drugs that stimulate your prefrontal cortex, dreaming, sensory deprivation, accessing inner creative structures like October does, be born differently, or be changed...

""But you want to just snap your fingers and BANG! be there...? I suggest drugs. I have some. I may also be able to guide you. But... it's no joke, no simple thing. There are risks. There are dangers there.""

column1:
""No, not normally..."" October answers, picking up and examining the lock as if it had sprung open on its own. ""I-I'm not really sure, I don't have much of a reason to come in here usually.""

Looking up, October's brow furrows as she looks back to the lawgiver in the doorway. ""It's usually pretty full; DK's got a big full auto type, like the ones you'd see mounted on a war rig. A-and a hunter's rifle. Stokes' gun is missing too..."" 

October peers down at the lock in her hand, a fingernail tapping a familiar beat onto the metal as she thinks. ""Only one who could get through this lock without breaking it is Dylan and Stokes, I don't even know the combo. And Lazlo I guess, he was the one DK got it from...""

Although October isn't paying super close attention to the boys' conversation outside, she catches enough of it for an idea to form. ""Maybe Lazlo could help? He's...touched, like Gritch and Hey. He might be able to tell us more about this.""

He's...touched, like Gritch and Hey. He might be able to tell us more about this.""</span></strong></p>

""That sounds like an awful lot of weight there."" Tor observes in response to October's list. ""Does Dylan normally take everything with him on jobs?"" Tor knows a bit about this, as now he tends to leave most of his armor (and mask) in the car unless he thinks he will need it, wearing all that all the time is exhausting.

Tor now look a bit more closely at the racks. ""Has he been 'cleaned out'?"" He asks. ""Could someone even force him to open the door for them?"" From how he was described, Tor would be surprised, he does not sound like a pushover... though, if they threatened someone he cared about...? Tor thinks that might fit what he has heard so far.

Sisqo looks Gritch hard in the eyes. “Dangers like what? Getting lost? Injured?” He gulps. “Worse?”
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Sisqo looks Gritch hard in the eyes. “Dangers like what? Getting lost? Injured?” He gulps. “Worse?”</p>

""Yes... lost, injuries, worse... to look upon yourself and not recognize who you have become... to see your inner fears and lusts laid bare... to taste your own betrayal, your own weakness... there's no armor, no weapons there..."" Gritch starts to shake and sits down on the floor to steady himself.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Yes... lost, injuries, worse... to look upon yourself and not recognize who you have become... to see your inner fears and lusts laid bare... to taste your own betrayal, your own weakness... there's no armor, no weapons there...""</strong> Gritch starts to shake and sits down on the floor to steady himself.</p>

Mother of God, Sisqo thinks as he stares at Gritch.  Sisqo has experienced these visions before, but nothing like what Gritch is describing.  The old man has gone too far, he thinks.  Surely, one with a more sound mind, a younger more alert mind, one that can keep one eye on the road and another on the map, would be able to cope... he reassures himself.  Right?

Sisqo sits next to Gritch and offers to put his arm around him, if he would take it, to try to provide some comfort. He lets a moment pass.  ""The first time, I remember being in one place, then instantaneously in another.  A little child was there - they did it to me.  I don't know how... But there was the sound of a chainsaw, ripping the air, tearing my ear drums... and then it... slowed.  It changed.  The ripping became a rhythmic drum - muffled.  I saw the cold metal of the chainsaw grinding towards me, then blackness as my eyes clinched shut, then when the sound changed I opened them to a faint pink/red glow... it was nice.  I don't know how long it stayed like that... a minute?  An hour?  Hell a day... I have no clue.  But when I left, I dug my fingers into everything I could feel.  I didn't want to leave.  Where was I going?  Back to the chainsaw?  Fuck that... No I fought... and I was ripped away.  I didn't have a vision that time... I had an experience.  And it was good.  The vision was kind of the same... but different."" He pauses.  ""You mention getting there with physical exhaustion, illness, dreaming... I think I got my vision with some form of hypnosis... like when you drive for a long time and end up where you need to be but it feels like you just left... You offer to guide me.  Fuuuuuuck."" He pauses while he thinks.  ""I'm in.""

Gritch shuffles away so that Sisqo can't put an arm around him.

Gritch's face contorts and it seems like something else wears his face suddenly. He is hard with cold, dead eyes. ""Guide you? Of course. But we need privacy for that. I can see you're searching for something. You can't have someone watching us though... they'll get in the way... save you from your truth. We can't have that.

""Truth hurts... like a saw, yes.""

Gritch changes again, his expression softening. ""Why? Why would you want to go there?"" he asks softly. It's almost like he cares. ""It can't be worth it. What did you lose, Sisqo?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Gritch shuffles away so that Sisqo can't put an arm around him.</p><p>Gritch's face contorts and it seems like something else wears his face suddenly. He is hard with cold, dead eyes. <strong>""Guide you? Of course. But we need privacy for that. I can see you're searching for something. You can't have someone watching us though... they'll get in the way... save you from your truth. We can't have that.</strong></p><p><strong>""Truth hurts... like a saw, yes.""</strong></p><p>Gritch changes again, his expression softening. <strong>""Why? Why would you want to go there?""</strong> he asks softly. It's almost like he cares.<strong> ""It can't be worth it. What did you lose, Sisqo?""</strong></p>

Sisqo is put off by Gritch's change in demeanor.  He looks down as he thinks for a moment. Then he looks back up at Gritch.

""I navigate, Gritch.  I get people where they need to go, where they need to be.  If I now have the ability to use a second map, you bet your ass I'm going to use it with your help or not. What use is a truck without a key?  It's shit is what it is - this whole time, my whole life I could have been just that - shit.  But now... now I could be better - more useful.  I don't know what this is... but if anyone can get a grasp on it, it's old Sisqo here."" he says confidently, with a smirk on his face.

""I'm not looking for anything big, Gritch - nothing I have lost in life.  Right now, I want to be able to help October, and if this is a skill I now all of a sudden have I want to understand and use it.  Look around Gritch..."" He gestures to October - fresh off a roller coaster of doubt, guilt, and emotion.  Then to Scarlet, still riding desperation on her path to Rain. ""You have a piece to this puzzle - a little girl, cold, alone, somewhere, water...  Who is it?  Is it Rain, or Hope?  Neither?  Maybe I have the other piece of the puzzle, but I need to find it.  Maybe that piece is more information about the girl, maybe its this Dylan fella.  I don't know.  I cannot drive them to a place that isn't on a map yet, but maybe I can still help them navigate.""  He looks back at Gritch. ""If you need to go somewhere else to show me this, I would follow you, but I need to be up front - I don't do drugs, not if I need to drive.""

Dana unobtrusively enters the armory as the others are engaged in conversation and introspection.

She bends down and reaches behind a table and picks up a wadded piece of paper and unfolds it.  Dana frowns, and her jaw tightens as she reads or sees what is on it.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dana unobtrusively enters the armory as the others are engaged in conversation and introspection.</p><p>She bends down and reaches behind a table and picks up a wadded piece of paper and unfolds it.  Dana frowns, and her jaw tightens as she reads or sees what is on it.</p>

""Normally, yeah. But today I he just took the rifle. I asked him to leave the big gun here, I felt it was overkill..."" she remembers aloud, not quite sure if she should be feeling regret or not.

Opening one of the containers closest to the gun rack, October puts her hand in and feels around, letting out a disappointed tsk upon finding it empty. No grenades...but he might've taken them with him.

The corner of her mouth pulls to the side at Tor's suggestion. ""I don't really see it. Even if they -whoever they are or if they exist - managed to get him down and to the door, the booby trap was still armed, he'd have used that at least to try to turn the tables a bit. Only way I can see would be if they had Hope-""

Cutting herself off with a gasp, her hands fly to her mouth as the weight of the words she said and thought struck her. ""You don't think that..."" she whispers, scared to even say it aloud.

It's only now that October notices Dana enter. Only now that she sees the paper on the floor that they'd all missed, sees the hunter's jaw tighten.

""...what's it say?"" she asks through her own fingers.

""Is there anyone he would confide in? Go to for supplies or information, take with him? This Stokes fellow, maybe?"" He asks. ""Anyone who would know where he went?""

The letter is written on yellowing paper with handwritten blue-black ink in a haphazard hand:

Barkers got me serounded.  Past this to are frend for help. Took sum out.  Be holed up near PX-1 in Cal Park.  Need help now.

Gemma

Tor glances at the note. ""Looks like it. What are 'barkers'? Dogs?"" He asks the room in general?

Then, turning to October, he asks: ""Does this look like Gemma's handwriting?"" He thinks for a moment. ""If she was in trouble... hang on though, how would she get written a note here in time...?"" He shakes his head, choosing to ignore that problem and continues. ""... I assume Dylan would go to help? As any good man would. But would he take Hope? Surely not! Where would he leave her?"" He asks again, that being a safe question.

Somehow knowing where Dylan was and why was both reassuring and cause for a new, different kind of worry. As if knowing that he was not being held hostage and was in an equally dangerous gunfight trying to help a friend was a good thing. Prolly cause I know that at least he can shoot back...

""Eye dee kay, I've never seen Gemma actually write,"" October answers, still confident that the message was genuine. ""Oh yeah, I'll bet everything I own that's where DK was headed. Stokes too I guess. Maybe there was a runner, or Gemma was with someone? Scar, did anyone come meet Dylan when you were with him, do you remember?""

Turning back to Tor, her arms fold in front of her, the corner of her mouth pulled to one side in thought. Waving away Tor's concern about blaming herself, October studies the floor in front of her. ""Well, it'd be with someone he trusted. Proper takes good care of us, but both he and his head waitress are at the festival. Maybe he dropped her off at the restaurant? O-or maybe he left her with Sheriff Willow if he went and told her what's up? And, I don't think he'd take her with him, but he might've if he thought he had no choice...Not gonna lie, I really really wanna go help my friends...fuck...""

You..."" Gritch grins, starting to laugh, then cough. He spits up some goo on the floor.

Doctor Sustice, leave him be. He doesn't know. Walk away. Say no. Please.

You helped me.

Sisqo looks at Gritch and the glove he just pulled out ""What the fuck is that?"" he says rhetorically. ""you know what Gritch, or Marsh, or whoever you are, this isn't quite what I was expecting but if it will help me learn about this other place..."" he hesitates for a moment, then looks at Gritch ""I'm still in.  Why don't we head to my truck while the others chat with the sheriff and you can teach me about this other place... although if you try any funny business, well..."" Sisqo puts his palm on the handle of the Machette (not grabbing it, just making it known he is wearing the over-sized blade).  The threat might be lost coming from Sisqo.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>Sisqo</strong> replies to <strong>Tor</strong> ""<strong>Gotcha, sounds like a place we need to visit.""</strong></p><p><strong>Sisqo </strong>looks at <strong>Gritch </strong>and the glove he just pulled out<strong> ""What the fuck is that?</strong>"" he says rhetorically<strong>. </strong>""<strong>you know what Gritch, or Marsh, or whoever you are, this isn't quite what I was expecting but if it will help me learn about this other place...""</strong> he hesitates for a moment, then looks at <strong>Gritch</strong> ""<strong>I'm still in.  Why don't we head to my truck while the others chat with the sheriff and you can teach me about this other place... although if you try any funny business, well..."" </strong>Sisqo puts his palm on the handle of the Machette (not grabbing it, just making it known he is wearing the over-sized blade).  The threat might be lost coming from Sisqo.</p>

Gritch looks at the machete and nods knowingly. He puts away the glove. ""There it is. Well... this whole business with Dylan and a truck and a park... that sounds far more important. Another time perhaps.""

He wanders over to Tor, hoping for protection. ""He's not ready,"" Gritch whispers to Tor, referring to Sisqo.

""Um? OK?"" Tor says, not understanding at all. ""But we need to go now.""

woooooow Sisqo thinks. What is up with this guy? How many people does it take to ask a sheriff a question? Wouldn’t we have time to do try this out or what? Like how hard can it be? I mean I did it hours ago without even trying!

His senses all spring back to him at once, and he feels his palm on the machete. Oooooh! Sisqo you old dog! Step down bud. This old man is afraid of you now, look what you’ve done. You are so intimidating! He thinks to himself. His lips curl down and his head nods understandingly, whether Gritch is actually afraid of Sisqo or offended or something else, Sisqo feels like a big man right now. 

“Ya for sure” he says as gentle as he can to Gritch. “Maybe later.”

He looks to Tor. “Let’s roll!” An excited flint in his eye at the potential to be behind the wheel.

""He was alone when I saw him,"" Scarlet says, shaking her head. She frowns, trying to remember her brief interaction with Dylan that morning. She gives a little laugh when it hits her, and then quickly stifles it. The last thing anyone should be doing is laughing at this situation, especially her, but....

""The reason I didn't think much about him taking off was, I thought he had to pee. You know?"" She hops from one foot to the other, like someone close to losing a battle with their bladder. Or someone with very pressing business.

column3: Kord Building Meet-Up (C 1.11, D 1.9, F 1.12, M 1.12, T 1.12)

column4:
Late night - Kord Building, Fawcet College campus

All,

Dropping everything for ""the call"" (or the text, what have you), you all hustle your way to meet up at Kord Building. There are lights on the sign of the building and by the sidewalks, but it's otherwise quiet, and dead.

Mackenzie, 

You didn't expect anyone else to show besides Mary Marvel, who hasn't shown up yet. But the rest of your team is on their way, it seems.

Oliver,

Did you run back or get a cab or what? It seems like you're the farthest away.

Kate,

Did you... suit up? Or just run over here?

Trace,

You're here pretty quickly, how do you arrive?

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282108""><div class=""row"">

The temptation to take Liberty to a dark alley and, when no one is watching, teleport us to my dorm room is incredible. I'd love to show off, and it would be so much easier ... honestly, the temptation is too much. Liberty looks downtrodden that she can't be involved and just this once I'll use my powers to impress somebody.

As we exit the club, I ask Liberty, ""Would you like to see something spectacular?"" Her head nods, and I smile a great broad smile.

Soon, we're in the alley and I say, ""Stand still and hold my hands, okay?"" The hoop of light rises around us. We should be instantly teleported to my dorm room. What could go wrong?
dice roll

Welll, how could I resist the chance to get an escort in Alex's muscle car, red light flashing and all of that extra cop driving skill on display? I'm weak, I couldn't.

I asked Alex not to follow since 'something's up with Kendra' could mean anything from 'she wants to show off a new Marvel thing' to 'it's super brawl time.'

I'm going to loop around from the back of the building to the front, just to get a feel for the surroundings. In case 'something's up.'

In case 'something's up.'</p>

I'm waiting near the front entrance of the Kord Building, leaning against the cool brick, head back, eyes closed. I probably should be up and attentive right now, but I'm taking every second I can to just be still and try to let my stomach and head settle before I'm out there throwing things and dodging punches.

I'm listening, though, for footsteps or the whoosh of Mary's cape when she lands, anything really, then I'll open my eyes and be a good hero, like I'm supposed to. I mean, like I am.

I mean, like I <em>am</em>.</p>

My suit can collapse into a small enough package to fit into a good-sized backpack, but it's heavy, and I don't always carry it with me. Once I get a working motorcycle again, I'll keep it in a (seriously tamper-proof) cargo sidecar, but tonight I'm a flightless Firefly. That doesn't mean I have no tricks up my sleeve, though. I have a full range of gadgets, gizmos, and gimcrackery in various pockets and in the messenger bag I have slung cross-shoulder. And since I've pretty much decided that ""sekrit identities"" are not going to work out for me, I don't much care about using them in the open.

I urge Kiki to put on some speed, if she can, and head toward the Kord building.

Oliver,

Liberty lets out a whoop in the half second before you jump that ends when you appear in your dorm room. Lucky for you, nobody is in here. She looks around with wide eyes, her body shaking from the experience, uttering a simple, ""Wow."" You're able to extricate yourself from your room, hearing her assure you she'll find her way back to her room as you jog down the hall.

You're able to catch up with Kate and Dawn as they jog across campus, your dorm is much closer to the Kord Building. Kate isn't suited up, and well, Kikiri doesn't have a suit (yet).

Kate and Kikiri,

You see Oliver running out of his dorm to catch up with you.

Trace,

As Alex drops you off, you start to jump out of the car, but she grabs your hand. She tugs you back inside for a quick kiss, apologizing for such a brief goodbye, then she watches you dash off. You swing around towards the front of the building and spot Mackenzie. Mac is leaning against the building, her eyes closed, she looks like maybe she's sleeping?

What do you do?

Naturally, after that brief (but excellent) goodbye, I've got to show off. I hustle and cut across some levels and low-standing cement 'fences' meant to divide the space and protect some bushes, performing a really unnecessary (but fun and tight) forward flip at about where Alex's line of sight would cut.

On a scale from 1 to 10, I'm feeling pretty cocky right now.

While I slow down to a respectable saunter, I catch sight of Mac. ""Hey Mackenzie, what's the news?"" My tone and step are both light, but this scene feels a little odd. It puts me on alert.

I lift my head from the building at the voice, not the voice I was expecting to hear. The sudden movement doesn't feel great and my stomach lurches a little. I grimace a bit, but the the feeling settles. Okay, Marvel power, keep on burning through that sake. Let's get done with this.

""Trace?"" I say, picking out her slight frame and practiced movement in the semi-darkness. ""What are you doing here?""

""What kind of trouble are we expecting here?"" I urgently ask Kate. She looks worried, ""cause I can put on some speed...""

I can accelerate myself, the same way I broke my fall in class I can accelerate myself with more or less concussive force. It's loud and, well... sometimes it can leave a mark.

Mackenzie looks sluggish and uncomfortable. ""Kate let me know that you might be in some sort of trouble here at the Kord building. Are you ok?"" I finish my approach and place a hand on her arm.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mackenzie looks sluggish and uncomfortable. ""<strong>Kate let me know that you might be in some sort of trouble here at the Kord building. Are you ok?</strong>"" I finish my approach and place a hand on her arm.</p>

I just jog forward. Since Oliver's with us, we might as well arrive together. ""No need to put on the whammy, Dawn, we're almost there."" When we come around the corner and catch sight of Trace and Mac, I almost do that cartoon ""skid to a stop"" thing, but manage to just slow myself to a quick walk and move toward them.

""Mackenzie! Is everything okay? I... wasn't your text some kind of message you were in trouble? It was so unlike you, I just assumed...""

column2: A lightning bolt streaks down from the sky, striking the sidewalk in front of the Kord Building. When the light flash has ended, there stands Mary Marvel.

Electricity arcs around her in small flashes until it dissipates. She looks around, spotting you, Calaca, Firefly, and Kikiri Dawn. She looks right at you, Firefly, ""Hello? Did Mackenzie call you or... something? Where's Mackenzie?""

What do you do?
A lightning bolt streaks down from the sky, striking the sidewalk in front of the Kord Building. When the light flash has ended, there stands Mary Marvel.</p><p>

<img src=""https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/scale_medium/6/66303/3134848-mary.jpg"" style=""width: 300px;""></p><p>Electricity arcs around her in small flashes until it dissipates. She looks around, spotting you, Calaca, Firefly, and Kikiri Dawn. She looks right at you, Firefly, <strong>""Hello? Did Mackenzie call you or... <em>something</em>? Where's Mackenzie?""</strong></p><p>What do you do?</p>

column1: I point behind her, to where Trace and Mackenzie are. ""They're over there, Mary. I think... there might have been a misunderstanding."" Embarrassment will come later if that's the case. I pull out my phone and show her the text. ""This didn't sound right, and it doesn't read like Mackenzie. I thought it was some sort of message that you guys were in trouble."" Of course, I didn't really think this through. If Mackenzie and Mary Marvel were in trouble, what the heck could our plucky band of misfits do about it?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I point behind her, to where Trace and Mackenzie are. <strong>""They're over there, Mary. I think... there might have been a misunderstanding."" </strong>Embarrassment will come later if that's the case.<strong> </strong>I pull out my phone and show her the text. <strong>""This didn't sound right, and it doesn't read like Mackenzie. I thought it was some sort of message that you guys were in trouble."" </strong>Of course, I didn't really think this through. If Mackenzie and Mary <em>Marvel</em> were in trouble, what the heck could our plucky band of misfits do about it?</p>

Mary moves quickly to look over at the text. She reads it quietly, her mouth turning into a slightly confused frown for a moment. She takes the phone from you, Kate, ""I need this for a moment, okay?"" She floats up into the air and flies over to you, Mackenzie, ""Mackenzie, did you need your team for-for something?"" She shows you the text message, eyes concerned. Trace, you see her eyes widen as if she's struck by a realization about Mackenzie's expression or posture.

She takes the phone from you, Kate, <strong>""I need this for a moment, okay?"" </strong>She floats up into the air and flies over to you, Mackenzie, <strong>""Mackenzie, did you need your team for-for something?""</strong> She shows you the text message, eyes concerned. Trace, you see her eyes widen as if she's struck by a realization about Mackenzie's expression or posture.</p>

""Kate did?"" I say when Sylvia tells me why she's here. I don't pull away from her hand on my arm. It's kind of comforting. Like she'd catch me if I fell over, which I'm not going to do, but still.

Thinking of Kate rings some sort of bell in my mind. A sort of sour note. It's not how I normally feel when I think about Kate, but I can't quite place what it is this time that's different. ""No, I'm fine. I was just waiting for Mary. We're just heading out to...""

I hear Kate, jogging toward us with the others, saying something about a message?

And bam, just like that - there's Mary. Lightning and everything. She talks to Kate first. Because of course she talks to Kate first. Why wouldn't she talk to Kate first? Mary flies over, just to prove she can I think, and I straighten up a bit, trying to be normal. Be normal. Be normal.

But she shows me the phone and...my stomach does a complete Trace-like somersault inside of my body. Oh no. Oh no. Oh no. ""Um...I..."" My eyes skip over the message again. ""Yyyes,"" I say, trying to put a plan together on the fly. Maybe work in a part of the Manifesto. My head hurts. ""I...thought we might need support. For tonight.""

I look up at her, hoping the lie sticks. Hoping I sent that text to Kate after Mary told me about Mister Atom. I did...right?
dice roll

I keep my hand on Mackenzie's arm and look up meet to Mary Marvel's eyes. ""I'm not clear on all the details yet, but I think this is a great opportunity for our team to get more experience working together. And we came together very fast - good stuff, Deltas!"" I flash a little peace sign and grin to the other clump of teammates.

Yeah there's something going on and I'm muddying the waters, but this is an opportunity and maybe we can help.

That junk Steffi was saying about Metas not being able to pledge still nags at the back of my mind. It's probably a good thing Kate and I got dragged out of there.... but I don't want to leave it at that. I'm no crusader for Meta rights or anything... but I hate to be treated less than human.  I wouldn't ever want to pledge... unless they tell me I can't.

But now is now. The lightning bolt of a Marvel appearing is pretty stunning and beautiful, really... and as much as I admire them, I'm paying attention. I need to learn to do as well, or better.... some day.

""We're here when you need us,"" I answer to Sylvia, not to Kendra.

Mary Marvel gently takes the phone from you, Mackenzie, flies over to hand it back, Kate. She turns to look at all of you, her cape fluttering with the turn. She puts her hands on her hips, standing arms akimbo, and says, ""Alright, team, Mister Atom is south of Fawcett City. He's super strong and durable, and his motives have always been sketchy. Lucky for us, he's never been subtle, so we should be able to find him by the wake of destruction he leaves. Do any of you fly or have transportation of some kind?""

I can't believe we're talking to and about to team up with Mary Marvel! This is incredible, and I'm unbelievably nervous. I raise my hand and say, ""I-I can teleport, ma'am ... but I've never tried to teleport a big group ... or teleport to some place I've never seen before.""

Am I good enough to be on a team with Mackenzie and Mary Marvel? Or will I just get in the way?

""Alright then. Let's go!"" Mary looks at you, Mackenzie, ""Stay with them, head to the Water Tower on southside, you can see most of the suburbs south of the river there. I'll fly. If I see anything, I'll use your frequency, Firefly. Stick with Mackenzie everyone."" She bends down for a moment, then springs up into the air like a bullet into the night sky, and then she's gone.

What do you do?

Let's go!""</strong> Mary looks at you, Mackenzie, <strong>""Stay with them, head to the Water Tower on southside, you can see most of the suburbs south of the river there. I'll fly. If I see anything, I'll use your frequency, Firefly. Stick with Mackenzie everyone.""</strong> She bends down for a moment, then springs up into the air like a bullet into the night sky, and then she's gone.</p><p>What do you do?</p>

I'm so grateful when Trace jumps in and shifts the focus of things from me to the team. Is Kate just playing along too, or does she actually think that whole text was just some secret message?

I'm not going to correct her. Not right now anyway. But...I probably should eventually. That's for another time though.

After Mary's left, I look at Oliver and put on my best chipper, go-get-'em voice. ""Ready to see if we can beat Mary to that water tower, Calaca?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I'm so grateful when Trace jumps in and shifts the focus of things from me to the team. Is Kate just playing along too, or does she actually think that whole text was just some secret message?</p><p>I'm not going to correct her. Not right now anyway. But...I probably should eventually. That's for another time though.</p><p>After Mary's left, I look at Oliver and put on my best chipper, go-get-'em voice. <strong>""Ready to see if we can beat Mary to that water tower, Calaca?""</strong></p>

Mackenzie turns to me and her words and attitude pep me up. There's no doubt now ... I'm working with the Marvels. I can do this!

""Yes ma' ... Mackenzie! Everyone, circle up around me, let's form a cross.""

Does everyone trust me enough to join me?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mackenzie turns to me and her words and attitude pep me up. There's no doubt now ... I'm working with the Marvels. I can do this!</p><p><strong>""Yes ma' ... Mackenzie! Everyone, circle up around me, let's form a cross.""</strong></p><p>Does everyone trust me enough to join me?</p>

I form up and put a hand on Oliver's shoulder. ""Like this?"" 

I have never been teleported before. But it happens all the time, right? Natural as lightning.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I form up and put a hand on Oliver's shoulder. ""<strong>Like this?</strong>"" </p><p>I have never been teleported before. But it happens all the time, right? Natural as lightning.</p>

Teleport?

Yeah that makes me nervous... as much as my own powers have gotten away from me sometimes, it can be hard to trust someone else's. 

But I'm not about to look afraid in front of everyone. I swallow, hard and hurry to join up with Sylvia and Oliver.

""Yeah, let's do this, C!"" I mirror Sylvia, and almost put my hand on Oliver's shoulder... but catch myself... ""uh... maybe I should find my own way over...""

I withdraw my hand... yeah. That's why... that's why.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Teleport?</p><p>Yeah that makes me nervous... as much as my own powers have gotten away from me sometimes, it can be hard to trust someone else's. </p><p>But I'm not about to look afraid in front of everyone. I swallow, hard and hurry to join up with Sylvia and Oliver.</p><p>""<strong>Yeah, let's do this, C!</strong>"" I mirror Sylvia, and almost put my hand on Oliver's shoulder... but catch myself... ""<strong>uh... maybe I should find my own way over...</strong>""</p><p>I withdraw my hand... yeah. That's why... that's why. </p>

I see Kikiri pull away, and I can't mess up any more tonight than I already have. I need to keep my team together, now that Mary knows they're involved. Actually, now that I know they're involved for that matter.

I step up and put my hand on Oliver's shoulder, looking at Kikiri. ""Put your hand on my shoulder,"" I say with more confidence than I feel. Maybe there's enough alcohol left to numb the pain if her crystals do get past Shazam's armor? ""You won't hurt me.""

I look back to Oliver, intending to give him an encouraging nod, but all the head turning has me dizzy and instead I just focus on standing here for now.
dice roll

I <em>need </em>to keep my team together, now that Mary knows they're involved. I step up and join the group, hand on Sylvia's free shoulder. I still don't know what was actually going on with the text, but looks like we could be useful regardless, so it's all good for now. ""I'm good to go.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I step up and join the group, hand on Sylvia's free shoulder. I still don't know what was actually going on with the text, but looks like we could be useful regardless, so it's all good for now. <strong>""I'm good to go.""</strong></p>

Kikiri Dawn, Mackenzie Marvel tries to reassure you, but you sense something's wrong with her, a chink in her armor, as it were. You would gain Influence over her right now, but since you already have it, you can shift one of her Labels up and another down, telling her who she needs to be right now.

What do you do?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>Kikiri Dawn, Mackenzie Marvel tries to reassure you, but you sense something's wrong with her, a chink in her armor, as it were. You would gain Influence over her right now, but since you already have it, you can shift one of her Labels up and another down, telling her who she needs to be right now.</em></p><p>What do you do?</p>

I snap, a little angrier than I mean to, ""yeah?"" I lower my voice, ""cause your advice has been so helpful... do you even know how much trouble that little prank you put me up to caused me?""

I sigh loudly, shake my head and walk over to Kate. I don't want to look like I'm not with the team, but I don't want it to look like Mac is the reason. 

""Kate, hey let me hold onto you,"" as long as it's ok with her I grab a handful of Kate's jacket or whatever. Somewhere tough that I won't mess up too much.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I snap, a little angrier than I mean to, ""<strong>yeah?</strong>"" I lower my voice, ""<strong>cause your advice has been so helpful... do you even know how much trouble that little prank you put me up to caused me?</strong>""</p><p>I sigh loudly, shake my head and walk over to Kate. I don't want to look like I'm not with the team, but I don't want it to look like Mac is the reason. </p><p>""<strong>Kate, hey let me hold onto you,</strong>"" as long as it's ok with her I grab a handful of Kate's jacket or whatever. Somewhere tough that I won't mess up too much. </p>
With everyone joined together, Calaca, you feel enough of a circle to try and open up a portal. Let's see you Unleash your Powers.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>With everyone joined together, Calaca, you feel enough of a circle to try and open up a portal. Let's see you Unleash your Powers.</p>

I can tell that everyone is nervous because I might not have the skill to do this, or that I might fail. Even Mackenzie looks a little wobbly. I've got to be a center of strength for them. Since this is only the second time I've ever teleported someone other than myself, and the first time was just minutes ago, my stomach does a turn on me. I suck it up and stand tall ... well, straight, at least, if not tall.

I whisper, ""Chacs, grant me the power to do this."" My skull flares up and I call on the power to take us to ... the Water Tower on the south side ... gulp. The glowing hoop forms at our feet.

""Here we go,"" I say, loudly, with shaky confidence.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I can tell that everyone is nervous because I might not have the skill to do this, or that I might fail. Even Mackenzie looks a little wobbly. The glowing hoop forms at our feet.</p><p><strong>""Here we go,""</strong> I say, loudly, with shaky confidence.</p>

Kikiri's words sting. I was just trying to bond with her the way Kate does, by getting into a little trouble together, conspiring, all that. And I even fessed up to Hawkwoman about it too.

And still, still I have to stand by and watch Kikiri choose Kate over me. Like Mary does.

Like everyone does.

I swallow the lump in my throat, and focus on not crushing Oliver's shoulder in my grip.

column3: 1.7 Day 4 - Back to the Ruins

column4:
The night passes without incident, and a half day's ride gets the men back to the ruined tower around lunch. 

""I'll start cooking if you guys want to look around,"" the guide offers.

column4:
As my training continued it eventually gnawed at me that I I had not seen the ""Roach"" in quite some time, For all the grief he gives me I do owe him. And I squelch on my debts.

I was not exactly sure how to get to him, but fortunately he was  waiting for me outside of the tournament area. Apparently a friend of a friend tipped him off I was at the tournament, my relief turned a little sour when I realized this tip probably had a steep cost, this place was way beyond his dealings.

""So this is how you lay low""- he said with a chuckle. I explained that my entree was not entirely of my own volition. He insitited he knew all about that. Whether it was true or he just wanted to sound in the know I couldn't tell. 

""Look I got a big job for you"" - he whispered the mirth leaving his face. "" I have a jar and the damn lid will not come off"". I sank a little bit, this was code making someone talk, he knew I did not like that kind of work.

""Look I would not ask you if this was a normal jar, but this damn Lid will not budge, and I dont want to say it but I stuck my neck-"" I interrupted him ""I owe you"". We both gave eachother a little nod.

it took us about 2 days to get to the ""guest Quarters"" Inside was a strikingly muscular grey man stark naked thoroughly chained to chair. Obviously he was not human, or fully. His bright green eyes clashed with ash grey skin. He looked to my entrance with amusement in his eyes. 


Although I disdained torture, I have been called in the past to help, usually as a big scary prop. But this one was not going to give in that easily. 

He had been held hear for at least a week, probably held in another location longer, and seemed completely unphased.

First impression's I thought to myself, in a commanding voice I said ""You are going to talk, how much of you is intact is entirely up to you"". 

Not a word just amusement on his face like a child about to receive a toy.

I rolled up my sleeve slowly letting the tension build leaned back so he could see my full height and punched him square in the jaw as hard as I could. It felt like hitting a wall,  no give, no impression that I was ever going to move it, saying his skin was like stone did not accurately portray it, his face was a mountain. I tried to hide my shock and the pain in my fist the best I could, but the smile practically screamed he knew. I looked at the men guarding him, broken fists, damaged weapons.

""no ones accusing you of having a glass jaw""- I complimented him. I pulled out my sword it, and layed it on his should letting him have a good look. I explained to him I am not even sure how old it is or who made it. But we all know how dangerous an artifact can be,

His eyes moved from the blade back to me, and again a big grin stretched across his face. I slid the blade across his skin attemping to dig in but again to no avail, I pushed harder and harder until I realized if this was a normal blade it would have shattered. 


I then swung down hard on his hair, nothing, not even a cut strand. and that same god damn smile across his face.

Changing gears I picked up piece of metal from one of the boys swords, I asked him to start a fire outside and bring me this when he was ready.  With that my gaze turned backed to the grey man who sat their, smile never fading.

After two days of trying everything of shocking him, burning him, crushing, slashing, nothing phased him, even jabbed molten steel in his eye. Nothing.

I reported to the ""Roach"" Nothing is breaking him. But I met some new people that might be able to help. and thus I returned back to the tournament area seeking assistance from my team members.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282286""><div class=""row"">

Damn it, damn it, damn it. I cant wait to get out from underneath that cursed exalteds thumb. Here I am in my paradise. Alone, no one to interrupt my studies or experiments, and no one raising pitchforks because of my less than adequate looks, but marvelous hair. Anyways I have to leave this paradise or that witch Rose will mark me for death more then I already am, which is to simply put, a lot. Nevertheless I will abandon my studies for now as... I am -obligated- as she puts it to serve, not that she appreciates my genius, and until I wiggle my way out of that oppression I will do as bid. However, the tasks she has me doing  this time around are all trivial which I could knock out in a day or two. I suppose I could go gambling for a bit... wouldn't hurt any right?

I walk around the tournament stands prowling for a game of chance to win. Despite gods and mythical creatures being the ones to reside in this place I'm still rejected at every turn and to be honest it stings a little. Without some big chip to bet no one is willing to stand the sight of me. Perhaps if I put on make up they would see how fabulous I could be. 

At the boiling point of my frustrations for being rejected my simpleton of a team mate Sid comes begging and pleading for my help. Apparently there is a man hes trying to break, but just does not possess the inventiveness to do so. I suppose I could help, Sid would owe me a favor and this is an excellent way to take out my frustrations in a ""healthy"" manner. . 

After agreeing to assist Sid with his endeavor to break a man. He more then eager to bring me to a nearby town near the base mountain. When we get in town we cross through some back alleys before he eventually bring me to a lone looking door. At this point my attention wavers a bit. He goes through what could only be described a stereotypical villainous code as he does a rhythm and says nonsensical words strung together. In all honesty I stop caring at this point and start to space out.

Eventually Sid gets us inside the building where he greeted by.... lesser thugs. They all seem to stare at me with actual awe. Perhaps they think I'm some sort of mad man who is well versed in the art of torture. I couldn't blame them. My looks tend to make people think like that. Eventually these lesser thugs guide us to the basement before bringing us to a dry bleak dreary gray room. Inside it are two guards stationed, sid, and in the center of the room a chiseled, sexy, naked Gray Man. I walk up to the man calmly giving him my best mad doctor smile, but it comes out as a sensual smile. The Gray Man shudders at the sight of my look. Clearly this wont be that hard.

I tell the man sitting before me,
 ""You're going to spill everything these fine people want to know... or I will put you through the same hell that made me look like this."" 
I give him that same mad smile I gave him before. However this time his reaction is different, he seems to give me a mocking smile like I put him back in his element.
""Oh Well, don't say I didn't offer you the easy way out.""
And just like that I began getting to work to break this man. I start off with some light.... -experiments- to see just how resilient this man is. A few prods and pokes with a sharp weapon some flayed skin here and there. However the man just keeps that mocking smile through it all. Perhaps I need to put some effort into it.
I pull my bag out. I show the man all manners of concoctions. Poisons, laxatives, mind warping drugs. I dont take the time to bother explaining them. I can guess he already figured out all these potions and vials I laid before him does not bode well for his health. 
I start applying several home brews just to experiment. An ointment that would make a man feel like they are burning wherever applied. Results are ineffective he doesnt even seem to break a sweat. I break a green vial infront of his nose. One whiff of this stuff and nightmares start to become a reality in the eyes of the beholder. However, this man still doesnt seem to break as if he mentally pushed himself through whatever nightmares hes seeing. Okay... time to bring out the big guns. I grab a vial filled with powder. This powder however is the devils powder. You put this on someone and they are liable to flay their own skin just to make the pain stop. I slowly apply this to each limb of the man. Slowly stopping to see if he ever broke that mocking smile. I frown, he didn't. 

Through the hours I try all manner of combinations but I cant seem to get it into this Gray Man's thick skull that he should fear me. It aggravating. Why dont you let me try? Ah Hah! I have an idea. I feel myself moving and thoughts flow into my head... strange part is I cant seem to recognize my own thoughts. How odd of a feeling. I walk up to the man I feel my body making its own actions. I just watch for now. My body seems to be... giggling? Am I giggling? The Gray Man seems to be put back on the defensive losing that mocking smile. I playfully slide me finger up and down the mans body as if I'm... caressing him? I try to stop myself, but my hands wont listen to me. For a few more minutes I seem to play with the man but then I suddenly stop only to start... playing with his hair? Am I knotting his hair? Words leave my mouth, but they arn't mine.
""Eyes you can get lost in, an exotic skin tone, abs to die for, but your hair is something were going to have to work on honey.""

I. Did. Not. Say. That. I feel like I'm shouting at myself to stop but I cant. I try to walk away from the Gray Man but my body just keeps playing with his hair. I come to the realization that I'm not in control. Something is controlling me, but what? It cant be magic.. I'm not so weak willed... am I? The only bright side to any of this is the Gray Man just looks down right disturbed having long since lost that mocking smile for a more pleasant look of dread. Even if I feel like I have that same look of dread. 

My body stops knotting the mans hair after a while. It seems to look around my bag, I know my body is looking for a mirror, but I stopped carrying those ever since my disfigurement for obvious reason. My body seems frustrated. 
""Thats a shame, I thought I had a mirror to show you what I've done with your hair. It looks positively lovely! "" 
The guards in the room seem to be giving my strange looks as well as Sid, but they let me continue. 
""Not a big talker are you? Thats a shame, but I suppose a man of mystery has is own unique appeal I could get behind.""
I walk infront of the man and lean forwards looking the man dead in the eyes. I see the same horrified look in his eyes as I know are in mine. My body is going in for a kiss. I actively am bucking, screaming, shouting for my body to stop but it just doesn't listen. The Gray Man in a moment of desperation rocks his head back at the last possible second before head butting me in the nose. Just like that I'm back in control my hands move the way I want them to and this pain is mine. I feel in the back of my thoughts something screaming in pain. Thats odd.. I dont feel pain, not anymore at least but yet I know some part of me does. I go to feel my nose and I realize is broken. 
That bastard broke my nose! I was only showing him affection.
""You bastard, you broke my nose.""

I swear I hear a voice, that it both mine and not. Am I losing it? Well I couldnt say. I feel an anger boil up from inside me. I dont know why but I was both wildly pleased the man stopped me and insanely pissed off he rejected my affections. I need to get out of this place to clear my head. Just as I pack up to leave I see the man giving me a bigger mocking smile then I have ever seen him give since I came into this place. I also see the guards and the Sid snickering in the back to themselves. This man has destroyed what was left of my pride and dignity. I will make him pay. 

I start the torture with renewed vigor, but after a couple more hours I give up. He has honestly beaten me. I have never met a man with such a high pain tolerance... perhaps he can feel no pain like I can? No, no, no he flinched when devil's powder was on him. He knows its there he just doesnt care. Bah he isnt worth my time. As I begin to walk to the stationed guards to let them know I give up, I hear the Gray Man for the first time laughing... at me. Its so frustrating he completely beat me
.
I let out a mental sigh... strange I do those in person more often then not. Wait am I not in... is my body... its not me honey. Did I just tell myself it wasn't me? I'm snapped back to reality as I hear my body giving a playful, mischievous laugh. It walks up to the guards with what I can only assume is a complete look of satisfaction. I get brief flashs of what my current body intends to do and even I'm slightly horrified. I wrest control of my body for the briefest of moments. 

""Sid you and the Gray Man's guards need to leave now. I wont kill the man you have my word.""

Sid nods the the simpleton may not fully comprehend, but I think he understands he cant be around for this next part. As soon as Sid and the guards leave my body turns around. The Gray Man who was just laughing at my defeat has an utter look of confusion on his face. I think he's realizing at the same moment that I am. I'm a Mad Man. My body seems to respond back to me.

""Not a mad man!""

I'm shocked that my body is interacting with me in this way, but before I can truly start asking if it understands me, my body simply moves forwards to the Gray Man and places a hand on one of his knees. I feel the winds of magic, motes of power start to transmute the mans knee. Somehow I realize my body is drawing upon my knowledge of medicine. I think its remaking the mans knee into something fragile and filled nerves.... and at that moment my body in 100% genuine curiosity asks the Gray Man. 

""Where is the treasure map?""

It aggravating. <del>Why dont you let me try?</del> Ah Hah! I have an idea. I feel myself moving and thoughts flow into my head... strange part is I cant seem to recognize my own thoughts. How odd of a feeling. I walk up to the man I feel my body making its own actions. I just watch for now. My body seems to be... giggling? Am I giggling? The Gray Man seems to be put back on the defensive losing that mocking smile. I playfully slide me finger up and down the mans body as if I'm... caressing him? I try to stop myself, but my hands wont listen to me. For a few more minutes I seem to play with the man but then I suddenly stop only to start... playing with his hair? Am I knotting his hair? Words leave my mouth, but they arn't mine.</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Eyes you can get lost in, an exotic skin tone, abs to die for, but your hair is something were going to have to work on honey.""</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">

<strong>I. Did. Not. Say. That. </strong>I feel like I'm shouting at myself to stop but I cant. I try to walk away from the Gray Man but my body just keeps playing with his hair. I come to the realization that I'm not in control. Something is controlling me, but what? It cant be magic.. I'm not so weak willed... am I? The only bright side to any of this is the Gray Man just looks down right disturbed having long since lost that mocking smile for a more pleasant look of dread. Even if I feel like I have that same look of dread. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">My body stops knotting the mans hair after a while. It seems to look around my bag, I know my body is looking for a mirror, but I stopped carrying those ever since my disfigurement for obvious reason. My body seems frustrated. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Thats a shame, I thought I had a mirror to show you what I've done with your hair. It looks positively lovely! "" </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">The guards in the room seem to be giving my strange looks as well as Sid, but they let me continue. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Not a big talker are you? Thats a shame, but I suppose a man of mystery has is own unique appeal I could get behind.""</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">I walk infront of the man and lean forwards looking the man dead in the eyes. I see the same horrified look in his eyes as I know are in mine. My body is going in for a kiss. I actively am bucking, screaming, shouting for my body to stop but it just doesn't listen. The Gray Man in a moment of desperation rocks his head back at the last possible second before head butting me in the nose. Just like that I'm back in control my hands move the way I want them to and this pain is mine. I feel in the back of my thoughts something screaming in pain. Thats odd.. I dont feel pain, not anymore at least but yet I know some part of me does. I go to feel my nose and I realize is broken. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><del><strong>That bastard broke my nose! I was only showing him affection.</strong></del></div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""You bastard, you broke my nose.""<br>

</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">I swear I hear a voice, that it both mine and not. Am I losing it? Well I couldnt say. I feel an anger boil up from inside me. I dont know why but I was both wildly pleased the man stopped me and insanely pissed off he rejected my affections. I need to get out of this place to clear my head. Just as I pack up to leave I see the man giving me a bigger mocking smile then I have ever seen him give since I came into this place. I also see the guards and the Sid snickering in the back to themselves. This man has destroyed what was left of my pride and dignity. I will make him pay. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">I start the torture with renewed vigor, but after a couple more hours I give up. He has honestly beaten me. I have never met a man with such a high pain tolerance... perhaps he can feel no pain like I can? No, no, no he flinched when devil's powder was on him. He knows its there he just doesnt care. Bah he isnt worth my time. As I begin to walk to the stationed guards to let them know I give up, I hear the Gray Man for the first time laughing... at me. Its so frustrating he completely beat me</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">.</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">I let out a mental sigh... strange I do those in person more often then not. Wait am I not in... is my body... <del>its not me honey.</del> Did I just tell myself it wasn't me? I'm snapped back to reality as I hear my body giving a playful, mischievous laugh. It walks up to the guards with what I can only assume is a complete look of satisfaction. I get brief flashs of what my current body intends to do and even I'm slightly horrified. I wrest control of my body for the briefest of moments. </div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Sid you and the Gray Man's guards need to leave now. I wont kill the man you have my word.""</div><div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">Sid nods the the simpleton may not fully comprehend, but I think he understands he cant be around for this next part. As soon as Sid and the guards leave my body turns around. The Gray Man who was just laughing at my defeat has an utter look of confusion on his face. I think he's realizing at the same moment that I am. I'm a Mad Man. My body seems to respond back to me.</div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Not a mad man!""</div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">I'm shocked that my body is interacting with me in this way, but before I can truly start asking if it understands me, my body simply moves forwards to the Gray Man and places a hand on one of his knees. I feel the winds of magic, motes of power start to transmute the mans knee. Somehow I realize my body is drawing upon my knowledge of medicine. I think its remaking the mans knee into something fragile and filled nerves.... and at that moment my body in 100% genuine curiosity asks the Gray Man. </div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);""><br></div><div style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"">""Where is the treasure map?""</div>
Back to Top

column4:
Panel 1: Establishing shot of a Tibetan Buddhist monastery atop a snowy mountain range.

Caption: Míngxiǎng Monastery, Heilongjiang, Manchuria.

Caption: 1932.

INCENSE MASTER QU (off-panel): ""And now you undertake the most solemn of oaths, the last sacred oaths you will ever take.""  


Panel 2: Deep beneath Míngxiǎng, a series of caves lit by lanterns leading into a single large natural cavern. The cavern's stalactites and stalagmites are riddled with small, carved-out alcoves containing lit candles; the dripping piles of wax indicate that candles have been placed and lit here for many years. In the center of the cavern is an altar, its top stained with the blood of many previous sacrificial offerings. Plumes of incense smoke rise from bowls placed upon the altar. Braziers filled with red hot coals fume on either side of the altar. Suspended high above the altar is a brass statue of a bearded warrior with a red-lacquered face, green-lacquered robes over his armor, and a massive guan dao, Green Dragon Crescent Blade,  looking down as if gazing into Hell with a demonic leer.

All around the altar are acolytes of the SI-FAN, wearing their traditional green garb. They stand at attention, in military-style formation. They are entirely male.

At the head of this congregation are teenaged LI FENG (holding the Staff of Nü Gua [Have we settled on a name for this yet? Entwining Oath, Shackled Fate, Spirit Binder, Soul Weaver? -- Ed.]) and BAO CHENG-HO, clad in the same green outfits as their brethren, but facing the crowd. 

Between them, presiding over this wicked rite, is INCENSE MASTER QU. In his upraised hand is a sharp, curved knife.

MASTER QU: Li Feng, Bao Cheng-ho -- now you shall swear the Thirty-Six Oaths of Loyalty before our revered Guan Gong...


Panel 3: The crowd of SI-FAN acolytes, hands behind their backs, at attention, all yelling in unison.

MASTER QU (off-panel): -- before the witness of your brethren, and sealed with a sacrifice of your own blood!

SI-FAN ACOLYTES: SWEAR IT!

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-286103""><div class=""row"">

Li Feng stands proud before her Brothers, her eyes bright and determined.  In the Temple, she was welcomed as a brother, and she would always love them for what they had given her, but the Si Fan were the family she had chosen, with eyes and heart both open.  And she knew she would prove herself worthy of their number -- indeed, more than worthy.

""After having entered the Hung gates I must treat the parents and relatives of my sworn brothers as my own kin,"" she intones, and the baritone voice of Bao Cheng-Ho keeps steady pace beside her, word for word.  ""I shall suffer death by five thunderbolts if I do not keep this oath.""

And that was only right, she felt -- these were her brothers, and she was theirs.  And one would do no less than that for one's family.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Li Feng stands proud before her Brothers, her eyes bright and determined.  In the Temple, she was welcomed as a brother, and she would always love them for what they had given her, but the Si Fan were the family she had chosen, with eyes and heart both open.  And she knew she would prove herself worthy of their number -- indeed, <em>more </em>than worthy.</p><p>""After having entered the Hung gates I must treat the parents and relatives of my sworn brothers as my own kin,"" she intones, and the baritone voice of Bao Cheng-Ho keeps steady pace beside her, word for word.  ""I shall suffer death by five thunderbolts if I do not keep this oath.""</p><p>And that was only right, she felt -- these were her brothers, and she was theirs.  And one would do no less than that for one's family.</p>

column2: The only Arachnid warship seen so far: a flat wedge with two spikes jutting out of the narrow front end and a total of twelve spines that curve forward coming out of the rear top and bottom. It is like all their constructs an entirely organic ship and as such is alive.

The skin of this creature is a strong adapting armour, like that of all Arachnid ships. Backing up this armor are shields consisting of interwoven energy fields and layers of gravitational distortion. These shields are capable of absorbing large amounts of energy, be it directed energy or kinetic in nature.
The armament of the Scout consists of a Quantum Gravitic Discharge Cannon which fires bursts of energy.

The ships sublight propulsion consists of a powerful gravity drive system that is used for maneuvering and main thrust. this gives the Scout superb maneuverability and acceleration. This drive can also be used as a tractor beam. Because of their long experience with FTL physics they have a hyperdrive system that allows them to move in and out of hyperspace at will, at whatever position they wish to appear at. This gives them a great advantage in ambushes etc. they can also use the drive to pass in between hyperspace and real space and be virtually invulnerable there.

Since the ship is alive it has an intelligence similar to that of a sentient AI and so can perform difficult maneuvers on its own. On sensor readings the ship will read as built out of organic materials rather than the metal alloys that most starships are built out of. When its ECM is engaged it is almost impossibly hard to detect.

column2: Earth Standard Date: 4th April 2369 6pm
Location: Arachnid Scout Ship, docked planetside at the Krytea Spaceport  - KRYTEA A4-F37D-O55 (Hex:2935)

Aboard the ship are Bruce, Faraday, Harmony,  Hebe and Quintus. An hour ago Faraday and Harmony made arrangements with Wilbur while Hebe negotiated with a hacker to fix her virus and Quintus entertained Bruce on ship.  The mysterious Abelard Dane picked up by mistake while travelling in hyperspace is apparently in the local authority police centre reporting on his alleged pirate attack and alleged escape.

column1:
Incoming communication answerable by Bruce, Quintus or Hebe. Or by anyone if Harmony asks the Ship to open communications (as she is now fluent in Arachnid).

""So my buddies, there was, like, a lot of background noise and as you are going to be owing me a Big Favour, I'm just wanting to be, like, totally clear on this.  When do you want me to extract the folk at the place?  Or should I wait for a signal?""

Or by anyone if <strong>Harmony </strong>asks the <strong>Ship </strong>to open communications (as she is now fluent in Arachnid).</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);""><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">""So my buddies, there was, like, a lot of background noise and as you are going to be owing me a Big Favour, I'm just wanting to be, like, totally clear on this.  When do you want me to extract the folk at the place?  Or should I wait for a signal?""</span></span></p>

Quintus is aware that there's a plan; that Harm has arranged with their contacts to make infil and/or exfil happen; and that this is what Harm does. There's no advantage to wading into a conversation that's already been had and upsetting the plan.

""Harm, comms inbound, encapsulation protocol says it's from Wilbur. You're our infiltrations expert. Happy to take point on this one?"" Quintus leaves some space for Harmony to agree; Harmon's always seemed overly keen to wade into danger first, after all. He feels a sense of self-preservation is unlikely to have developed over the last few minutes.

And then: ""Anyone want to weigh in before we open a channel?""

column3: 2530 through 2540 - A Series of Communications

column4:
Wave 2530.0100 15:24 - Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Mr. Beglan,

My name is Hotaru Minami and I am nine years old. I am doing a report about famous astronomers. I learned that you found the Amenoukihashi by observing the stars. How did you know to look where you did? How could you tell it was not another star or planet or space dust? Do you think other Arks are out there? 

I can not find a biography about you. My friends Daichi and Tomiko say it is because you are not dead. They said you should write an autobiography instead. I told them I would interviewer you for my report. Will you let me interview you?

Sincerely,

Hotaru Minami

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282350""><div class=""row"">

Dear Ms. Hotaru,

Thank you for you letter. I wouldn’t consider myself a famous astronomer, just a lucky one. I was an amateur looking through a small telescope for undiscovered comets when I found what turned out to be the Amenoukihashi. Sometimes the greatest discoveries happen by chance. 

In space natural objects like comets, asteroids and even dust clouds are pulled around by gravity. In the ‘Verse, with our five suns, this results in some pretty strange orbits. Imagine five people pulling on you from different directions. But as strange as they are, they are predictable, if you know the location and momentum of the object relative to all the suns and planets.  What you don’t ever see is a natural object suddenly change its direction. And that is what the Amenoukihashi did.

Of course, the Verse has many space ships traveling between the planets, so spotting a large spaceship would not be that unusual. What was unusual is that the Amenoukihashi was outside the elliptic of the Verse, a sort of flat disk where most of the suns and planets orbit; and where you’d find almost all space traffic. I happened to be looking in that direction because I hoped to find one of those unusual objects that does orbit on that disk. 

I watched the small speck travel in one direction for a week or so, then it changed direction. That was when I knew it wasn’t a comet. The rest is history.

I don’t know if there are any other Arks out there, though it’s true several others never made it to our system. If you continue to study astronomy, maybe you’ll be the one to find one.

I hope that all made sense. If not, I hope you will look up some of those words and ideas and tell me if they make sense. And I’d be happy to answer any more questions you have.

I am happy to correspond with you more if you’d like to learn more about astronomy.

Maybe you can tell me what are your favorite subjects in school, and your hobbies. 

Beglan Shea,

But my friends call me ‘Beggar'

Wave 2530.0103 07:01 - Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Mr. Beglan,

My Teacher, Ito-sensei, showed me how to search the cortex. I looked up all those words and decided I do not want to be an astronomer anymore. I think I might want to be a pilot or a detective. I read a story about a pilot who was also a detective and flies around the 'Verse solving crimes!

Don't be sad. I will still interview you for my report.

Did you always want to be an astronomer? When did you know you wanted to be an astronomer? Do you have a family like a wife or children? I live with haha (my mother). I don't have any brother or sister. Tomiko has a brother and Daichi has a brother and a sister. I am glad I don't have any brothers or sisters. They aren't always very nice. 

Sincerely,

Hotaru Minami

I looked up all those words and decided I do not want to be an astronomer anymore. I think I might want to be a pilot or a detective. I read a story about a pilot who was also a detective and flies around the 'Verse solving crimes!</p><p>Don't be sad. I will still interview you for my report.</p><p>Did you always want to be an astronomer? When did you know you wanted to be an astronomer? Do you have a family like a wife or children? I live with haha (my mother). I don't have any brother or sister. Tomiko has a brother and Daichi has a brother and a sister. I am glad I don't have any brothers or sisters. They aren't always very nice. </p><p>Sincerely,</p><p>Hotaru Minami</p>

Wave 2530.0103 07:01 - Shea.Beglan-Gonghe

Dear Hotaru

Good to hear from you. Astronomy is not for eveyone. My wife Rosalie is a journalist, that is something like a detective. 

I originally wanted to be a cricketer, but I was never very good. In school, I studied to be a shepherd, but that didn’t work out either. I was an mechanic at a gas plant for a bit, then an engineer on a merchant ship, I’ve always loved looking at the stars, and luckily I was able to make looking at the stars my job.

I grew up in a big family with three brothers and four sisters, and lots of cousins around. Most of them were nice enough, but it got a little rough sometimes. Still, I knew they loved me. Most of them still live in Londinium. I was the only one to leave the planet for good. I thought I would have a big family like mine growing up, but life hadn’t worked out like that.

I told you about my wife, she is beautiful and smart, she keeps me honest with myself. Do you know someone who knows you as well or better than yourself! As a journalist she travels all over the Verse, so we don’t see her as often as we’d like. Our daughter Stella is just five, but I can tell she is going to be like her mother. 

I see you’re from Tethys... pardon my asking, but are you in RA Shinkyo? 

Beggar
