Most of them were nice enough, but it got a little rough sometimes. Still, I knew they loved me. Most of them still live in Londinium. I was the only one to leave the planet for good. I thought I would have a big family like mine growing up, but life hadn’t worked out like that.</p><p>I told you about my wife, she is beautiful and smart, she keeps me honest with myself. Do you know someone who knows you as well or better than yourself! As a journalist she travels all over the Verse, so we don’t see her as often as we’d like. Our daughter Stella is just five, but I can tell she is going to be like her mother. </p><p>I see you’re from Tethys... pardon my asking, but are you in RA Shinkyo? </p><p>Beggar</p>

Wave 2530.0104 20:22 - Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Hello Mr Beggar-san,

Thank you for answering my questions. I will make an excellent report with it. I hope you don't mind if I continue writing to you. It is nice to have a pen pal.

I am in RA Shinkyo. My haha says that one day soon we will leave and find a new home. Don't tell her but I don't want to leave. My best friends are here and I don't think I want to get on another ship ever again. I sometimes have bad dreams about being stuck in a pod in the middle of the black. 

Stella must be sad not seeing her Okaa-san (mother). I know I miss my chichi (father) and wish I could see him again. 

Sincerely,

Hotaru Minami

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Wave 2530.0104 20:22 - Minami.Hotaru-Tethys</p><p>Hello Mr Beggar-san,</p><p>Thank you for answering my questions. I will make an excellent report with it. I hope you don't mind if I continue writing to you. It is nice to have a pen pal.</p><p>I am in RA Shinkyo. My haha says that one day soon we will leave and find a new home. Don't tell her but I don't want to leave. My best friends are here and I don't think I want to get on another ship ever again. I sometimes have bad dreams about being stuck in a pod in the middle of the black. </p><p>Stella must be sad not seeing her Okaa-san (mother). I know I miss my chichi (father) and wish I could see him again. </p><p>Sincerely,</p><p>Hotaru Minami</p>

Dear Hotaru-san,

I spent many years on a ship. I actually loved being in the black, my last ship, a durance class, had a large shuttle bay with huge windows and a roof you could turn transparent. That is where I set up my telescope, but some nights I would just lie there and look all around me at the stars. When I think of them moving in harmony, always changing but ever the same, I see the work of God. It makes me feel better when things are chaotic in my life, to know that it is there, constant. And there has been a lot of chaos in it. Someday, maybe when you're older, I have some stories for you. corse, they may'nt get you to like the Black any more.

Stella misses her mother terribly. We have a game we play, Rosie takes out personal ads on the Bu Gao Lan, with little clues for us to solve to learn where she is, or where she is going. She hides little things, Easter Eggs she calls them, I could never figure out why, in the messages. It is like a game of hide and seek she plays with Stella from all across the 'Verse. She usually uses the 'penny' ads, or sometime 'lost and found' classified, since those are free. We see each other as much as we can, but we do miss her. It helps to know she is doing good work.

Where do you think you'll be headed?

Your friend,

Beggar

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dear Hotaru-san,</p><p>I spent many years on a ship. I actually loved being in the black, my last ship, a durance class, had a large shuttle bay with huge windows and a roof you could turn transparent. That is where I set up my telescope, but some nights I would just lie there and look all around me at the stars. When I think of them moving in harmony, always changing but ever the same, I see the work of God. It makes me feel better when things are chaotic in my life, to know that it is there, constant. And there has been a lot of chaos in it. Someday, maybe when you're older, I have some stories for you. corse, they may'nt get you to like the Black any more.</p><p>Stella misses her mother terribly. We have a game we play, Rosie takes out personal ads on the <a href=""https://wiki.rpg.net/index.php/Bu_Gao_Lan"" target=""_blank"">Bu Gao Lan</a><strong>,</strong> with little clues for us to solve to learn where she is, or where she is going. She hides little things, Easter Eggs she calls them, I could never figure out why, in the messages. It is like a game of hide and seek she plays with Stella from all across the 'Verse. She usually uses the 'penny' ads, or sometime 'lost and found' classified, since those are free. We see each other as much as we can, but we do miss her. It helps to know she is doing good work.</p><p>Where do you think you'll be headed?</p><p>Your friend,</p><p> Beggar</p>

Video Message 2530.246 6:00 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

The video starts with three children staring into the screen. They all are of Japanese descent. The one in the middle is a young girl with short hair that barely reaches to her jawline and blue eyes. On one side is another girl obviously younger with much longer hair wrapped in a ponytail that drapes over her left shoulder. On the other side is a boy who looks to be closer to a teenager with hair neatly combed and parted. 

The three of them are speaking in Japanese to each other. For those who know the language, the dialect that the children are speaking is obviously nothing spoken around the verse in hundreds of years.

IN JAPANESE:

“Is it working?” Tomiko, the younger girl asks.

“Shh,” Hotaru responds, pointing to the screen. “He can hear you.”

The three children all turn as one to stare at the screen.

IN ENGLISH:

In unison, they say, “Happy Birthday, Beggar-San. Thank you for saving us.”

The three children move as if to bow but because the screen is so small it looks like they are just bobbing their heads. Then they sing a little Japanese birthday song.

Hotaru points to the girl. “This is Tomiko,” she points to the boy. “And this is Daichi”

“Hotaru talks about you all the time,” Daichi says. “We are honored to leave you his message.”

And then Tomiko pipes up, “She found your birthday in the university database.” Tomiko leans forward so her face takes up the entire space. Her next words are serious, like that of a child mimicking an adult. “You might want to ask for a raise.”

There is a sudden bickering in Japanese with Hotaru chastising Tomiko for being so rude and Daichi defending Tomiko. Tomiko looks ready to cry. Then Hotaru pushes her friends off screen so she is the only one there. 

“My apologies, Beggar-San. My friends really wanted to say hello. Otanjo-bi omedetou (happy birthday!)” Hotaru smiles brightly and waves before cutting the video.

Text Wave 2530.246 11:00 Shea.Beglan-Gonghe

Hotaru,

Thank you for the birthday message. It was nice to see and hear you and your friends. 

I am impressed with your ingenuity cracking into the system here at Loyola. A word of warning though. You can get yourself bound by law if you keep that up. The authorities doesn't much appreciate one getting into their systems, and revealing their information, trust me I know. It might seem thrilling to get away with it, and it is, until you don't get away with it. Then it is something else. 

I recommend you use your significant skills on more safe and sound activities like your studies. 

Still, thanks again for the birthday message, if you want to know more, I suggest you just ask. 

Your friend,

Beggar

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Text Wave 2530.246 11:00 Shea.Beglan-Gonghe</p><p>Hotaru,</p><p>Thank you for the birthday message. Wave 2531.0050 22:43:58 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-San,

I could not sleep and decided to send you a message. I was reading some old posts on Pulse News! yesterday. Is everything Rosalyn writes true? Some of it is very horrible. I asked my teacher about it and he said it was a bunch of lies. Then he sent me to the principal's office who told my haha I was doing something bad. She took away my access to the cortex! She does not really know how to work the terminals very well so I was able to bypass her lock so I could send this message. I promise, I will lock it up when I am done so she won't feel bad that I disobeyed her.

I did find a Pulse Special Report that talked about the Ameonukihashi and the ship Devon and its crew. Are you Lang? Is the rest of the crew still around? I do not understand all of the report but I think it says that you and the other crew are heroes. Were they your friends? Do you still keep in touch with them even though you don't travel anymore?

Your Friend,

Hotaru Minami

Wave 2533.0146 19:06:32 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-San,

I found out today that Daichi is applying to go to pilot school. If he gets in, he will leave RA Shinkyo. I was so upset, I changed his application so he would get rejected, then I felt guilty for changing his answers and changed it back and then I thought I could make his application even better so he definitely gets in. 

I know you told me not to do stuff like this but I couldn't help it. I don't want him to go, but I don't want him to be sad that he did not get in. Maybe I should go in and change it back to the original. I will change it back right after I finish this message. 

Your Friend,

Hotaru Minami

Wave 2533.0297 19:26:44 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-San,

I hope this message finds you well. How is Stella? I was reading the Penny Ads and saw Rosalie-sama's personal ad to you. I cannot tell where she is in the verse. Her clues are very hard. Maybe I will write an algorithm to search the cortex for the answer.

I am both happy and sad today. Daichi was accepted to the pilot school. He will be leaving to go into a training class for the next two years. I am going to miss him. Tomiko is mad at him and she won't talk to him anymore. I hope she changes her mind and talks to him. He will be leaving soon and then she won't be able to talk to him again for awhile.

Your Friend,

Hotaru Minami

Text Wave 2534.46 20:00 Shea.Beglan-Gonghe

Dear Hotaru,

Thank you for helping me with Rosie’s last message. I think she overestimates my technical savvy. I wish I could answer your question about why she is going... you know where, but firstly, I never really know, and secondly, if she doesn’t feel she can tell me, well best not to go speculating. I’ll read about just like you. 

Your friend,

Beggar

Text Wave 2534.99 20:00 Shea.Beglan-Gonghe

Dear Hotaru,

I have a dear friend who would warn you about trusting any anonymizers. You only have their word they work, she’s convinced that some of those are ‘seeded’ in certain communities to lull people into a false sense of security. But even she will admit to being a bit paranoid. 

My advice is to trust your instincts, I don’t regret those times I was disappointed after being tricked, even when it put me and my crew in danger. I’d rather error on the side of kindness, and justice then abandon someone in need.

There is a woman who pan-handles on my way to work. I’ve heard she commutes to her spot in a private air car. That doesn’t seem too likely, but even if she is less needy than she claims, it doesn’t lesson my opportunity to be charitable.

Be safe. Be smart. Trust your instincts.

Your friend,

Beggar

Wave 2535.001 00:10:01 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Happy New Year Beggar-San!

Daichi came home to visit for the break. Our community had a large celebration. Everyone loves Daichi. My Haha made her famous Onigiri. We all drool when she makes it. Next year I will have to decide if I want to apply to schools off-planet or stay here in RA Shinkyo.

I find so many sad things in the Verse and then I look around here and see that my people are sad too. I think many of the adults are disappointed at what they see. It is not what they expected. But for now, in the new year, they are happy to see their Daichi-Kun.

Daichi caught me before Midnight and gave me a ticket to come to his graduation later in the year. He said he had one extra after giving to the rest of his family. I told him to give the ticket to Tomiko because she adores him so but he said he wanted me to go. I want to see him graduate, but I am nervous about getting on the ship.

I am sad to see that Rosalie could not get home to see your for the new year. I hope you get to see her soon.

Your Friend,

Hotaru Minami

Wave 2535.199 11:59:59 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-san,

Daichi is graduating in the morning. I fear I could not get on the ship so I gave the ticket to Tomiko. I hope he will forgive me for giving in to my fear.

By the way, I have been thinking about your comment regarding all those anonymizers and I started writing my own. Wish me luck!

Your Friend,

Hotaru

Wave 2535.301 08:49:02 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-san,

I have finally decided! I will apply to be a teacher. After making lists of all the schools and all the professions I could enter, I did what you suggested and went with my gut. If I am a teacher, I don't have to learn only one thing. My Haha is disappointed with my choice. She says I should go to medical school and become a doctor. She mentioned a university on Osiris. I do not want to go to Osiris or to be a doctor.

Your Friend,

Hotaru

Wave 2536.025 09:09:09 Firefly.Little-Earth.That.Was

Beggar-san!

Can you guess who this is? No? Don't worry, it is only me, Hotaru.

I thought I would try out my new program. I spent all night finishing it up.

Tomiko is not talking to me anymore. She yelled at me yesterday and said I do not understand what she is going through. It is hard for me to understand when she never talks to me anymore. Ever since she went to see Daichi graduate, she seems to be avoiding me. I have tried to ask Daichi but he will not say anything either. He took a job flying cargo to the border planets and may not be back for many months.

Sometimes I feel so alone.

Wave 2536.291 06:24:13 Minami.Hotaru-Tethys

Dear Beggar-san,

I am going to teaching school! The letter came a few minutes ago. In a few months, I will be boarding a ship to a new location. I am very nervous. Daichi says he will come back to make sure I get on the ship.

Remember that new friend I told you about? She told me I should always secure all my messages. I am sending you a special encryption program with instructions on how to use it. We can now send super secret private messages.

I don't know why anyone would want to read our messages. They seem very boring and uninteresting but I trust her enough to do what she suggests.

Your Friend,

Hotaru

Encrypted Wave 2537.010 19:44:26  Firefly.Little-Earth.That.Was

Beggar-san,

I am playing with the anonymizer code and merging it with the encryption protocol. It seems rather complicated but at its core it's very simple and elegant.

Daichi is home. He arrived late last night while I was sleeping. He has changed so much. It is hard to describe but he is not the same person I knew. Will I change that much when I leave? He is still sweet and kind to me and I remember how much I missed my best friend. 

He will be flying me to my school like he promised. There is no way I can avoid it. He said he will tie me up if he has to.

Your Friend,

Little Firefly

column3: [Matthew, Richard] W2D2 One more for the road

column4: Matthew wants to meet Richard. Whoever post first, feel free to set the scene and the location. It could be Richard's PI agency, or Matthew's restaurant, or somewhere else.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-282274""><div class=""row"">
Matthew swings by Richard's PI agency and goes straight for his office and looks around
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Matthew swings by Richard's PI agency and goes straight for his office and looks around</p>
""Good evening."" said a blonde female sitting in the reception, almost as Matthew passed her. ""How can I help you?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Good evening."" said a blonde female sitting in the reception, almost as Matthew passed her. ""How can<b style=""font-style: italic;""> I </b>help you?"" </p>
Matt looks at her with dead cold eyes ""I am here to see Richard"" said Matt with a bit higher tone, so that anyone behind the door would hear him
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Matt looks at her with dead cold eyes ""I am here to see Richard"" said Matt with a bit higher tone, so that anyone behind the door would hear him</p>

She looked at a small notebook on her table.

""You haven't scheduled. What's the matter of your business? Are you here for an investigation?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>She looked at a small notebook on her table.<br><br>""You haven't scheduled. What's the matter of your business? Are you here for an investigation?"" </p>
Matt leans on the desk ""I think Richard will take me in without a scheduled apointment""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Matt leans on the desk ""I think Richard will take me in without a scheduled apointment"" </p>

""The number of people who come in through this door demanding an unscheduled meeting is... rather large. So, to know, if you'd really need one, I'll have to ask you to explain to me what's so urgent. We can start with a name and the reason.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""The number of people who come in through this door demanding an unscheduled meeting is... rather large. So, to know, if you'd really need one, I'll have to ask you to explain to me what's so urgent. We can start with a name and the reason."" </p>

Matt leans back. The whole room becomes a bit darker, his smirk threatening, his eyes more savage ""I assume Richard placed you here for a reason and you are special. By now you know what I am, but you clearly don't know who I am. I am the one who gives orders to you, so you have two options, first being quite and sit there like a little good girl that you are or continue wasting my time and learn who I am"" said Matt in an annoyed voice
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Matt leans back. The whole room becomes a bit darker, his smirk threatening, his eyes more savage ""I assume Richard placed you here for a reason and you are special. By now you know <em>what</em> I am, but you clearly don't know who I am. I am the one who gives orders to you, so you have two options, first being quite and sit there like a little good girl that you are or <em><strong>continue wasting my time and learn who I am</strong></em>"" said Matt in an annoyed voice</p>

Natalya went silent for a moment. 

""I don't know who you are, there's a lot of people coming in here on a daily bases demanding entrance. Now that you spoke that way, I do realize what you are. I'll notify Richard, until then, he's still in a meeting, and as such, you'll have to wait. ""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Natalya went silent for a moment. <br><br>""I don't know who you are, there's a lot of people coming in here on a daily bases demanding entrance. Now that you spoke that way, I do realize what you are. I'll notify Richard, until then, he's still in a meeting, and as such, you'll have to wait. ""</p>
Matthew sits down on the coach near the door.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Matthew sits down on the coach near the door.</p>

The door to the office opened, and Kelly glanced over at Matthew. 

""oh, good evening, Regent. What a lovely surprise to see you here."" she said as she strolled passed him towards the exit.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The door to the office opened, and Kelly glanced over at Matthew. <br><br>""oh, good evening, Regent. What a lovely surprise to see you here."" she said as she strolled passed him towards the exit. </p>
The whole room becomes normal again and Matt gives a fake smile ""Evening Kelly""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The whole room becomes normal again and Matt gives a fake smile ""Evening Kelly""</p>

She was about to walk away when she stopped. 

""So what brings you here? To society hill of all places? Most Kindred avoid this place, however central it might be."" 

Matthew noticed Richard in his office as well, looking out, wondering who else came to his office.

column4: St. Apollonia’s Academy for the Spooky and Mysterious Campaign

column3: 10.4 ""The Embers Estate"", a.k.a Aunt Flora's House

column4:
It doesn't seem like a house, more like a village. Even though it's definitely after midnight at this point (for Tanner drew his last breath at the very stroke of it), the Embers Estate (as Flora loves to call it with a wink and a smile) does not show any signs of stopping...whatever it is all those people are doing. 

The Embers Estate was once referred to as the Abney House, a historical plantation on the very edge of Arlington Brook's city limits. The last owner in a line dating back to the 1600's, Dr. Zachariah Abney, ended up fleeing the town in disgrace back in 1911 after it became known that not only was he running a back-alley abortion clinic for poor, down-on-their-luck girls, but he was also sterilizing them as well, taken up with the eugenics movement at the time, deciding for himself that he did not want such wanton behaviors to be passed on to the next generation. Legend has it that it's haunted, but Aunt Flora knows that there's nothing a bit of white sage can't fix. 

There's beauty in the place, however, with a sweeping lawn and a driveway framed with laurel trees still bright with their autumn colors. Lanterns are strung through the branches of every tree, lighting the way of the cars. Grazing animals, goats and sheep, make a meal of the front lawn. 

Behind the house there's a servant's quarters, converted into a clinic where Aunt Flora sees her patients, but everything else is pure chaos. People laugh and dance around a bonfire unceremoniously lit in the backyard. It's clear that a party is going on, with people wearing animal masks paired with strange formal wear: a tuxedo here, a ball gown there, togas, kilts, ceremonial dresses from all sorts of cultures. A slight woman with strawberry blonde hair serves what seems to be wine out of a giant metal garbage can, wearing a white dress and the mask of a deer, antlers and leaves crown her brow. A man in a pig mask tries to jump the bonfire, while another man in a fox mask holds him back.

There is a weird indication that this isn't even a party. This is just how things are. 

In the middle of all of this is Aunt Flora. She's wrapped in a gossamer dress of burnt orange that trails the ground. Necklaces of crystals hang from her throat, and a crown of laurel leaves freshly picked from the trees in the front sits on top of her head. She is the only one not wearing a mask. She approaches the teens with open arms. 

""Welcome to my space! I love your energy!"" she cries. ""If you want, Eve is serving up some delicious libations that you can enjoy while I take a look at this poor little...""

Her face falters a bit as she looks at Sam.

""Dog?""

Sam pads up beside the others and sits besides Cora and Trish facing this new woman. Her eyes look over the party, taking in everything.

Eccentric, that’s for sure. She looks back to the woman and huffs a gentle woof as she cocks her head, studying her thoughtfully. She didn’t exactly look like what she thought a vet would look like? Sam tries to look less wolflike and threatening and more doglike but that’s kind of just her face... resting wolf face, so it’s not particularly effective.

She tries a tail wag and relaxed pant. She feels the sticky rough patch up job Seth did getting more slick with blood. She needs stitches most likely she thinks. She raises a paw and whines at the vet. 

‘ Hi there... don’t mind me, I’m just perfectly normal dog. That’s right. Just sew me up and I’ll get the hell on out of here and send you a gift basket sometime.’ she thinks feeling a bit ridiculous trying to seem non threatening.

Just sew me up and I’ll get the hell on out of here and send you a gift basket sometime.</em></strong>’ she thinks feeling a bit ridiculous trying to seem non threatening.</p>

Dawn had spent the car ride over crammed in with everyone including the dog. She decided during the trip that she quite likes animals, even the ones that look like they could fit Dawn’s entire head into their tooth filled maw. The constant panting of the big dog is kind of comforing.

When she arrives at the distinct weird vet’s place she leaps out of the car. She suddenly reels as she feels a sudden stabbing pain in her back, she leans against the side of the car panting heavily as she tries to clear her head...
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dawn had spent the car ride over crammed in with everyone including the dog. She decided during the trip that she quite likes animals, even the ones that look like they could fit Dawn’s entire head into their tooth filled maw. The constant panting of the big dog is kind of comforing.</p><p>When she arrives at the distinct weird vet’s place she leaps out of the car. She suddenly reels as she feels a sudden stabbing pain in her back, she leans against the side of the car panting heavily as she tries to clear her head...</p>

""This is some shit,"" Summer mumbles as she takes in the scene, unaware of what Dawn is doing.


In a moment that seems to take place in between heartbeats, the girl in the deer mask turns her head to look over at Dawn, her expression is hidden behind the white on brown spots of a doe, but her blue eyes go wide as the vision overtakes Dawn. 

Suddenly, Dawn is in an ill-fitting body, one that might too easily slide from one form to another under the blue light of the moon. There is a moment as she surrenders her form into another, while Trish and Trevor's stunned faces watch. It seems, for a brief moment, that everything will be fine, that everyone will understand, and the loneliness will end. There is joy. 

And then there is pain. 

A white hot flash of pain runs down Dawn's back, and as she turns she can see him. It's that Zeke kid, staring at her with such hatred. Dark circles rim his eyes, darker than before. There's something strange about him. Distantly, a train horn sounds.

""You're not real,"" he insists. 

The razor is in her back, the razor is in his hand, as she looks up he brings it down again...

""Hey!"" The girl with the deer mask pushes through everyone to get to Dawn's side. ""Just breathe."" The girl is calm, she's like a still pond or a frozen ice rink before anyone has marred it with skates.

Flora kneels to look at the wound on what is clearly a wolf, ignoring the sudden weirdness that just occurred. ""Oh yes, it's not great, but a few stitches will do just nicely, come, we'll go to the clinic. It's a shame, sweet pea, you just missed Lupinalia.""

She takes in the motley band around her and smiles. ""I'm glad you're making friends at school, Cora. The cards told me you would. You are all free to roam the grounds of the estate if you'd like, but be careful...there are a lot of places to get lost. You can, of course, also come to the clinic with me, I have a feeling some of you want to.""

This is directed mostly at Trish, Trish nods. Flora smiles back and turns on her heel, walking towards the servant's quarter, lit by the light of the bonfire and strung with small paper lanterns. Trish follows.

Sam sniffs at the woman... getting familiar with her scent and enjoying her kindness and eccentricity... did she know what Sam was? She wonders... then she looks at Dawn concerned when she notices her distress and the other girl coming to her aid. She goes and whines empathetically and licks her hand trying to comfort her.  

When Cora’s Aunt and Trish start walking she seems torn but licks again at Dawn’s  hand with a last worried and apologetic look before following the other two and coming to walk beside Trish, padding quietly beside her... this whole night has been rather surreal, but Sam feels fairly safe here strangely... it’s hard to explain.

You’re not real

Zeke’s accusations hurts her almost as much as the agony of the razor in her back. She gasps, panicking and jerking herself off-balance, but a pair of arms stop her from pitching to the ground.

Just breathe

Without seeing who the arms belong to she clutches at them to support. The presence is calm and  reassuring. As her vision clears she finds her face inches away from something.

A deer? Prey? No, it’s just a mask. 

Her ragged breathing starts to slow as she stares up into the eyes behind the mask, but she’s still confused and disoriented by the vision.

“I am real”, she protests. Her voice is quiet but desperate, “It’s just that Dawn’s skin doesn’t fit properly, and I can’t change it in the moonlight.”

“I don't need a mask or a Halloween costume. I'm wearing them, and they don't come off.”

Cora wraps her flannel around her tightly as she looks around at the party at hand.  This was a semi average Friday at the Embers Estate...or at least how she remembered it when she was young.  They were still new in town so this was really the first one that had been thrown since she arrived.   She looks over at Seth, grabs his hand and smiles slightly.  ""If you think this is a party, you should come to a solstice."" she whispers ""Actually, check out May Day, its a fairy fuck fest.  SO MUCH NUDITY."" She giggles and walks toward her Aunt.  

""Yeah... so dog was a mild understatement.  Apparently, Cassie missed the day in school where they taught her about animals."" She chuckles, scratches Sams head, and turns her head to see how everyone else was taking the circus around them.  Either I just became the cool girl, or the laughing stock on Monday... Fuck it, I wasn't going to let an animal bleed out because my family is a bit fucking crazy!

She heard her Aunt talking to Sam about a Roman holiday but caught Eve, rushing through people toward Dawn, who looked like she was having a panic attack.  She knew her Aunt was talking to her but instead Cora felt the need to help Dawn.  ""Yeah yeah.. we'll catch up, go on"" her voice trails off as she makes it to Dawn's side.  

I don't need a mask or a Halloween costume... I'm wearing them?  How much did Dawn drink tonight?  Did someone drug her.

""Hey Gorgeous"" Cora slips a hand on Dawns shoulder lightly.  ""You alright?  Wanna go inside and get a glass of water or something?""

Seth is pretty sure the crazy new girl just invited him to a sex party. Apparently one that also involves fairy costumes? Unclear. Whatever. He's also pretty sure he is so there for it.

(Give this girl everything you've got to give her.)

It occurs to Seth to wonder whether the Fallen One wants him to forget about Francesca for the moment. Probably because I did that on my own, he thinks without a shred of self-awareness.

""I did my best to bandage her up,"" Seth tells Aunt Flora, ""but she needs real help.""

Anything beyond that is interrupted by Dawn's outburst, and, more importantly, by Cora calling her ""gorgeous"" and leading her off. Not that Dawn isn't gorgeous. She is. But that's hardly the point. It seems to be a day for people to snuggle up to him only to scamper. Another ""lesson"" from the Fallen One, no doubt.

With Trish and Aunt Flora helping Sam limp off to the clinic, and Cora taking Dawn inside, Seth finds himself, once again, alone.

Except he isn't alone. It's actually worse. He's alone with Summer Fucking Potts.

He pushes himself back onto the hood of the car, and checks his pockets. He's got a joint in his pants pocket, but he only now realizes that he never put his jacket back on after getting out of the hot tub, so he's without a lighter. There might be one in the flannel that Cora just walked off in.

Seth looks at Summer. Against his better judgment, he speaks.

""I don't suppose you've got a lighter.""

Eve stays by Dawn’s side, whispering to her but keeping her voice low. She grips Dawn’s hand tightly. 

“I feel flesh,” she says. “Real flesh. Anything else is just lies your brain tells yourself.”

She lifts her mask to reveal a youthful face, anywhere between 15 or 19. She looks as though she understands.

“There are a lot of people here,” she says. “A lot of feelings and personalities, the trick is to let them flow through you like water.”

“Flow like water”, she repeats without understanding, “I think I’m ok now.”

The grip of the deer-girl on her hand is strong and comforting, helping her focus on getting control of herself again.

“Thank you”, she says to both the deer-girl and to the devil-girl, “I’m sorry to make a scene.  I’m ok now, honest.”

“How’s the dog we brought?” she says trying to change the subject, and the focus away from herself,  “Did they get it to the vet? They don’t have to put it down do they?”

Seth doesn't like Summer Potts. He has no interest in liking Summer Potts. There is literally nothing likable about Summer Potts. But right now she's the only living thing in the vicinity who isn't somehow wrapped up in a drug-fueled fairy tale, and he's pretty sure even the Fallen One doesn't think he'd have a shot with her, so he'll probably be left relatively alone.

(Stupid boy, trying to hang with the queen of the school?)

Whoops.

Well, anyway, she gave him a lighter, so acknowledging her existence is the actual least he can do.

""What could possibly have ruined the queen bee's night so badly that wants to get high outside a combination hippie commune and vet clinic?""

Cora watches as some color starts to come back into Dawn's face.  Maybe she had a little too much to drink at the party? She keeps her hand on Dawns shoulder and lightly strokes it with her thumb, in a motherly way, hoping this will help calm her down.

""Don't worry about it.  If you think you're the only one here making a scene, well then you may need a tour. Eve is dressed like a deer!  And at least two people here could be arrested for incident exposure.""  She smiles softly hoping this will put Dawn at ease. ""The dog is fine, my Aunt took her to get some stitches.  She'll be fixed up soon enough.""  She gently removes her hand from Dawn and spots Queen Bee and Seth sharing a smoke out the corner of her eye.  A quick flash of jealousy rushes through Cora. 

Of course he sticks around with the Cheer Queen herself.  Who wouldn't go for the hot girl.  You idiot, he's not yours, he probably has a girlfriend.... you were stupid to share such a deep secret with some teen boy you JUST met!   She pulls the flannel tightly around her, and can smell Seth on it.  Stupid Girl!  Who invited that bitch anyway?!  

She looks back at Dawn and then realizes, those two came in a pair, and Dawn was too sweet for her to be mad at.  There was something about Dawn that Cora wanted to get to know more about.  They both were new in school, so it would be nice to have someone to talk to about this weird place.  Having a friend would be good, right?

""So we could go check on my Aunt and Samcakes, or we could go dance and party.""  She takes Dawns hand ""What would you like to do tonight gorgeous?""

She needs to be more careful. </p><p>She dances off after spouting whatever hippie bullshit  is necessary to keep her cover and pulls the deer mask down over her face. It’s easy here, where she can pick up on the wavelengths of all of these people, combining them into whoever she is. It’s easier this way, to drift. Maybe one day that poor girl will see it. </p><p>She takes her place by the trash can again and fixes her eyes on Summer.</p><p>That one is going to be trouble. </p>

“I’m not?” Summer asks lightly. This amuses her. “Sometimes I feel like I could be, if enough people assumed. No, I didn’t kill Tanner...but I think I might have helped him go to his death.”

She glares at him, hating the vulnerability.

“There’s a lot of shit about the world you probably don’t understand,” she says. “Something’s completely fucky about this town, have you noticed?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“I’m not?” Summer asks lightly. This amuses her. “Sometimes I feel like I could be, if enough people assumed. No, I didn’t kill Tanner...but I think I might have helped him go to his death.”</p><p>She glares at him, hating the vulnerability.</p><p>“There’s a lot of shit about the world you probably don’t understand,” she says. “Something’s completely fucky about this town, have you noticed?”</p>

“....And that covers my Satanist days,” Flora says as she gently cleans Sam’s wound with antiseptic. Trish sits on a bench, enraptured.

“So you literally anointed yourself with goat’s blood to summon a demon to impregnate you?”

Flora shrugs, threading a surgical needle with the appropriate thread. “I thought I wanted a baby at the time and hybrids HAD to be better behaved, right?” 

She shrugs. 

“Did you have it?” Trish leans forward.

Flora laughs. “Hell no! Pun intended. He stood me up, I was so embarrassed. Greg next door, he’s an incubus, told me it became a sort of inside joke for a while. So I swore off demons, except for Greg. Who barely counted at the time... I mean incubi...”

She sighs and starts to stitch Sam up. 

“They’re on another level.”

They sit in silence as Flora works, stitching up the gash in Sam’s back.

“You’ll be fine,” Flora assures her. Trish puts her head in her hands.

“So is this all bullshit?” She asks. Flora looks up, but doesn’t say anything. 

“Like, is Ashton Kutcher somehow attempting to reboot his stupid show and punk me? I feel like I’m crazy, and I don’t know what to believe anymore.” 

Flora finishes the stitches and scratches Sam behind the ears.

“Well, I have my own mantra to get through life in this world.”

“What’s that?” Trush asks. 

“Believe everything.” 

Flora pauses to let the words land before focusing her attention back on Sam. 

“And how are we doing?”

Sam rolls her eyes and snorts, huffing in an almost approximation of laughter as Flora goes on. Bewildered, a bit horrified, and also just wanting to laugh until she couldn’t breathe. Apparently this whole town was full of weird? It’s a good distraction from the pain of getting pierced with the needle over and over and getting slowly stitched up.

She leans into the head scratches and pants happily with her tongue lolling out as Flora finishes.

Sam let’s out a deep rumbling woof of acknowledgment and gratitude in answer to Flora’s question, and leans forward to lick her cheek.

The wolf jumps off the table, and shakes herself off. She feels much better. She snuffles at Flora for a bit, exploring the funky scent of the woman. She sneezes but then licks her hand in thanks and then walks over to Trish and sits.

She noses at the girls hand on the bench, licking it also once. She wishes she could speak, so she could tell Trish how much it meant that she didn’t run away, and that Sam understands how... overwhelming this all must be for her.

But this was all she had, so she offers her head to be petted and scratched, hoping Trish would be comforted and enjoy it as she enjoyed it.

""That's your problem, Potts,"" Seth says, with more compassion than he intends it to convey. ""You give so many fucks what other people think of you, that you let them tell you what to be. Everybody's scared as fuck of you, so you're like this huge, vicious tiger. But if they stopped? You'd let them declaw you. So you've got to be this man-eating tiger all the time, every day.""

He looks her dead in the eye, and, instead of an accusation, he just looks sad.

""It sounds fucking exhausting.""

He looks away, and starts flicking the lighter he still hasn't returned.

""How's that for shit I don't understand? Whatever fucky shit is out about this town, it doesn't have anything on the people."" Seth looks Summer over. He means to sound disdainful, but what comes next comes out more like a combination of anger and insecurity. ""Or am I wrong? Are you totally cool as a cucumber and not at all worried about what people think? Especially the people who might see that your boyfriend wasn't cool with you doing anything you wanted? Or that your sidepiece actually doesn't give a shit? 

""Or, worst of all, that your best friend and fearless leader might actually really care about someone like me? And I mean truly care, not in the Francesca-loves-puppies-and-everybody kind of way, but might actually want me in her life. Does that scare you?"" he says, and then accidentally adds, before he even realizes he's said it, ""as much as it scares me?""

Moon Child, thanks Eve, but I guess there are worse nicknames.

""Ahh another West Coast girl!  I'm originally from Washington, but in the past few years,"" she scrunches her face trying to hid her true emotions on the situation,""you could throw a dart on a map and probably land in a state I've lived.  Zara... errr my Mom, has a hard time blowing her...business opportunities.""  Maybe its too soon to make my mom sound a bit ho'ish. ""So, we moved a bit.   Aunt Flora said, not to worry, now we are home""  She spreads her arms wide and spins to face Dawn.  ""This is apparently the a healthy environment for a high school aged girl to grow up in.  Helps me ... oh how did she put it, understand and respect my own body and mind.  Plus, there's a fuck ton of pot... so that's sweet!""   

Cora looks around the estate that looks almost like a bohemian carnival.  People drinking and dancing, others off in the distance fucking near the woods, while a large group skip around a bonfire, and chanting what she assumes are ancient druid prays.  The veil is thin tonight.  She can hear Cassie in her head.  Sweet little witch, you have no idea the Pandora's box you've opened befriending me.  This would be your dream world, right here right now.  She feels a little bad leaving Cassie back at Seth's but someone had to watch his house, right?  And Seth... Cora shakes her head with when the thought of him pops in her mind.  Hope he's having fun fucking the Prom Queen.  She wraps the flannel around her tight smelling his scent again.  GOD DAMN IT!  I'm going to have fun tonight!  Fuck that guy!

They make it to the clinic, and Cora flings open the door.  She walks in and sees that Sam is already all stitched up and sitting by Trish's feet.  ""So hows the sweet little patient?""  she lightly scratches the wolf-dog on the head. ""I hope my Aunt didn't bore you with her life story."" She turns to her Aunt and sticks her tongue out.  ""You know you love me.""  She walks over and hops up on the counter by the large stainless steel sink, and sits facing the group.  ""So ladies, and lupus dulce, whats the night have in store for us!""

Sam pants happily at Cora and accepts her head scratches and greeting, licking her hand as she takes it away. In response to Cora’s question she pads over to window and stands up leaning her body with her massive front paws on the sill to support her large frame, and howls mournfully at the bright full moon shining through.

Now that she’s been stitched up, she wants to go back outside, to be under the starry night sky and run in the woods...

She feels the call of the wild... More danger lurks out there, true, but also answers...

“She seems fine now”, Dawn remarks as she sees the animal,  “Sure is a big thing”, she continues, staying clear of it. 

It seems friendly enough, but she’s nervous of its size,  and specifically, the size of its teeth.  

“Is she yours?”

The last question was directed at Trish. She seems to have been with the animal since they found it, so it’s her best guess. 

“It looks like she wants to go”, Dawn looks at the moon through the the window, shuffling her feet as if she wants to pace, “I can blame it. I mean who likes doctor’s offices?”

“Come on!”, she says suddenly lunging at Cora, and grabbing her hand, “The dog’s fine, and we’re missing all the dancing. Now that the emergencies over. I want to do something wild.”

“I want to dance, I want to race across around the bonfire without shoes on. Let’s go.”

She pulls Cora towards the door, despite her size, she’s surprisingly strong.

Trish looks at Dawn, uncomprehending the question at first. Did no one hear her say that this was an actual person that turned into a wolf or was Trish going completely fucking insane?

“She’s not mine,” Trish explains. “I’m pretty sure she belongs to herself.” 

With that, she opens the door to let Sam outside. “Be careful,” She whispers. “You already got hurt once today.”

This is probably where Old Summer would laugh at this display of emotion. Seth Chapel was baring his throat to her, and all she had to do was take a bite.

“I’m not scared of that. Francesca deserves to let go once in a while. She’s too proper, it’s like she’s already studying to be a senator’s wife or something. I basically do what I do because she wants to do it. The bad stuff in general, I mean.”

There’s more to it, but Summer chokes on the words. It’s best to change the subject. 

“There’s a lot that Francesca is blind to, that’s just from being a princess for so long, and I think that with your influence, she could probably become...anything. Of course that scares me, she’s my best friend. She almost defines me. It’s scary to lose that.”

Of course that scares me, she’s my best friend. She almost defines me. It’s scary to lose that.”</p>

Sam looks gratefully at Trish, and nuzzles her arm with her muzzle, she then leans up slowly and snuffles at Trish’s ear and licks it once.

‘Thank you...’ is what she is trying to say... 

She hopes that comes across. And then she turns to Aunt Flora and woofs at her and Cora and Dawn and then starts walking out the door and tries to head through the party towards the edge of the woods.

And then she turns to Aunt Flora and woofs at her and Cora and Dawn and then starts walking out the door and tries to head through the party towards the edge of the woods.</p>

""My influence, huh?"" Seth laughs darkly. ""This is the part where I say I don't want to influence her, that I just want her to be herself, right?""

He shakes his head.

""We're selfish bastards, aren't we? She's better than me. Definitely better than you. And here we are, letting her define us, not because we want to be like her, but because we want her to be what we need. What kind of pieces of shit does that make us?""

There's a memory there, all at once. Seth remembers collapsing by the water's edge, sobbing. Telling Francesca that she can't be gone, that he needs her.

The voice is suspiciously silent, and for a moment Seth wonders whether her power is diminished here. But he feels her, breathing down his neck, blanketing him. He's doing her work for her. Exactly what she wants.

""You're right. She doesn't see that. She sees the good in people. I think that's what I love so much about her."" He pauses. ""I do, you know. Love her, I mean.""

Cora flies off the counter with some force.  ""Damn girl!  Do you work out?"" She laughs as she's tugged toward the door.  Stopping before they exit the clinic, she looks at the dog.  ""Be careful SamCakes!  You always have a place to stay and friends here."" she smiles kindly at the animal then looks over to Trish.  ""Wanna come dance with us?""  But before she can get a definite answer she hears a loud yell outside.    Rushing to the door, she pops her head out, only to see it was two of the party members chasing each other, in what may be a mating ritual.  Who knows at this point, but the couple start laughing and making out, so Cora reaches back for Dawns hand.   

SamCakes, woofs in their general direction then struts pass them out of the clinic.  Cora watches as the sweet wolf makes her way through the crowd.  Not a single soul bats an eye at the wolf, she's just another invited guest.  This place strangely does feel like home. 

""So Gorgeous, how about we dance the night away, I doubt this party is going to end anytime soon!""  She interlaces her fingers into Dawns and heads out the door back to the party area where they started.  The chanting around the fire pit seems more intense, and the group is staring at the sky.  She hears someone say something that sounds like ""the veil"", but assumes her ears playing tricks on her.  There's no way everyone is talking about the veil tonight!  Whats next?  Ghosts and Vampires?  Maybe SamCakes will end up being a Werewolf!  Or maybe Tanner.... wait TANNER!  She stops dead in her tracks as she remembers her vision from earlier.  The same vision Seth had.  Seth!  I must find Seth!  ""Tanner,"" she says as she drops Dawns hand.  ""I'm sorry, I forgot about them... I need Seth.  I must find them."" She ditches Dawn and runs toward the front of the house, toward Seth.  

Shes barefoot and running on dirt, so she's able to move quickly and quietly.  She stops on the other side on the car, and apparently came in at an intense part of Seth and ...whatever season or month this girl was named after's conversation.  She hears Seth say ""I think that's what I love so much about her.....I do, you know. Love her, I mean.""  Cora's eyes burn and her heart jumps to her throat.  He's not talking about you, he's talking about that matching bookend you saw him with earlier.  You stupid, stupid girl.  You told him about you.... your darkest secret.... you dumb little girl.  You practically threw yourself at him, while others are dying.  Who crushes on some rich kid they just met?  SAY SOMETHING! But, all she can do is stand petrified like a deer in headlights.

Sam goes to the edge of the woods, and pauses, turning I look back at the friendly faces and we’ll sishes she had left. Trish, Cora, her aunt...

She doesn’t know what’s the right move here. Instincts tell her that there’s something important in the woods. Something she had been missing before. Was there  something crucial she needs to see or was this the most reckless mistake she could make, one that would get her killed? Trish was right... she had JUST been stabbed not half an hour earlier tonight.

But that girl... she sent her a vision? Important. Those people in trouble... or was it already too late? If she had been supposed to go help, had she missed her chance?

She was safe here, accepted,. Hell,people even gave her affection, both physical and kind words. There was also something mystical going on here... it might be smarter to get a better understanding of this mysterious party and the odd woman who claimed to have been involved with an incubus and believe in everything.

She couldn’t exactly ask questions but she could see more and overhear more in this form, people most likely willing to talk more freely among her wolf form than her human one.

But there was so much more unknown out there... What had become of Trevor? Of Ray? Was Zeke ok? What about that man who was trying to end the world?...

There were just too many questions. 

So Sam hesitated... stuck in a quandary, on the edge of the woods. She didn’t know where to begin her search if  she DID go into the woods, which is what she thought she needed to do. Where should she go? What was she even looking for?

She looks up at the moon again and howls, long and lingering.
dice roll

Trish, Cora, her aunt...</p><p> She doesn’t know what’s the right move here. Instincts tell her that there’s something important in the woods. Something she had been missing before. Was there  something crucial she needs to see or was this the most reckless mistake she could make, one that would get her killed? Trish was right... she had JUST been stabbed not half an hour earlier tonight.</p><p>But that girl... she sent her a vision? Important. Those people in trouble... or was it already too late? If she had been supposed to go help, had she missed her chance?</p><p>She was safe here, accepted,. Hell,people even gave her affection, both physical and kind words. There was also something mystical going on here... it might be smarter to get a better understanding of this mysterious party and the odd woman who claimed to have been involved with an incubus and believe in everything.</p><p>She couldn’t exactly ask questions but she could see more and overhear more in this form, people most likely willing to talk more freely among her wolf form than her human one.</p><p>But there was so much more unknown out there... What had become of Trevor? Of Ray? Was Zeke ok? What about that man who was trying to end the world?...</p><p>There were just too many questions. </p><p>So Sam hesitated... stuck in a quandary, on the edge of the woods. She didn’t know where to begin her search if  she DID go into the woods, which is what she thought she needed to do. Where should she go? What was she even looking for?</p><p>She looks up at the moon again and howls, long and lingering. </p>

Summer stares at Seth for a long moment. 

“This is getting too fucked up,” she says. “This entire night is fucked up.”

The problem is that of course he loves her. It’s probsbly beautiful and pure, it’s probsbly a cute story they can tell their grandchildren one day. The problem is that Sunmer’s future feels like a brick wall past the age of 18, and she doesn’t know if anyone would love her enough to bring her into that future.

She looks over at the welcome sight of Cora and Dawn as they slowly approach. 

“Okay, Chapel, I think it’s time to dance. We’re fucking teenagers for fuck’s sake. Teenagers at a fucking baccanal and we’re sitting here talking about feelings like a couple of virgins.”

She passes the joint back to him. 

“Cora this party is SICK,” she cries. “How many of these people know that the age of consent here is 16...and more importantly, how many of them even care?”

Dawn comes up on Seth and Summer, somewhat behind Cora, but when Cora stops she catches up. She feels a sudden pang of anxiety, but the feeling is quickly brushed aside. The lights and noise from the party now have a hold on her. 

She leans in close to Cora’s ear.

“Leave to moping to mister ‘it’s complicated’ over there”, she whispers, trying entice Cora out of her obvious funk, “Totally not worth spoiling a party over.”

“Who cares!”, she calls back to Summer, beckoning to the two of them, “These people know how to have fun.”

She kicks off her shoes, flinging them carelessly. She can feel the grass through Dawn’s toes. She looks up at the bright moon and lets out an ecstatic laugh, flinging her arms out at spinning around.

“I’m going to dance, until I drop. What are you two just going to do? Stand there looking miserable?”

She beckons again to the two sad-sacks, laughs, and then twirls off towards the masked party people.

column2: The moon sends her loving rays to caress Sam’s face.
Would that I could keep you safe, She whispers.
But I shall light your way nonetheless...

Suddenly, to Sam’s eyes, the forest becomes alive with the moon glow, and a glittering path of silver seems to lead the way.

“Sam?” Trish walks out of the clinic, following the wolf’s footsteps. “Where are you going?” She pauses for a moment. “...Can I come?”
The moon sends her loving rays to caress Sam’s face. </p><p>
Would that I could keep you safe, She whispers.

Suddenly, to Sam’s eyes, the forest becomes alive with the moon glow, and a glittering path of silver seems to lead the way.</p><p>“Sam?” Trish walks out of the clinic, following the wolf’s footsteps. “Where are you going?” She pauses for a moment. “...Can I come?”</p>

column1:
Sam stops walking and turns back to face Trish, blinking in surprise.

Trish wants to come? Sam would hve thought that she’d had enough adventure for one night and would gladly take the opportunity and time for some r and r and a ridiculously crazy party with probably someone who had really good kush?

She cocks her head in a confused questioning way and makes a small vocalization.

“Arurrr?” She starts low and then goes high in deliberate mimic if a questioning tone, as if ensuring Trish was set in her mind as she waged her tail in a friendly manner. “Are you sure?”

If she was determined to follow Sam then she really didn’t have the time or inclination to dissuade her. She had to leave now, she had already wasted too much time. It would be dangerous but, Trish knew that. She was the one that said the woods creeped her out before after all. 

Her change was surprising, but if this was what she wanted now... who was Sam to tell her what she could and couldn’t handle and what to do in general? No one, especially when Sam really didn’t have an idea about where they would end up now or what they would face.

All she could do was protect her the best she could. Honestly Sam was scared and any friendly face or offer of assistance especially from someone who currently had opposable thumbs was appreciated. She would rather not have to untie anyone with her teeth.

Sam waited for the explanation or confirmation or whatever Trish wanted to offer her in response to what she hoped she had made an obvious enough query.

Trish stares at Sam for a bit. She kind of wished that werewolves or whatever could at least talk, or become creepy Furry wet dream wolf men with working vocal chords. It would make all of this ten times easier.

“I’m going to take that as a yes,” she says finally. “Lead the way...if you even know where you’re going.”

It would make all of this ten times easier.</p><p>“I’m going to take that as a yes,” she says finally. “Lead the way...if you even know where you’re going.” </p>

Sam chuffs out a noise of affirmation and then starts off, following the trail as fast as she can go without losing Trish or being reckless.... She does not want Trish or her to get surprised by a buckshot in the side as they run. Sam works to keeps aware of her surroundings, determined not to have a repeat of before with Zeke happen.

The ground, dirt and grass and leaves beneath her paws, the smell of the woods, the full moon peeking through the trees. Despite the danger and the mission, the tightness in her back where the stitches stretched as she made her way and the general unpleasant weirdness of many of the events of the night, Sam can’t help but be happy and feel wild and free and at home in the woods.

Dawn spins off into the masked revellers, she dances with them, following a rhythm entirely of her own making, twirling and leaping with reckless abandon. The fox mask grabs her hand and spins her multiple times, before she dances away from him, unwilling to commit to a single partner.

She dances her way over to the antlered deer.

She stops spinning, and catches herself laughing, “I wanted to thank you  for helping me earlier”, she says studying the eyes behind the mask, “I just spazzed out for a second, but even so, I’m grateful.”

“Oh that wine smells delicious. Can I have some?”

Before Eve can answer, she extends her hand, “Will you dance with me?”

Seth is a bit stunned with how quickly the world comes crashing down on him. Did he ... just have a moment with Summer?

Whatever, maybe she's human. Evil human, though, definitely. But human, he guesses.

Cora, on the other hand, looks a bit worse than Seth does. He approaches her slowly.

""Oh, sweetie, did she ...?"" He puts an arm around her shoulder. ""Come on. Do you want to dance? Take your mind off it?""

He looks back at Summer and gives her a slight nod.

Eve looks at the wine, and then looks at Dawn’s outstretched hand. “I would love to,” she replies.

There’s something strange about Eve, it’s as though she’s a blank piece of paper that’s constsntly being written on. She takes Dawn’s hand, ready to dance.

Summer looks at Cora’s face and starts to walk, clapping Seth on the shoulder. She leans in close to whisper in his ear.

“Listen, take this last piece of advice from me, it’s advice I live by very seriously.”

Her eyes drift over to Cora.

“If you cant be with the one you love, honey...love the one you’re with.” 

With that, she gives him a light push towards Cora and grabs a shirtless man with the mask of a horse crowned with seaweed by the suspenders he’s wearing. 

“I’m liking what’s exposed,” she says coldly to him. “You’ll do. Toodles, nerds!”

And with that, Summer disappears into the crowd to dance with the bewildered man. In his defense, he’s used to being a never-ending party horse that drowns people, but Summer is a force that even he can’t reckon with.

Cora takes a moment to center herself.  The season... or month...whatever her name is, Queen Teflon is being nice.  Dawn is all the sudden the life of the party.  The sweet wolf pup, is gone.  And then there's Seth.  Part of her wants to smack the boy and storm off. She did just over hear him telling Queen Teflon that he was in love with some girl... and yet he was snuggled up in his bed with her maybe an hour prior.  Yet, who was she kidding, she just met this guy.... it's high school.   Her mum and Aunt would tell her to let loose, make a mistake or two.  She's far to young to be so serious.  And yet, she looks around this bohemian circus and thinks, someone has to be an adult here right?

She feels Seth arm around her, and it makes her tense up.  He's words seem sweet, he seems sweet, and he smells soothing, but she feels dirty being with him and yet comfortable at the same time.  She looks into those stupid dark eyes and finally process the words he was saying. ""Wha.. hum? Oh, umm Samcakes? Oh she's gone..."" Still processing she realizes what she just said and how her tone sounds distant and sad. ""WAIT! No I mean, she's fine, she's gone back to the woods.  My Aunt stitched her up.""  She takes a deep breath and slips Seths arm off her shoulder.  ""Shouldn't we, like help them?  Kyla, Tanner, and Mia.  Like was that a super natural vision of things to come, or something that happened, or someone or thing fucking with us?  Maybe I just need a drink or a magic mushroom or something.  I'm sure Charlie over there has some, pretty sure he runs on them.""  She points off toward a group of sitting in a circle holding hands and meditating.  ""Ugh I just need out of my own head. Fuck me!""  She says covering her face with her hands.  ""It's been one hell of a night, wouldn't you say?""

She takes Eve’s hand, smiles and  leads her to an open space. She can feel the wildness of the party as a buzz in the background, but she feels nothing from Eve. No expectations, feelings,  fears, or anxieties. Likewise, she pushes nothing onto Eve. She dances slowly with the other girl, and a zen-like peace slowly engulfing her.

“I feel weird… nothing…” she whispers to Eve in a small voice.

""Help them?"" Seth says. ""How? I don't ... If it's real, what can we do?""

He sighs. ""I'm not ... It comes and goes, sort of. Well, not really. I can always do things when I need to. But right now ... it costs more. Does that make sense?""

He's fairly sure it doesn't.

""It's just that, where should we go? We don't know where they are, we don't know who's with them. We really don't know anything."" He shrugs uselessly. ""Is there anything we can do?""

But Seth knows he needs to get back on his horse. Whether or not he can do anything about Kyla and Mia, he's not himself. Time to be yourself.

""Aside, I mean, from getting you out of your own head. Which I hear you have some suggestions for.""

Cora turns toward Seth.  He's not super good at this comforting thing is he?  But, he's kinda adorable for trying.  Boy might be just as broken as I am.   A good time might not be such a bad thing.  Queen B is partying it up, Dawn seems to be enjoying herself, and I'm never the one to sulk in a corner.  Fuck this, there's a party going on!  She smiles, shakes her head and wraps her arms around Seth's neck.  She leans in and kisses him gently on the cheek.  ""That's for your pathetic attempt to cheer me up.""

With her arms still around his neck she pulls herself closer to him ""So Wonder boy, pick your poison on how to get us out of this funk.  I'm sure there's a bunch of herbal remedies about, Eve was serving wine, and I know there's cheap whiskey in my room.  This may not be a succubus party but I can promise you Fae know how to party.""  She smiles and scrunches her nose.  It's nice to finally have someone to share my secret with.

Eve smiles and moves as close to Dawn as she dares. She can feel the strangeness, the chaotic confusion in this one. It reminds her so much of herself, before she met the person who helped her change all that. 

""It's not nothing,"" she says with a smile. ""It's an absence of everyone else. There's calm in that, even if at first it might seem scary. I learned a long time ago that in the nothing, there I am...""

""Pathetic is basically my core aesthetic,"" says Seth. ""It made you smile. So, worth it.""

The kiss on the cheek, of course, is the kiss of death. Except with this girl obviously nothing is as it seems.

He listens diligently to the options she proposes.

""You may not know this about me, but I'm something of a connoisseur of cheap whiskey. Like, the cheaper the better."" Then, afraid he'll sound like he's propositioning her again at the choice of the option in her room, and already having been called pathetic once in the last two minutes, he quickly adds, ""Could go grab it and sit outside, smoke if you want. It's a really nice night, and the cold air clears the head a bit.""

It's a really nice night, and the cold air clears the head a bit.""</p>

Eve’s words ring true for Dawn, away from the crowd and close to Eve, she does feel calm. It feels like people have been shouting at her — demanding her attention and empathy loudly and stridently — for as long as she can remember. The noise was so constant, that she only notices it by its absence. It’s like a loudspeaker, blaring white noise, has suddenly been switched off.

She relaxes, and sighs peacefully, placing her head on Eve’s shoulder, continuing to move to the rhythm, drawing Eve in close as a bulwark against a return of the noise.

But, even in the peace, a doubt slowly, starts to creep into the silence.

“What happens in the nothing”, she whispers, “If I find that the ‘me’ is an awful person?”

“What happens if I find that I’m not a person at all?”
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Eve’s words ring true for Dawn, away from the crowd and close to Eve, she does feel calm. It feels like people have been shouting at her — demanding her attention and empathy loudly and stridently — for as long as she can remember. The noise was so constant, that she only notices it by its absence. It’s like a loudspeaker, blaring white noise, has suddenly been switched off.</p><p>She relaxes, and sighs peacefully, placing her head on Eve’s shoulder, continuing to move to the rhythm, drawing Eve in close as a bulwark against a return of the noise.</p><p>But, even in the peace, a doubt slowly, starts to creep into the silence.</p><p>“What happens in the nothing”, she whispers, “If I find that the ‘me’ is an awful person?”</p><p>“What happens if I find that I’m not a person at all?”</p>

Red flushes to Eve’s cheeks for a moment, picking up what Dawn has definitely put down. She strokes Dawn’s hair distantly, before pulling back and giving her a sisterly smile. 

“There are no bad people,” she says. “There are only people. As for not being a person at all...there are many ways to be a person too, or so I’ve learned.”

It barely makes sense to Eve, but it’s all she has.

Dawn’s cheeks flush as Eve pulls away from her. Even though Eve is kind in her rejection, Dawn can’t help but feel humiliated. In truth, she’s not even really sure that she’s attracted to Eve. She desperately wants to be attracted to Eve, and she wants Eve to be attracted to her, but rather than an actual attraction to the masked girl, there’s a strange absence of feeling.

“I don’t know what I want”, she says her eyes apologizing, “I want to be something, but I don’t know what that is.”

She desperately wants to be attracted to Eve, and she wants Eve to be attracted to her, but rather than an actual attraction to the masked girl, there’s a strange absence of feeling.</p><p>“I don’t know what I want”, she says her eyes apologizing, “I want to be something, but I don’t know what that is.”</p>

Oh you stupid boy just kiss me already.  She looks up at the moon and realizes Seth is right.  It is a nice... no not nice, it beautiful.  It's a beautiful night out, yet in some way the moon looks uneasy.   She tilt her head and stares hoping it would just tell her whats wrong.  Why the night seems so perfect and yet so wrong.  Maybe tell her what the creepy JigSaw vision was all about.  She takes a deep breath and looks back into the stupid boys, big dark eyes.  Fuck it, if he's too shy, lord knows I'm shameless.

""Well, how about, you and I, go back to the house, grab a nice cheap bottle of whiskey, a big fuzzy blanket, and then we'll track down some pot from one of the druids chanting around the fire pit."" She smiles.  ""I mean I saw you're room it's probably only fair you see mine."" She mocks and leans in close to his ear. ""But, unlike you, I actually like sharing me bed... unless you'd prefer the floor."" She leaves a light kiss on his neck, then pulls away grabbing his hand and leading him toward the house.
dice roll

Eve reaches up and touches Dawn’s cheek.

“You’ll find it...I promise. I had to...learn it a strange way. It was a long road, but the first step is knowing that there is something different, so you’ve basically already started.”

She turns her head to look into the crowd, where Summer is plastered against the man she had grabbed earlier. The horse mask dangles from the hand she had thrown around his neck. His face visible, the man is actually ethereally beautiful. He whispers something in Summer’s ear.

“Looks like our poor cousin hasn’t,” Eve says.

“I don’t understand”, she admits, “but thank you”

She looks over to where Summer is dancing with the strangely beautiful man.

“She’s not my…” she starts to say, but stops, realising that she doesn’t really know for sure. She can feel some connection between herself and Summer, and maybe Eve feels that connection as well. Looking at the party from the sanctuary of calmness that surrounds herself and Eve, it feels weird and alien, maybe even threatening.

She doesn’t like the way that the horse-mask guy is looking at Summer, or the way she is looking back at him, and she feels that it’s more than just jealousy that’s making her worried.

“Is she alright? I mean, with that guy?”

Seth smiles, and pats his pockets. ""Hrm. Guess I got dressed in kind of a hurry.""

Then something occurs to him.

He pulls Cora back for a second and wraps an arm around her. For a moment, it seems like he's going to just hold her there, but he slips a hand into the pocket of the flannel shirt, and produces a joint from it.

""I wore that shirt this morning,"" he says, as if that were an explanation. ""We can leave out the druids and chant by ourselves, if you prefer.""

He nuzzles her neck gently, and then pushes her away, back towards the house, and follows her.

""Who? Eachann?"" She looks over at Summer. ""No, I think she'll be alright. He probably has more to fear from her than anyone, plus, he's a good horsie now, hasn't drowned any children in a century or so, but he can't seem to shake his love of seducing pretty young women.""

She looks around, and points at a group of hunched women by the bonfire. They don't wear animal masks, but their faces are shrouded in shadow. One of the women approaches the man in the fox mask and asks him to dance. In the firelight her face is heartbreakingly beautiful, a true wild Irish rose. 

The man refuses. 

""It's the sisters you need to look out for. I've been around these folk long enough to get an idea of what they are trying to do. I think they just want to be, it's just hard these days, with so little true believe going around...we're lucky in that way, I think.""

She looks back at Dawn, her eyes amused. ""You're taking all of this rather well, I think.""

Cora jumps slightly as Seth pulls her back in and slides a hand in her flannel shirt.  She blushes and smirks as he reveals a joint.  ""Well then, that's one thing to tick off the list.""  She takes his hand leading him toward the house. ""Now, I guess I'll teach you to chant.  It could be a rather long and tiring lesson.  Feeling up for it?""  She turns and looks back at him while she turns the door knob to the large double doors. 

They walk through the door to a large foyer with a slightly spiral stair case.  The room, currently, is mostly lite by candles, even though a large chandelier hangs from the ceiling.  The house smells of incense and pot. There are doorways on each side of the of foyer, one looks into what appears to be a hippy parlor.  There's a table with a crystal ball set up in the middle of the room.  The other room, is full of bean bag chairs, throw pillows, and bookshelves.  There are iron druid charms placed throughout the room.  

""Welcome to my Fairy favorite place."" She giggles. ""We aren't nearly as classy as you neck of the woods, but this place is a safe haven for any and all creatures who need it""  Her Aunts voice seems to project from her own mouth.  ""It's home."" A soft smile appears when she says the word home. My home.

She takes his hand and leads him up the staircase, her heart racing.  Am I really taking a boy up to my room?  This is going to end poorly.... it must end poorly!?  What am I doing?!  

They make their way down the hall to last door, and she swings it open.  ""Well this ones mine.  JUDGEMENT FREE ZONE, GOT IT!""  

She flicks the light switch on and walks over to her desk and picks up a bottle of Black Velvet whiskey. ""Second item ticked off.  You said you liked it cheap!""  She walks back over to Seth, pushes up on her toes and wraps an arm around his neck.  ""So, what was next, Mr. Chapel, fuzzy blanket, or teaching you to chant?""  She bites her lip and raises an eyebrow.  ""Suggestions?""

Taking it rather well.

She watches at the revels around her. The circle of calm that she and Eve are sharing now begins to feel like a barrier. A moment ago she was caught up in the abandon of the party, but now she feels like she’s watching from a distance. 

Taking it rather well.

Is exactly what she’d overheard her doctor say to her foster parents a little over a week ago.

I don’t remember anything. I had to look at my phone just to learn my name, and I’m trapped in this body, moving its arms and legs like a bad puppeteer just to get around.

And, to top it off, tonight she's had visions of human sacrifice, felt an animal being stabbed in its back as if it’s happening to her.

“Yeah, that’s me”, she replies absently, “taking it rather well.”

Eve's eyes turn serious as Dawn replies, and she takes the girl's hand. 

""What do you remember as a child?"" She's remarkably direct given her dreamy answers before. ""I have only met one other like us, and she wouldn't answer me. I don't remember anything, am I supposed to remember something? There had to have been something before..."" 

She turns her eyes to Summer. ""What does she remember?""

Seth looks around for a moment, at the still-packed boxes and milk crates. How long could she have been living here? Weeks? Months?

""No judgment, I like it. It's kind of cubist.""

Something is nagging at him. It's all just a little bit off. Just a little too easy. And, while this girl's vocabulary could easily be excused as a West Coast thing, or just knowing other people like them -- her aunt, did she say? or her mother? -- it's not sitting quite right.

He takes the whiskey from her and takes a swig. ""That,"" he says, ""is perfect. Perfectly awful. Top marks--"" and is about to call her by her last name, when he realizes he has no idea what it is, so he just ends it there, and puts down the bottle.

He's had quite a bit to drink. He's had quite an overwhelming day. He's been ditched by his date. And he's had quite enough of feeling like he's alone.

""I have a few suggestions,"" he says, pulling her in. He slides his oversized shirt down off her shoulders and moves to start undoing her dress. His eyes dart to the bed, and then back to her. ""It looks like you've got a big fuzzy blanket already. So maybe we can just chant right here.""

Cora blushes as the flannel slips off her shoulders and she feels Seth's hands run down her back.  She giggles as she can feel him searching for the zipper.  ""I'll give you $20"" she smirks ""If you can actually find the zipper on this thing.""  She pushes up on her toes and leans in close for a kiss, but out the corner of her eye she notices the door is still open, and instead quickly pulls away from Seth. She rushes to the door and quickly shuts and locks it. 

""Sorry,"" she giggles.  ""Here are the Embers Estate, you never know who or what will wander in.  There's a Kelpie outside, the one dancing with the MeanGirl... whats her face.  Anyway, like last week I found him curled up on the floor by my bed.  Waking up to a horse man in your room... little freaky.  But, he just wants love and attention, really a sweetheart.  It's been a weird two weeks, but I think I'm starting to like it here.""  She walks back over letting the flannel fall to the ground, and sneaks back into Seth's arms.  ""So, where were we?  Fuzzy blanket, check.  Oh yeah, find the zipper, and get a prize.""  She bite her lip and leans in, placing a soft kiss on Seth's lips. ""I'll even let you pick the prize.""

She rushes to the door and quickly shuts and locks it. </p><p>""Sorry,"" she giggles.  ""Here are the Embers Estate, you never know who or what will wander in.  There's a Kelpie outside, the one dancing with the MeanGirl... whats her face.  Anyway, like last week I found him curled up on the floor by my bed.  Waking up to a horse man in your room... little freaky.  But, he just wants love and attention, really a sweetheart.  It's been a weird two weeks, but I think I'm starting to like it here.""  She walks back over letting the flannel fall to the ground, and sneaks back into Seth's arms.  ""So, where were we?  Fuzzy blanket, check.  Oh yeah, find the zipper, and get a prize.""  She bite her lip and leans in, placing a soft kiss on Seth's lips. ""I'll even let you pick the prize.""  </p>

""A kelpie?""

Wait, not the dog.

""Wow. Summer is dancing with a horse? She is crashing and burning pretty hard from this Andrew rejection if she's going with some Catherine the Great shit.""

He feels a little mean saying it. But it's not like they're friends or anything. She would do the same thing to him without even feeling bad about it.

He pulls her in, and kisses her. It's simultaneously exactly right, and exactly wrong.

Without letting go of her, without interrupting the kiss, he guides her slowly back to the bed. Leaning her back, he fumbles about for a few minutes. He chatters sort of aimlessly, vaguely charmingly, as he does.

""You know, there are those who have said that I have no drive, no follow-through. That I need to apply myself."" Not in all the usual places, but this is hardly the first time Seth has gone to undress a girl wearing an odd garment. ""You know, like my dad, my math teacher, my math teacher last year, my fourth grade teacher ..."" He chuckles. ""But I can be highly persistent when properly motivated ...""

He finds what he's looking for.

""Ha!"" he says, triumphantly but softly. ""Looks like I get a prize. I choose ..."" He waggles his eyebrows. ""The money. After all, 20 bucks is 20 bucks.""

He pushes her back onto the bed and climbs in with her.
